paras.en: I know I'm not an ordinary ten-year-old kid. I mean, sure, I do ordinary things. I eat ice cream. I ride my bike. I play ball. I have an XBox. Stuff like that makes me ordinary. I guess. And I feel ordinary. Inside. But I know ordinary kids don't make other ordinary kids run away screaming in playgrounds. I know ordinary kids don't get stared at wherever they go.
paras.cn: 我知道我不是一个普通的十岁小孩。我的意思是，当然，我也会做普通的事情。我吃冰淇淋，骑自行车，打球，我有一个XBox游戏机。像那样的事情让我变得普通，我猜。而且我内心感觉自己是普通的。但是我知道普通的小孩不会让其他普通的小孩在操场上尖叫着跑开。我知道普通的小孩无论走到哪里都不会被人盯着看。

vocab.ex: I know I'm not an ordinary ten-year-old kid.
Stuff like that makes me ordinary.
Other ordinary kids run away screaming in playgrounds.
I know ordinary kids don't get stared at wherever they go.
Kids run away screaming in playgrounds.
He was screaming loudly during the game.

gram.name: 话语标记（让步与不确定）
gram.function: 用于使对话听起来更自然、更口语化。'I mean' 用来澄清或解释前面的话。'sure' 表示让步，承认某一点。'I guess' 表示不确定或犹豫。

example.en: I mean, it's a good movie, I guess, but it's a bit too long.
example.cn: 我的意思是，这部电影不错，我猜，但就是有点太长了。

gram.constraints: 这些短语在正式写作中应谨慎使用，但在描述个人想法或对话时非常常见。

gram.name: 一般现在时
gram.pattern: Subject + base Verb (+ s/es for third person)
gram.function: 描述习惯、事实或普遍真理。例如 'I eat ice cream.' 表示平常做的事情。

example.en: She goes to school every day.
example.cn: 她每天上学。

gram.constraints: 第三人称单数动词需要加 s/es。

gram.name: 情态动词 can
gram.function: 表示能力、可能性。例如 'I know ordinary kids don't make other ordinary kids run away screaming' 表示普通孩子不会造成这种结果。

example.en: I can ride my bike.
example.cn: 我会骑自行车。

gram.constraints: 情态动词后动词必须用原形。

gram.name: 一般现在时否定形式
gram.function: 表示否定。例如 'ordinary kids don't get stared at' 表示普通孩子不会被盯着看。

example.en: He doesn't like chocolate.
example.cn: 他不喜欢巧克力。

gram.constraints: 第三人称单数用 does not，其余用 do not。

gram.name: 副词作状语（inside）
gram.function: 表示状态或方式。例如 'I feel ordinary. Inside.' 强调内心的感觉。

example.en: He smiled happily inside.
example.cn: 他内心开心地微笑。

gram.constraints: 通常放在句末或修饰谓语动词。

gram.name: 转折连词 (and yet)
gram.function: 表示与前句形成对比或出乎意料的情况。例如 'And yet, he faced an early setback.'

example.en: I was tired, and yet I kept working.
example.cn: 我很累，但我仍然继续工作。

gram.constraints: 通常放在句首，后面加逗号。

paras.en: If I found a magic lamp and I could have one wish, I would wish that I had a normal face that no one ever noticed at all. I would wish that I could walk down the street without people seeing me and then doing that look-away thing. Here's what I think: the only reason I'm not ordinary is that no one else sees me that way.
paras.cn: 如果我找到一个神灯并且能许一个愿，我会希望我有一张正常的、完全不会被人注意到的脸。我会希望我能走在街上，而人们不会看到我后又做出那种移开视线的动作。我的想法是这样的：我之所以不普通，唯一的原因是没有人那样看待我。

vocab.ex: He found a magic lamp and rubbed it.
I wish I could travel more often.
Did you notice he was wearing a new watch?

vocab.mean: 移开目光（那种尴尬动作）
vocab.ex: He did that awkward look-away thing when I tried to talk to him.
She felt like an ordinary person in a crowd.

gram.name: 第二条件句
gram.function: 用于描述与现在或将来事实相反的、不可能或极不可能发生的假设情况及其可能的结果。此处用于表达一个不切实际的愿望。

example.en: If I had a million dollars, I would buy a house.
example.cn: 如果我有一百万美元，我就会买一栋房子。

gram.constraints: 条件从句用一般过去时（be动词通常用were），主句用'would/could/should/might + 动词原形'。

paras.en: But I'm kind of used to how I look by now. I know how to pretend I don't see the faces people make. We've all gotten pretty good at that sort of thing: me, Mom and Dad, Via. Actually, I take that back: Via's not so good at it. She can get really annoyed when people do something rude. Like, for instance, one time in the playground some older kids made some noises. I don't even know what the noises were exactly because I didn't hear them myself, but Via heard and she just started yelling at the kids. That's the way she is. I'm not that way.
paras.cn: 但我现在对我自己的长相算是有点习惯了。我知道如何假装没看见人们做出的表情。我们都变得挺擅长那种事了：我、妈妈、爸爸，还有维娅。其实，我收回那句话：维娅并不那么擅长。当别人做一些无礼的事情时，她会变得非常恼火。比如，有一次在操场上，一些大孩子发出了一些怪声。我甚至不知道那具体是什么声音，因为我自己没听到，但是维娅听到了，她就开始对那些孩子大喊大叫。她就是那样的。我不是那样的。

vocab.ex: I'm used to waking up early every day.
I'm kind of tired today.
She pretended to be asleep.
He was annoyed by the loud noise.
It's rude to interrupt someone when they're talking.
She was yelling at the kids to stop.
Some people, for instance, enjoy hiking on weekends.

gram.name: be used to 结构
gram.function: 表示“习惯于”某个状态或动作。在此句 'I'm kind of used to how I look' 中，后面跟的是一个由 'how' 引导的名词性从句。

example.en: He is used to the cold weather.
example.cn: 他习惯了寒冷的天气。

gram.constraints: 注意与表示过去习惯的 'used to + 动词原形' 区分开。'to' 在这里是介词。

gram.name: 现在完成时 (have/has + past participle)
gram.function: 表示动作发生在过去并与现在相关，或经历。例如 'We've all gotten pretty good at that sort of thing.' 表示经历了练习而变得熟练。

example.en: I have finished my homework.
example.cn: 我已经完成了作业。

gram.constraints: 助动词与主语保持一致（have/has），过去分词形式不可省略。

gram.name: 名词性从句作宾语
gram.function: 作动词的宾语，说明动作的内容。例如 'I know how to pretend I don't see the faces people make.'

example.en: I know that he is telling the truth.
example.cn: 我知道他在说实话。

gram.constraints: 从句可由 that 或 wh-引导，作动词宾语。

gram.name: 不定式作宾语 / 补语
gram.function: 作动词的宾语或补语，说明动作目的或方式。例如 'I know how to pretend' 中 'to pretend' 表示动作内容。

example.en: I want to go home.
example.cn: 我想回家。

gram.constraints: to + 动词原形，不定式作宾语或补语。

gram.name: 转折与对比 (like, actually, for instance)
gram.function: 表示对比、举例或修正前文。例如 'Actually, I take that back: Via's not so good at it.' 'Like, for instance, one time...' 用于补充说明或举例。

example.en: Actually, I changed my mind.
example.cn: 实际上，我改变了主意。

gram.constraints: 可置于句首或句中，常加逗号。

gram.name: 短语动词 (run away, start yelling, take back)

components.role: 副词或介词构成短语动词

gram.function: 表达具体动作或状态，通常是口语化。例如 'run away screaming', 'start yelling', 'take that back' 表示行为或撤回前言。

example.en: He ran away screaming.
example.cn: 他尖叫着跑开了。

gram.constraints: 动词和小品词一起构成不可分割的意义，有时可分开加宾语。

gram.name: 限定性/非限定性定语从句 (who/which)
gram.function: 修饰名词，提供必要或附加信息。例如 'the kids who made some noises' 修饰 'kids'。

example.en: The girl who is singing is my sister.
example.cn: 正在唱歌的女孩是我妹妹。

gram.constraints: 限定性从句无需逗号，非限定性需用逗号。

paras.en: Via doesn't see me as ordinary. She says she does, but if I were ordinary, she wouldn't feel like she needs to protect me as much. And Mom and Dad don't see me as ordinary, either. They see me as extraordinary. I think the only person in the world who realizes how ordinary I am is me.
paras.cn: 维娅不认为我是普通的。她说她认为是，但如果我是普通的，她就不会觉得需要那么保护我。妈妈和爸爸也不认为我是普通的。他们认为我是非凡的。我想，世界上唯一意识到我有多普通的人，只有我自己。

vocab.ex: It's a parent's job to protect their child.
She told an extraordinary story about her travels.
He didn't realize his mistake until it was too late.

gram.name: see... as... 结构
gram.function: 表示“将…看作…”或“认为…是…”，用于表达某人对另一人或事物的看法或观念。这个结构在段落中被反复使用以对比不同角色的视角。

example.en: Many people see him as a hero.
example.cn: 许多人将他视作英雄。

gram.constraints: 这是一个表达观点和认知的常用句型。

gram.name: 一般现在时否定形式 (doesn't / don't)
gram.function: 表示否定。例如 'Via doesn't see me as ordinary' 表示 Via 不认为我普通。

example.en: He doesn't like chocolate.
example.cn: 他不喜欢巧克力。

gram.constraints: 第三人称单数用 does not，其余用 do not。

gram.name: 与现在事实相反的假设 (Second Conditional)
gram.function: 表示与现在事实相反的假设。例如 'if I were ordinary, she wouldn't feel like she needs to protect me' 表示我并非普通孩子的假设情况。

example.en: If I were rich, I would travel the world.
example.cn: 如果我有钱，我会环游世界。

gram.constraints: 条件句中用过去时表示与现在事实相反，主句用 would/could/might。

gram.name: 限定性定语从句 (who)
gram.function: 修饰名词，提供必要信息。例如 'the only person in the world who realizes how ordinary I am' 修饰 'person'。

example.en: The man who lives next door is a doctor.
example.cn: 住在隔壁的那个男人是医生。

gram.constraints: 限定性从句无需逗号。

gram.name: 并列连词 (and / but / either)
gram.function: 'and' 用于连接并列动作或描述，'but' 表示转折，'either' 用于强调否定或补充。例如 'Mom and Dad don't see me as ordinary, either' 表示补充信息。

example.en: She likes tea, and he likes coffee.
example.cn: 她喜欢茶，他喜欢咖啡。

gram.constraints: 连接两个语法独立的句子或分句。

paras.en: My name is August, by the way. I won't describe what I look like. Whatever you're thinking, it's probably worse.
paras.cn: 顺便说一下，我叫奥古斯特。我不会描述我长什么样。无论你在想什么，可能都比那更糟。

vocab.ex: By the way, did you finish your homework?
Can you describe the man you saw?
Whatever you decide to do, I'll support you.

title: Why I Didn't Go to School

paras.en: Next week I start fifth grade. Since I've never been to a real school before, I am pretty much totally and completely petrified. People think I haven't gone to school because of the way I look, but it's not that. It's because of all the surgeries I've had. Twenty-seven since I was born. The bigger ones happened before I was even four years old, so I don't remember those. But I've had two or three surgeries every year since then (some big, some small), and because I'm little for my age, and I have some other medical mysteries that doctors never really figured out, I used to get sick a lot. That's why my parents decided it was better if I didn't go to school. I'm much stronger now, though. The last surgery I had was eight months ago, and I probably won't have to have any more for another couple of years.
paras.cn: 下周我就要上五年级了。因为我以前从未上过真正的学校，所以我差不多完全、彻底地吓呆了。人们认为我没去上学是因为我的长相，但不是那样的。这是因为我做过的所有手术。从我出生起就有二十七次了。大的那些手术在我还不到四岁时就发生了，所以我不记得那些。但从那以后我每年都要做两三次手术（有些大的，有些小的），而且因为我比同龄人小，还有一些医生一直没搞明白的医学谜团，我过去经常生病。那就是为什么我父母决定如果我不去上学可能会更好。不过，我现在强壮多了。我上一次手术是在八个月前，而且可能在未来几年内都不需要再做任何手术了。

vocab.ex: Next year, she will start fifth grade.
I was petrified during the thunderstorm.
He had to undergo surgery after the accident.

vocab.mean: 医学上的未解之谜；不明病因
vocab.ex: Doctors are still trying to understand these medical mysteries.
She's very tall for her age.
I used to get sick a lot when I was a child.

gram.name: 副词强化语
gram.function: 使用多个副词（'pretty much', 'totally', 'completely'）来逐步加强形容词 'petrified' 的程度，生动地表达出极度的恐惧感，这是一种口语化的强调方式。

example.en: The cake was almost completely gone.
example.cn: 那个蛋糕几乎完全没了。

gram.constraints: 常用于非正式的口语和写作中以加强语气。

gram.name: 现在完成时与since
gram.pattern: Present Perfect + since + point in time
gram.function: 表示一个从过去某个时间点开始并持续到现在的动作或状态。'I've had twenty-seven [surgeries] since I was born' 强调了从出生到现在手术的总数。

example.en: I have lived here since 2010.
example.cn: 我从2010年起就住在这里。

gram.constraints: since后面跟的是一个过去的时间点或一个描述过去动作的从句。

gram.name: 一般现在时表示将来
gram.function: 用于表示固定安排或时间表。例如 'Next week I start fifth grade.'

example.en: The train leaves at 8 o'clock.
example.cn: 火车在八点开。

gram.constraints: 通常与时间状语连用表示将来。

gram.name: 现在完成时 (have/has + past participle)
gram.function: 表示过去发生的动作对现在有影响或经历。例如 'I've never been to a real school before.'

example.en: I have finished my homework.
example.cn: 我已经完成作业。

variants: never, already, yet 常用副词搭配
gram.constraints: 助动词与主语一致，过去分词形式不可省略。

gram.name: 时间原因连词 (since / because)
gram.function: 表示原因或起点时间。例如 'Since I've never been to a real school before...' 和 'because of all the surgeries I've had.'

example.en: I stayed home because it was raining.
example.cn: 因为下雨，我待在家里。

gram.constraints: 从句可位于句首或句中，句首用逗号隔开。

gram.name: 副词修饰 (totally / completely / pretty much)
gram.function: 用于强调形容词或副词的程度。例如 'totally and completely petrified' 表示极度害怕。

example.en: She was completely exhausted.
example.cn: 她完全累垮了。

gram.constraints: 可用于形容词或副词前，增强语气。

gram.name: 限定性定语从句 (who/which)
gram.function: 修饰名词，提供必要信息。例如 'doctors never really figured out' 修饰 'medical mysteries'。

example.en: The doctor who treated me was very kind.
example.cn: 给我治疗的医生很亲切。

gram.constraints: 限定性从句无需逗号，非限定性需用逗号。

gram.name: 过去持续/重复动作 (used to / would + Verb)
gram.function: 表示过去经常发生的动作或状态。例如 'I used to get sick a lot.' 表示过去经常生病。

example.en: I used to play basketball every weekend.
example.cn: 我过去每个周末都打篮球。

gram.constraints: 表示过去习惯，现已不再发生或情况改变。

paras.en: Mom homeschools me. She used to be a children's-book illustrator. She draws really great fairies and mermaids. Her boy stuff isn't so hot, though. She once tried to draw me a Darth Vader, but it ended up looking like some weird mushroom-shaped robot. I haven't seen her draw anything in a long time. I think she's too busy taking care of me and Via.
paras.cn: 妈妈在家教我。她曾经是一名儿童读物插画家。她画的仙女和美人鱼非常棒。不过，她画的男孩类的东西就不怎么样了。有一次她试着给我画一个达斯·维达，但结果画得像个奇怪的蘑菇形机器人。我已经很久没见过她画任何东西了。我想她太忙于照顾我和维娅了。

vocab.mean: 在家上学；由家长教育孩子
vocab.ex: Mom homeschools me instead of sending me to public school.
She used to be a children's-book illustrator.
She draws really great fairies.
Her illustrations include fairies and mermaids.

vocab.mean: 《星球大战》中的达斯·维达（人物名）
vocab.ex: She once tried to draw me a Darth Vader.
The robot ended up looking like some weird mushroom-shaped robot.
Her boy stuff isn't so hot, though.
It ended up looking like some weird robot.

gram.name: used to 与一般过去时
gram.function: 区分过去的行为。'She used to be an illustrator' 描述了她过去长期的职业状态（现在不是了）。'She once tried to draw' 描述了过去发生的一次性具体事件。

example.en: He used to live in Paris, but he visited London once.
example.cn: 他过去住在巴黎，但他去过一次伦敦。

gram.constraints: 'used to' 强调与现在的对比，而一般过去时只陈述过去发生的事。

gram.name: too... to... 结构（隐含）
gram.pattern: too + adj/adv + (for someone) + to do something
gram.function: 表示程度太高以至于无法做某事。在句子 'I think she's too busy taking care of me and Via' 中，虽然没有 'to draw'，但上下文（'I haven't seen her draw...'）暗示了完整的意思：'she's too busy... to draw anything.'

example.en: He is too tired to continue working.
example.cn: 他太累了，无法继续工作了。

gram.constraints: 该结构本身带有否定含义。

paras.en: I can't say I always wanted to go to school because that wouldn't be exactly true. What I wanted was to go to school, but only if I could be like every other kid going to school. Have lots of friends and hang out after school and stuff like that.
paras.cn: 我不能说我一直都想去上学，因为那不完全是真的。我想要的是去上学，但前提是我能像其他每个上学的孩子一样。有很多朋友，放学后一起玩，诸如此类的事情。

vocab.ex: That wouldn't be exactly true.
I wanted to go to school, but only if I could be like every other kid.
We used to hang out after school.

gram.name: 强调句型 (What... is/was...)
gram.function: 用于强调句子中的某个特定部分，通常是动作的对象或内容。'What I wanted was to go to school...' 强调了他真正想要的“东西”是“去上学”这个行为。

example.en: What I need is a long vacation.
example.cn: 我需要的是一个长假。

gram.constraints: 由 'what' 引导的主语从句充当句子的主语。

gram.name: 情态动词 + say 表达限制或否定
gram.function: 表示说话者对某事持否定或限制性的态度，例如 'I can't say I always wanted to go to school' 意为“我不能说我一直想去上学”。

example.en: I can't say I agree with you completely.
example.cn: 我不能说我完全同意你。

gram.constraints: 从句通常紧随 say 之后，表达具体内容。

gram.name: 条件状语从句 (only if)
gram.function: 用于表示条件限制，强调只有在特定条件下主句才成立。例如 'but only if I could be like every other kid going to school'。

example.en: I will go, only if you come with me.
example.cn: 我会去，前提是你跟我一起去。

gram.constraints: only if 引导的从句通常放在主句之后或句首。

gram.name: 并列结构 (and) 表列举
gram.function: 表示动作或事物并列，例如 'Have lots of friends and hang out after school' 中，两个动作并列列举。

example.en: She likes reading and writing.
example.cn: 她喜欢阅读和写作。

gram.constraints: 并列项通常保持语法一致。

paras.en: I have a few really good friends now. Christopher is my best friend, followed by Zachary and Alex. We've known each other since we were babies. And since they've always known me the way I am, they're used to me. When we were little, we used to have playdates all the time, but then Christopher moved to Bridgeport in Connecticut. That's more than an hour away from where I live in North River Heights, which is at the top tip of Manhattan. And Zachary and Alex started going to school. It's funny: even though Christopher's the one who moved far away, I still see him more than I see Zachary and Alex. They have all these new friends now. If we bump into each other on the street, they're still nice to me, though. They always say hello.
paras.cn: 我现在有几个非常好的朋友。克里斯托弗是我最好的朋友，其次是扎卡里和亚历克斯。我们从婴儿时期就认识了。而且因为他们一直都知道我本来的样子，所以他们习惯了我。我们小的时候，过去总是一起玩，但后来克里斯托弗搬到了康涅狄格州的布里奇波特。那地方离我住的北河高地有一个多小时的路程，那里在曼哈顿的最顶端。扎卡里和亚历克斯也开始上学了。有趣的是：尽管搬到远处的是克里斯托弗，我见他的次数仍然比见扎卡里和亚历克斯的次数多。他们现在都有了这些新朋友。不过，如果我们在街上偶然碰到，他们对我还是很好的。他们总是会打招呼。

vocab.ex: Christopher is my best friend, followed by Zachary and Alex.
We used to have playdates all the time.
If we bump into each other on the street, they're still nice.
They're still nice to me, though.

gram.name: 句末副词 though
gram.function: 放在句末，作用相当于 'however' 或 'but'，用于引出与前文形成对比或转折的信息。这是一种非常口语化的用法。

example.en: It's a difficult job. I enjoy it, though.
example.cn: 这工作很难。不过，我喜欢它。

gram.constraints: 通常用逗号与主句隔开，只能放在句末。

gram.name: 非限定性定语从句
gram.function: 用于提供关于先行词 'North River Heights' 的额外、非必要信息。它与主句用逗号隔开。

example.en: We visited the museum, which was very interesting.
example.cn: 我们参观了博物馆，那非常有趣。

gram.constraints: 必须用逗号与主句隔开，不能使用关系代词 'that'。

gram.name: 现在完成时 + since 表示起点
gram.function: 表示从过去某一时间开始一直延续到现在。例如 'We've known each other since we were babies.'

example.en: I have lived here since 2010.
example.cn: 我从2010年开始住在这里。

gram.constraints: since 后面跟具体时间点或时间状语从句。

gram.name: 过去习惯 (used to)
gram.function: 表示过去经常做但现在不再做的动作。例如 'we used to have playdates all the time.'

example.en: I used to play basketball every weekend.
example.cn: 我过去每个周末都打篮球。

gram.constraints: 仅用于表示过去的习惯性动作或状态。

gram.name: 限定性定语从句 (which)
gram.function: 修饰名词，提供必要信息。例如 'North River Heights, which is at the top tip of Manhattan'。

example.en: The house which has a red door is mine.
example.cn: 有红门的那栋房子是我的。

gram.constraints: 限定性从句可不加逗号，非限定性需用逗号。

gram.name: 让步状语从句 (even though)
gram.function: 表示让步，即尽管…，仍…。例如 'even though Christopher's the one who moved far away, I still see him more.'

example.en: Even though it was raining, we went out.
example.cn: 尽管下雨，我们还是出去了。

gram.constraints: 从句可位于句首或句中，逗号可选。

gram.name: 一般现在时表示习惯或事实
gram.function: 表示经常性动作或一般事实。例如 'They always say hello.'

example.en: She goes to school every day.
example.cn: 她每天上学。

gram.constraints: 用于一般事实、习惯动作或规律事件。

paras.en: I have other friends, too, but not as good as Christopher and Zack and Alex were. For instance, Zack and Alex always invited me to their birthday parties when we were little, but Joel and Eamonn and Gabe never did. Emma invited me once, but I haven't seen her in a long time. And, of course, I always go to Christopher's birthday. Maybe I'm making too big a deal about birthday parties.
paras.cn: 我也有其他朋友，但不如克里斯托弗、扎克和亚历克斯那么好。例如，我们小的时候，扎克和亚历克斯总是邀请我参加他们的生日派对，但乔尔、伊蒙和盖博从来没有。艾玛邀请过我一次，但我已经很久没见到她了。当然，我总是去参加克里斯托弗的生日。也许我把生日派对这事看得太重了。

vocab.ex: I have other friends, but not as good as Christopher was.
For instance, Zack and Alex always invited me.

vocab.mean: 对…小题大做；把…看得太重
vocab.ex: Maybe I'm making too big a deal about birthday parties.

gram.name: 同级比较结构 (as... as...)
gram.function: 用于比较两者在某方面是否相同。其否定形式 'not as... as...' 表示“不如…”，用于说明两者之间的差距。

example.en: This book is not as interesting as the last one.
example.cn: 这本书不如上一本有趣。

gram.constraints: 中间必须使用形容词或副词的原级。

gram.name: 并列连词 but
gram.function: 用于连接相反或对比的观点，例如 'I have other friends, too, but not as good as Christopher…'。

example.en: I wanted to go, but I was too tired.
example.cn: 我想去，但我太累了。

gram.constraints: 连接两个独立句子，前面通常加逗号。

gram.name: 一般过去时
gram.function: 表示过去发生的动作或状态，例如 'Zack and Alex always invited me to their birthday parties.'

example.en: I watched a movie yesterday.
example.cn: 我昨天看了一部电影。

gram.constraints: 表示过去动作，通常有时间状语。

gram.name: 现在完成时
gram.function: 表示过去发生的动作对现在有影响，例如 'I haven't seen her in a long time.'

example.en: I have finished my homework.
example.cn: 我已经完成作业。

variants: never, already, yet 可搭配使用
gram.constraints: 助动词与主语一致，过去分词不可省略。

gram.name: 情态动词表示推测 (maybe)
gram.function: 表示说话人的推测或不确定性，例如 'Maybe I'm making too big a deal about birthday parties.'

example.en: Maybe it will rain tomorrow.
example.cn: 也许明天会下雨。

gram.constraints: 通常位于句首，可与逗号分开。

paras.en: I like when Mom tells this story because it makes me laugh so much. It's not funny in the way a joke is funny, but when Mom tells it, Via and I just start cracking up. So when I was in my mom's stomach, no one had any idea I would come out looking the way I look. Mom had had Via four years before, and that had been such a "walk in the park" (Mom's expression) that there was no reason to run any special tests. About two months before I was born, the doctors realized there was something wrong with my face, but they didn't think it was going to be bad. They told Mom and Dad I had a cleft palate and some other stuff going on. They called it "small anomalies."
paras.cn: 我喜欢妈妈讲这个故事，因为它总让我笑得不行。它不像笑话那样好笑，但是当妈妈讲的时候，维娅和我就开始笑得前仰后合。所以当我在妈妈肚子里的时候，没人知道我生出来会长成我现在的样子。妈妈在四年前生了维娅，那次经历简直是“小菜一碟”（妈妈的说法），所以没有理由去做任何特别的检查。在我出生前大约两个月，医生们意识到我的脸有问题，但他们不认为会很糟糕。他们告诉爸爸妈妈我患有腭裂，还有些其他问题。他们称之为“微小异常”。

vocab.ex: Via and I just start cracking up.
That had been such a "walk in the park".
They told Mom and Dad I had a cleft palate.
They called it "small anomalies."

vocab.mean: 裂缝；裂口；（尤指人中或下巴的）凹陷
vocab.ex: He had a small cleft in his chin that made his smile unique.
He was born with a cleft palate and needed surgery as a baby.

gram.name: 过去完成时
gram.function: 表示在过去某个时间点或动作之前已经完成的动作。'Mom had had Via four years before' 指的是在“我出生”这个过去的事件之前，妈妈已经生了维娅。

example.en: When I arrived, the party had already started.
example.cn: 我到达时，派对已经开始了。

gram.constraints: 通常与一个表示过去时间点的状语（如 'before'）或另一个过去时的动作连用，以表明动作的先后顺序。

gram.name: 间接引语和直接引语
gram.pattern: Quotation marks "..." and expressions like '(Mom's expression)'
gram.function: 用于引用他人的原话或特定的表达。引号内的 "walk in the park" 和 "small anomalies" 直接引用了他人的用词，而 '(Mom's expression)' 则是叙述者对此的解释。

example.en: She said, "I'll be there soon."
example.cn: 她说：“我很快就到。”

gram.constraints: 引用的内容需要准确无误。

gram.name: 名词性从句作宾语
gram.function: 名词性从句在句中作宾语，说明动词的内容。例如 'I like when Mom tells this story' 中，'when Mom tells this story' 是动词 like 的宾语。

example.en: I remember when we first met.
example.cn: 我记得我们第一次见面的时候。

gram.constraints: 从句在句中充当宾语；when/that 等连接词不可省略。

gram.name: the way 引导的比较结构
gram.function: 用于表达“……的方式”。在 'looking the way I look' 中，'the way I look' 表示“我看起来的样子”。

example.en: I love the way you smile.
example.cn: 我喜欢你微笑的样子。

gram.constraints: the way 后面从句一般省略 that。

gram.name: 否定比较结构 not ... in the way ...
gram.function: 用于表达“不像……那样”。例如 'It's not funny in the way a joke is funny.' 意为“这并不是像笑话那样好笑”。

example.en: It’s not scary in the way horror movies are scary.
example.cn: 它并不是像恐怖电影那样吓人。

gram.constraints: 后面的从句一般省略主语重复部分。

gram.name: 过去完成时 + 一般过去时
gram.function: 过去完成时用于表示在过去某一时间之前已经发生的动作。例如 'Mom had had Via four years before' 表示“在我出生前四年，妈妈已经生了姐姐”。

example.en: I had eaten dinner before you called.
example.cn: 在你打电话之前我已经吃过晚饭了。

gram.constraints: 常与 before, after, already 连用。

gram.name: 过去进行与预测结构

components.role: 补充说明未来或假设的句子

gram.function: 用于叙述当时进行中的情境或他人预期的情况，例如 'the doctors realized there was something wrong with my face, but they didn’t think it was going to be bad.'

example.en: We were hoping it would be easy.
example.cn: 我们当时希望这会很容易。

gram.constraints: was/were + going to + Verb 常表示“当时原本打算/预计”。

paras.en: There were two nurses in the delivery room the night I was born. One was very nice and sweet. The other one, Mom said, did not seem at all nice or sweet. She had very big arms and (here comes the funny part), she kept farting. Like, she'd bring Mom some ice chips, and then fart. She'd check Mom's blood pressure, and fart. Mom says it was unbelievable because the nurse never even said excuse me! Meanwhile, Mom's regular doctor wasn't on duty that night, so Mom got stuck with this cranky kid doctor she and Dad nicknamed Doogie after some old TV show or something (they didn't actually call him that to his face). But Mom says that even though everyone in the room was kind of grumpy, Dad kept making her laugh all night long.
paras.cn: 我出生的那个晚上，产房里有两位护士。一位非常友善甜美。另一位，妈妈说，看起来一点也不友善或甜美。她有很粗壮的手臂，而且（好笑的部分来了），她不停地放屁。比如，她会给妈妈拿些冰块，然后放个屁。她会量妈妈的血压，然后放个屁。妈妈说这简直难以置信，因为那个护士甚至从来没说过“对不起”！与此同时，妈妈的常规医生那晚不值班，所以妈妈碰上了一个脾气暴躁的年轻医生，她和爸爸根据某个老电视剧什么的给他起了个外号叫“杜基”（他们并没有当着他的面这么叫他）。但妈妈说，尽管房间里的每个人都有点暴躁，爸爸却整晚不停地逗她笑。

vocab.ex: There were two nurses in the delivery room.
She kept farting.
Mom got stuck with this cranky kid doctor.
Everyone in the room was kind of grumpy.
One nurse was very nice and sweet.
Mom's regular doctor wasn't on duty that night.
Dad kept making her laugh all night long.
She'd check Mom's blood pressure, and fart.

vocab.mean: 被迫应付；不得不处理（不太喜欢的人或事）
vocab.ex: Mom got stuck with this cranky kid doctor.
They nicknamed the doctor Doogie after some old TV show.

gram.name: 使用'would'表示过去习惯
gram.function: 用于描述过去反复发生的习惯性动作，常带有讲故事的色彩。'she'd bring Mom some ice chips... She'd check Mom's blood pressure...' 描述了护士在那晚反复做的动作。

example.en: Every summer, we'd go to the beach.
example.cn: 每年夏天，我们都会去海滩。

gram.constraints: 'would'不能用于描述过去的状态，只能用于描述动作。

gram.name: 插入语
gram.function: 使用括号来插入补充信息、解释或旁白，而不会打断主句的流程。例如 '(here comes the funny part)' 和 '(they didn't actually call him that to his face)' 都是叙述者添加的旁注。

example.en: He finally answered (after taking five minutes to think).
example.cn: 他终于回答了（在想了五分钟之后）。

gram.constraints: 插入语在语法上是独立的。

paras.en: When I came out of Mom's stomach, she said the whole room got very quiet. Mom didn't even get a chance to look at me because the nice nurse immediately rushed me out of the room. Dad was in such a hurry to follow her that he dropped the video camera, which broke into a million pieces. And then Mom got very upset and tried to get out of bed to see where they were going, but the farting nurse put her very big arms on Mom to keep her down in the bed. They were practically fighting, because Mom was hysterical and the farting nurse was yelling at her to stay calm, and then they both started screaming for the doctor. But guess what? He had fainted! Right on the floor! So when the farting nurse saw that he had fainted, she started pushing him with her foot to get him to wake up, yelling at him the whole time: "What kind of doctor are you? What kind of doctor are you? Get up! Get up!" And then all of a sudden she let out the biggest, loudest, smelliest fart in the history of farts. Mom thinks it was actually the fart that finally woke the doctor up. Anyway, when Mom tells this story, she acts out all the parts—including the farting noises—and it is so, so, so, so funny!
paras.cn: 当我从妈妈肚子里出来时，她说整个房间变得非常安静。妈妈甚至没机会看我一眼，因为那位好心的护士立刻把我冲出了房间。爸爸急着跟出去，结果把摄像机掉在了地上，摔得粉碎。然后妈妈变得非常激动，想下床去看看他们要去哪里，但是那个放屁的护士用她粗壮的手臂把妈妈按在床上。她们几乎在打架，因为妈妈情绪失控，而放屁的护士则对她大喊让她保持冷静，然后她们俩都开始尖叫着找医生。但你猜怎么着？他晕倒了！就倒在地板上！所以当放屁的护士看到他晕倒了，她就开始用脚推他想让他醒过来，全程对他大喊：“你算哪门子医生？你算哪门子医生？起来！起来！” 然后突然之间，她放出了屁史上最大、最响、最臭的一个屁。妈妈认为实际上是那个屁最终把医生熏醒了。不管怎样，当妈妈讲这个故事时，她会把所有部分都表演出来——包括放屁的声音——那真是太、太、太、太好笑了！

vocab.mean: 歇斯底里的；情绪失控的
vocab.ex: Mom was hysterical.
He had fainted! Right on the floor!
She let out the biggest, loudest, smelliest fart.
She acts out all the parts.
She let out the biggest, loudest, smelliest fart in the history of farts.
The nice nurse immediately rushed me out of the room.
The farting nurse was yelling at her to stay calm.
They both started screaming for the doctor.
She started pushing him with her foot to get him to wake up.
They were practically fighting, because Mom was hysterical and the farting nurse was yelling at her to stay calm.
When I came out of Mom's stomach, the whole room got very quiet.
He dropped the video camera, which broke into a million pieces.
Mom got very upset and tried to get out of bed.

vocab.mean: 压制某人；让某人待在下方/不能动
vocab.ex: The farting nurse put her very big arms on Mom to keep her down in the bed.

gram.name: such... that... 结果状语从句
gram.function: 用于强调名词的某种特性所带来的结果。'Dad was in such a hurry... that he dropped the video camera' 强调了爸爸“匆忙”的程度及其后果。

example.en: It was such a cold day that we stayed indoors.
example.cn: 天气太冷了，我们都待在室内。

gram.constraints: 当名词是单数可数名词时，需要加 'a/an'。

gram.name: 重复以示强调
gram.function: 通过重复副词 'so' ('so, so, so, so funny') 来极大地加强情感的强度，模仿了儿童说话时天真而夸张的语气，生动地传达了“极其好笑”的感觉。

example.en: I am so, so tired.
example.cn: 我太累太累了。

gram.constraints: 这是一种非常口语化和非正式的强调方式。

paras.en: Mom says the farting nurse turned out to be a very nice woman. She stayed with Mom the whole time. Didn't leave her side even after Dad came back and the doctors told them how sick I was. Mom remembers exactly what the nurse whispered in her ear when the doctor told her I probably wouldn't live through the night: "Everyone born of God overcometh the world." And the next day, after I had lived through the night, it was that nurse who held Mom's hand when they brought her to meet me for the first time.
paras.cn: 妈妈说那个放屁的护士结果是一个非常好的女人。她全程都陪着妈妈。即使在爸爸回来后，医生们告诉他们我病得有多重，她也没有离开妈妈身边。妈妈清楚地记得，当医生告诉她我可能活不过那个晚上时，护士在她耳边低声说了什么：“凡从神生的，就胜过世界。” 第二天，在我活过了那个晚上之后，当他们带妈妈第一次见我时，正是那位护士握着妈妈的手。

vocab.ex: The farting nurse turned out to be a very nice woman.
The nurse whispered in her ear.
Everyone born of God overcometh the world.
The farting nurse turned out to be a very nice woman.
She stayed with Mom the whole time.
She didn't leave Mom's side even after Dad came back.

vocab.mean: 握住某人的手（安慰或支持）
vocab.ex: The nurse held Mom's hand when they brought her to meet me.

gram.name: 强调句型 (It was... who...)
gram.pattern: It was + [emphasized part] + who + [rest of sentence]
gram.function: 用于强调句子中的某个特定部分，通常是动作的执行者。'it was that nurse who held Mom's hand...' 强调了握住妈妈手的人正是“那位护士”，突出了她的重要性。

example.en: It was my brother who broke the vase.
example.cn: 是我的兄弟打破了花瓶。

gram.constraints: 被强调的部分是人时，通常用 'who'。

paras.en: Mom says by then they had told her all about me. She had been preparing herself for the seeing of me. But she says that when she looked down into my tiny mushed-up face for the first time, all she could see was how pretty my eyes were.
paras.cn: 妈妈说到那时他们已经把关于我的一切都告诉她了。她一直在为见到我做心理准备。但她说，当她第一次低头看我那张小小的、皱巴巴的脸时，她所能看到的只有我的眼睛是多么漂亮。

vocab.ex: By then they had told her all about me.
She had been preparing herself for the seeing of me.
She looked down into my tiny mushed-up face.
She looked down into my tiny mushed-up face.

gram.name: 过去完成进行时
gram.function: 表示一个在过去某个时间点之前一直在持续的动作。'She had been preparing herself...' 强调了在“见到我”这个过去的动作发生之前，妈妈“做准备”这个动作一直在进行。

example.en: He had been waiting for an hour when the bus finally arrived.
example.cn: 当公交车终于到达时，他已经等了一个小时。

gram.constraints: 强调动作的持续性。

gram.name: 强调句型 (All... was...)
gram.function: 用于强调“唯一”的概念，即某人所能做、所能看到或所想的唯一事物。'all she could see was how pretty my eyes were' 强调了在那个瞬间，她唯一注意到的是眼睛的美丽。

example.en: All I want for Christmas is you.
example.cn: 我圣诞节想要的只有你。

gram.constraints: 后面的 'that' 常常被省略。

paras.en: Mom is beautiful, by the way. And Dad is handsome. Via is pretty. In case you were wondering.
paras.cn: 顺便说一下，妈妈很美。爸爸很帅。维娅很漂亮。以防你想知道。

vocab.ex: Mom is beautiful, by the way.
And Dad is handsome.
In case you were wondering.

gram.name: 直接对读者说话与旁白
gram.function: 使用 'by the way' 和 'In case you were wondering' 这样的短语，是叙述者在故事主线之外，直接与读者进行的交流。这种方式模仿了朋友间讲故事的亲切感，拉近了与读者的距离。

example.en: I'm going to the store now. Just so you know.
example.cn: 我现在要去商店了。只是让你知道一下。

gram.constraints: 这是一种营造亲密叙事氛围的文学技巧。

paras.en: I was really bummed when Christopher moved away three years ago. We were both around seven then. We used to spend hours playing with our Star Wars action figures and dueling with our lightsabers. I miss that.
paras.cn: 三年前克里斯托弗搬走的时候我真的很难过。那时我们都大约七岁。我们过去常常花好几个小时玩我们的星球大战人偶，用我们的光剑决斗。我很想念那段时光。

vocab.ex: I was really bummed when he moved away.
We used to play with our Star Wars action figures.
We were dueling with our lightsabers.
Christopher moved away three years ago.
We were dueling with our lightsabers.

gram.name: used to 表示过去习惯
gram.function: 用于描述过去经常发生但现在已经不再发生的习惯或状态。'We used to spend hours playing...' 描述了他们童年时的常态，并与现在（'I miss that'）形成对比。

example.en: I used to play the piano when I was a child.
example.cn: 我小时候常常弹钢琴。

gram.constraints: 可以用来描述过去的动作和状态。

paras.en: Last spring we drove over to Christopher's house in Bridgeport. Me and Christopher were looking for snacks in the kitchen, and I heard Mom talking to Lisa, Christopher's mom, about my going to school in the fall. I had never, ever heard her mention school before.
paras.cn: 去年春天，我们开车去布里奇波特的克里斯托弗家。我和克里斯托弗正在厨房里找零食，我听到妈妈在和克里斯托弗的妈妈丽莎谈论我秋天要去上学的事。我以前从来、从来没有听她提过上学的事。

vocab.ex: We drove over to Christopher's house.
I heard her talk about my going to school in the fall.
I had never, ever heard her mention school before.
Last spring we drove over to Christopher's house.
We drove over to Christopher's house in Bridgeport.
Me and Christopher were looking for snacks in the kitchen.

gram.name: 感官动词结构 (hear sb doing sth)
gram.function: 表示“听到某人正在做某事”，强调动作的正在进行。'I heard Mom talking...' 意味着听到了谈话的过程。

example.en: I saw him running down the street.
example.cn: 我看见他正在街上跑。

variants: hear + object + infinitive (听到动作的全过程或完成)
gram.constraints: 适用于 see, hear, watch, feel 等感官动词。

gram.name: 强调词 ever
gram.function: 在 'never' 之后加上 'ever' 是一种口语化的强调方式，极大地加强了否定的语气，表示“绝对从来没有”。

example.en: I will never, ever do that again.
example.cn: 我再也、再也不会做那种事了。

gram.constraints: 用于非正式语境中以增加情感色彩。

paras.en: "What are you talking about?" I said. Mom looked surprised, like she hadn't meant for me to hear that. "You should tell him what you've been thinking, Isabel," Dad said. He was on the other side of the living room talking to Christopher's dad. "We should talk about this later," said Mom. "No, I want to know what you were talking about," I answered. "Don't you think you're ready for school, Auggie?" Mom said. "No," I said. "I don't, either," said Dad. "Then that's it, case closed," I said, shrugging, and I sat in her lap like I was a baby.
paras.cn: “你们在说什么？” 我说。妈妈看起来很惊讶，好像她不是故意让我听到的。“你应该告诉他你一直在想什么，伊莎贝尔，” 爸爸说。他当时在客厅的另一边和克里斯托弗的爸爸说话。“我们应该晚点再谈这个，” 妈妈说。“不，我想知道你们刚才在谈论什么，” 我回答道。“你不觉得你已经准备好上学了吗，奥吉？” 妈妈说。“不，” 我说。“我也不觉得，” 爸爸说。“那就这样吧，结案了，” 我耸了耸肩说道，然后像个婴儿一样坐在了她的腿上。

vocab.ex: She hadn't meant for me to hear that.
Then that's it, case closed.
I said, shrugging, and I sat in her lap.
"What are you talking about?" I said.
"You should tell him what you've been thinking."

vocab.mean: 像；仿佛（用来比较或形容行为）
vocab.ex: I sat in her lap like I was a baby.

gram.name: 现在分词作伴随状语
gram.function: 用于描述与主句动作同时发生的伴随动作。'I said, shrugging...' 描述了“说话”和“耸肩”两个动作是同时进行的。

example.en: She walked out of the room, slamming the door behind her.
example.cn: 她走出房间，砰地一声关上了门。

gram.constraints: 分词的逻辑主语必须是主句的主语。

gram.name: 现在完成进行时
gram.function: 表示一个从过去开始一直持续到现在的动作，并且可能还会继续下去。'...what you've been thinking' 强调了妈妈“思考”这个动作已经持续了一段时间。

example.en: I have been waiting for you for an hour.
example.cn: 我已经等了你一个小时了。

gram.constraints: 强调动作的持续性。

paras.en: "I just think you need to learn more than I can teach you," Mom said. "I mean, come on, Auggie, you know how bad I am at fractions!" "What school?" I said. I already felt like crying. "Beecher Prep. Right by us." "Wow, that's a great school, Auggie," said Lisa, patting my knee. "Why not Via's school?" I said. "That's too big," Mom answered. "I don't think that would be a good fit for you."
paras.cn: “我只是觉得你需要学习比我能教你的更多的东西，” 妈妈说。“我的意思是，拜托，奥吉，你知道我的分数有多差！” “什么学校？” 我说。我已经感觉想哭了。“比彻预备学校。就在我们附近。” “哇，那是个很棒的学校，奥吉，” 丽莎说着，拍了拍我的膝盖。“为什么不是维娅的学校？” 我说。“那太大了，” 妈妈回答。“我不认为那会很适合你。”

vocab.mean: （用于劝说或鼓励）拜托；得了吧
vocab.ex: I mean, come on, Auggie, you know how bad I am at fractions!
You know how bad I am at fractions!
I don't think that would be a good fit for you.
"You need to learn more than I can teach you," Mom said.
"Wow, that's a great school," said Lisa, patting my knee.
"I don't think that would be a good fit for you."
I already felt like crying.

gram.name: 比较级 (more... than...)
gram.function: 用于比较两者在数量或程度上不同。'...you need to learn more than I can teach you' 比较了“你需要学的”和“我能教的”两者在数量上的差异。

example.en: She has more books than he does.
example.cn: 她的书比他的多。

gram.constraints: 用于两者之间的比较。

paras.en: "I don't want to," I said. I admit: I made my voice sound a little babyish. "You don't have to do anything you don't want to do," Dad said, coming over and lifting me out of Mom's lap. He carried me over to sit on his lap on the other side of the sofa. "We won't make you do anything you don't want to do." "But it would be good for him, Nate," Mom said. "Not if he doesn't want to," answered Dad, looking at me. "Not if he's not ready." I saw Mom look at Lisa, who reached over and squeezed her hand. "You guys will figure it out," she said to Mom. "You always have." "Let's just talk about it later," said Mom. I could tell she and Dad were going to get in a fight about it. I wanted Dad to win the fight. Though a part of me knew Mom was right. And the truth is, she really was terrible at fractions.
paras.cn: “我不想去，” 我说。我承认：我让自己的声音听起来有点孩子气。“你不用做任何你不想做的事，” 爸爸说着，走过来把我从妈妈的腿上抱起来。他把我抱到沙发的另一边，让我在他的腿上坐下。“我们不会强迫你做任何你不想做的事。” “但这对他是好的，内特，” 妈妈说。“如果他不想去就不是，” 爸爸看着我回答道。“如果他还没准备好就不是。” 我看见妈妈看向丽莎，丽莎伸过手来握了握她的手。“你们会解决的，” 她对妈妈说。“你们一直都是。” “我们还是晚点再谈吧，” 妈妈说。我看得出她和爸爸要为此吵架了。我希望爸爸能赢。尽管我内心的一部分知道妈妈是对的。而且事实是，她在分数方面真的很糟糕。

vocab.ex: I made my voice sound a little babyish.
She reached over and squeezed her hand.
I could tell they were going to get in a fight about it.
I admit: I made my voice sound a little babyish.
Dad came over and lifted me out of Mom's lap.
"You guys will figure it out," she said to Mom.
And the truth is, she really was terrible at fractions.

gram.name: 省略句
gram.function: 在对话中为了简洁而省略一些在上下文中很明显的词语。'Not if he doesn't want to' 省略了 'It would not be good for him'。'Not if he's not ready' 省略了 'It would not be good for him'。这使得对话更加自然流畅。

example.en: Are you coming? - If I can. (If I can come)
example.cn: 你来吗？ - 如果我能来就来。

gram.constraints: 通常出现在非正式的口语和写作中，依赖上下文来理解完整含义。

gram.name: I could tell
gram.function: 表示“我看得出”或“我能感觉到”，用于根据观察到的迹象做出推断。这是一个表达主观判断的常用短语。

example.en: I could tell he was angry by the look on his face.
example.cn: 从他脸上的表情我看得出他生气了。

gram.constraints: 后面通常跟一个由 'that' 引导的宾语从句，'that' 可以省略。

paras.en: It was a long drive home. I fell asleep in the backseat like I always do, my head on Via's lap like she was my pillow, a towel wrapped around the seat belt so I wouldn't drool all over her. Via fell asleep, too, and Mom and Dad talked quietly about grown-up things I didn't care about.
paras.cn: 回家的车程很长。我像往常一样在后座睡着了，头枕在维娅的腿上，好像她是我的枕头，一条毛巾裹在安全带上，这样我就不会流口水弄得她满身都是。维娅也睡着了，爸爸妈妈小声地谈论着我不关心的成年人的事情。

vocab.ex: I fell asleep in the backseat.
So I wouldn't drool all over her.
They talked about grown-up things.
It was a long drive to the countryside.
I fell asleep while watching TV.
The cat jumped onto her lap.
He rested his head on a soft pillow.
There was paint all over the floor.
She closed the door quietly.

gram.name: 独立主格结构
gram.function: 在句子中作状语，提供附加的细节或背景描述，其逻辑主语与主句主语不同。'my head on Via's lap' 和 'a towel wrapped around the seat belt' 都是独立主格结构，生动地描绘了主角睡觉时的情景。

example.en: The meeting over, we all went home.
example.cn: 会议结束了，我们都回家了。

gram.constraints: 它在语法上独立于主句，通常用逗号隔开。

paras.en: I don't know how long I was sleeping, but when I woke up, there was a full moon outside the car window. It was a purple night, and we were driving on a highway full of cars. And then I heard Mom and Dad talking about me. "We can't keep protecting him," Mom whispered to Dad, who was driving. "We can't just pretend he's going to wake up tomorrow and this isn't going to be his reality, because it is, Nate, and we have to help him learn to deal with it. We can't just keep avoiding situations that . . ."
paras.cn: 我不知道我睡了多久，但当我醒来时，车窗外挂着一轮满月。那是一个紫色的夜晚，我们正行驶在一条满是汽车的高速公路上。然后我听到了爸爸妈妈在谈论我。“我们不能一直保护他，” 妈妈对正在开车的爸爸低声说。“我们不能只是假装他明天醒来这一切就不会是他的现实，因为它就是，内特，我们必须帮助他学会应对。我们不能只是不停地回避那些... ...”

vocab.ex: Mom whispered to Dad.
This isn't going to be his reality, because it is.
We have to help him learn to deal with it.
We can't just keep avoiding situations.

gram.name: keep doing sth. 结构
gram.function: 表示“持续不断地做某事”。'We can't keep protecting him' 和 'keep avoiding situations' 强调了这些行为的持续性，以及妈妈认为这种持续状态需要改变。

example.en: He keeps making the same mistake.
example.cn: 他不停地犯同样的错误。

gram.constraints: keep 后面必须跟动名词（-ing形式）。

paras.en: "So sending him off to middle school like a lamb to the slaughter . . . ," Dad answered angrily, but he didn't even finish his sentence because he saw me in the mirror looking up. "What's a lamb to the slaughter?" I asked sleepily. "Go back to sleep, Auggie," Dad said softly. "Everyone will stare at me at school," I said, suddenly crying. "Honey," Mom said. She turned around in the front seat and put her hand on my hand. "You know if you don't want to do this, you don't have to. But we spoke to the principal there and told him about you and he really wants to meet you."
paras.cn: “所以把他送到中学就像待宰的羔羊......，” 爸爸愤怒地回答，但他甚至没说完自己的话，因为他从镜子里看到我抬起了头。“什么是待宰的羔羊？” 我睡意朦胧地问。“回去睡觉，奥吉，” 爸爸轻声说。“在学校里大家都会盯着我看，” 我说着，突然哭了起来。“亲爱的，” 妈妈说。她在前座转过身，把手放在我的手上。“你知道如果你不想做这件事，你就不必做。但我们和那里的校长谈过了，告诉了他关于你的事，他真的很想见见你。”

vocab.mean: 待宰的羔羊（比喻天真无知地走向危险）
vocab.ex: Sending him off to middle school like a lamb to the slaughter.
I asked sleepily.
We spoke to the principal there.
They sent him off to boarding school last year.

gram.name: 直接引语
gram.function: 直接引用角色的对话，使故事更加生动和真实。文中大量使用直接引语来推动情节发展和展现人物性格。

example.en: "I'm tired," she said.
example.cn: “我累了，” 她说。

gram.constraints: 引用的内容需要放在引号内，并注意引述语的位置和相应的标点符号。

paras.en: "What did you tell him about me?" "How funny you are, and how kind and smart. When I told him you read Dragon Rider when you were six, he was like, 'Wow, I have to meet this kid.' " "Did you tell him anything else?" I said. Mom smiled at me. Her smile kind of hugged me. "I told him about all your surgeries, and how brave you are," she said. "So he knows what I look like?" I asked.
paras.cn: “你们告诉他关于我的什么事了？” “你有多风趣，有多善良和聪明。当我告诉他你六岁时就读了《龙骑士》，他当时就说：‘哇，我必须见见这个孩子。’” “你们还告诉他别的什么了吗？” 我说。妈妈对我笑了笑。她的微笑像是在拥抱我。“我告诉他你所有的手术，还有你有多勇敢，” 她说。“所以他知道我长什么样了？” 我问。

vocab.ex: He was like, 'Wow, I have to meet this kid.'
Her smile kind of hugged me.
I told him how brave you are.

gram.name: 拟人化
gram.pattern: Giving human qualities to an inanimate object or abstract idea.
gram.function: 通过将人类的行为（'hugged'）赋予抽象的事物（'smile'），作者创造了一种生动、富有情感的意象，让读者能真切地感受到微笑带来的温暖和安慰。

example.en: The wind whispered through the trees.
example.cn: 风在树林间低语。

gram.constraints: 这是一种文学修辞手法。

paras.en: "Well, we brought pictures from last summer in Montauk," Dad said. "We showed him pictures of the whole family. And that great shot of you holding that flounder on the boat!" "You were there, too?" I have to admit I felt a little disappointed that he was a part of this. "We both talked to him, yes," Dad said. "He's a really nice man." "You would like him," Mom added. Suddenly it felt like they were on the same side.
paras.cn: “嗯，我们带了去年夏天在蒙托克的照片，” 爸爸说。“我们给他看了全家的照片。还有你在船上举着那条比目鱼的精彩照片！” “你当时也在？” 我不得不承认我感到有点失望，因为他也参与了这件事。“我们俩都和他谈了，是的，” 爸爸说。“他是个非常好的人。” “你会喜欢他的，” 妈妈补充道。突然感觉他们站到同一边了。

vocab.ex: And that great shot of you holding that flounder.
That great shot of you holding that flounder on the boat!
I felt a little disappointed that he was a part of this.

vocab.mean: 站在同一阵线；意见一致
vocab.ex: They were finally on the same side after the argument.

gram.name: I have to admit
gram.function: 用于引出一个坦诚的、有时是不情愿承认的想法或感受。这是一个表示坦率的常用短语。

example.en: I have to admit, I was wrong.
example.cn: 我得承认，我错了。

gram.constraints: 后面通常跟一个由 'that' 引导的宾语从句，'that' 可以省略。

paras.en: "Wait, so when did you meet him?" I said. "He took us on a tour of the school last year," said Mom. "Last year ?" I said. "So you've been thinking about this for a whole year and you didn't tell me?" "We didn't know if you'd even get in, Auggie," answered Mom. "It's a very hard school to get into. There's a whole admissions process. I didn't see the point in telling you and having you get all worked up about it unnecessarily."
paras.cn: “等等，那你们是什么时候见的他？” 我说。“他去年带我们参观了学校，” 妈妈说。“去年？” 我说。“所以你们已经想这件事想了一整年了，却没告诉我？” “我们不知道你是否能被录取，奥吉，” 妈妈回答。“那是一所很难进的学校。有一整套录取流程。我觉得没必要告诉你，让你白白为此事紧张兮兮。”

vocab.ex: He took us on a tour of the school.
There's a whole admissions process.
Having you get all worked up about it unnecessarily.
She’s been thinking about moving to another city.
He worked hard to get into a good university.

vocab.mean: 认为有意义；理解某事的目的
vocab.ex: I don’t see the point of arguing about it anymore.
He worried unnecessarily about the exam results.

gram.name: not see the point in doing sth.
gram.function: 表示“（不）觉得做某事有意义/有必要”。这是一个表达对某行为价值判断的常用短语。

example.en: I don't see the point in arguing with him.
example.cn: 我觉得和他争论没什么意义。

gram.constraints: 介词 'in' 后面必须跟动名词（-ing形式）。

paras.en: "But you're right, Auggie, we should've told you when we found out last month that you got in," said Dad. "In hindsight," sighed Mom, "yes, I guess." "Did that lady who came to the house that time have something to do with this?" I said. "The one that gave me that test?" "Yes, actually," said Mom, looking guilty. "Yes." "You told me it was an IQ test," I said. "I know, well, that was a white lie," she answered. "It was a test you needed to take to get into the school. You did very well on it, by the way." "So you lied," I said.
paras.cn: “但你是对的，奥吉，我们上个月发现你被录取时就应该告诉你，” 爸爸说。“事后看来，” 妈妈叹了口气，“是的，我想是吧。” “那次来家里的那个女士跟这事有关吗？” 我说。“就是给我做测试的那个？” “是的，确实是，” 妈妈说着，看起来很内疚。“是的。” “你告诉我是智商测试，” 我说。“我知道，嗯，那是个善意的谎言，” 她回答。“那是你进学校需要参加的一个测试。顺便说一下，你考得很好。” “所以你撒谎了，” 我说。

vocab.ex: "In hindsight," sighed Mom, "yes, I guess."
Did that lady have something to do with this?
That was a white lie.

vocab.mean: 叹气（表示无奈、疲惫或感叹）
vocab.ex: She sighed after finishing all her chores.
She felt guilty for forgetting his birthday.

gram.name: should have + 过去分词
gram.function: 表示“本应该做某事但实际上没做”，用于对过去的行为表示遗憾、后悔或批评。'we should've told you' (should have told you) 表达了爸爸的歉意。

example.en: I should have studied harder for the exam.
example.cn: 我本应该为考试更努力学习的。

variants: shouldn't have + pp (本不该做但做了)
gram.constraints: 用于虚拟语气，谈论与过去事实相反的情况。

paras.en: "A white lie, but yes. Sorry," she said, trying to smile, but when I didn't smile back, she turned around in her seat and faced forward. "What's a lamb to the slaughter?" I said. Mom sighed and gave Daddy a "look." "I shouldn't have said that," Dad said, looking at me in the rearview mirror. "It's not true. Here's the thing: Mommy and I love you so much we want to protect you any way we can. It's just sometimes we want to do it in different ways." "I don't want to go to school," I answered, folding my arms.
paras.cn: “一个善意的谎言，但是，是的。对不起，” 她说着，试图微笑，但当 我没有回以微笑时，她在座位上转过身，面向了前方。“什么是待宰的羔羊？” 我说。妈妈叹了口气，给了爸爸一个“眼色”。“我不该说那个的，” 爸爸在后视镜里看着我说。“那不是真的。事情是这样的：妈妈和我都非常爱你，我们想尽一切办法保护你。只是有时候我们想用不同的方式来做。” “我不想去上学，” 我双臂交叉地回答。

vocab.ex: Dad said, looking at me in the rearview mirror.

vocab.mean: 事情是这样的（用于引出解释或要点）
vocab.ex: Here's the thing: we want to protect you.
I answered, folding my arms.

vocab.mean: 善意的谎言；无伤大雅的谎话
vocab.ex: He told a white lie to avoid hurting her feelings.
She faced forward while riding in the car.
Parents always try to protect their children.
The farmer took the cows to the slaughterhouse.
The farmer fed the lambs in the morning.

gram.name: shouldn't have + 过去分词
gram.function: 表示“本不应该做某事但实际上做了”，用于对过去的行为表示后悔或批评。'I shouldn't have said that' 表达了爸爸对自己言论的后悔。

example.en: You shouldn't have eaten so much cake.
example.cn: 你本不该吃那么多蛋糕的。

variants: should have + pp (本该做但没做)
gram.constraints: 用于虚拟语气，谈论与过去事实相反的情况。

paras.en: "It would be good for you, Auggie," said Mom. "Maybe I'll go next year," I answered, looking out the window. "This year would be better, Auggie," said Mom. "You know why? Because you'll be going into fifth grade, and that's the first year of middle school—for everyone. You won't be the only new kid." "I'll be the only kid who looks like me," I said.
paras.cn: “这对你是好的，奥吉，” 妈妈说。“也许我明年再去，” 我看着窗外回答。“今年会更好，奥吉，” 妈妈说。“你知道为什么吗？因为你将要上五年级，那是中学的第一年——对每个人都是。你不会是唯一的新生。” “我会是唯一长得像我这样的孩子，” 我说。

vocab.ex: I answered, looking out the window.
You'll be going into fifth grade.
That's the first year of middle school.
Next year, I'll be in fifth grade.
Being the new kid at school can be stressful.

gram.name: 一般将来时 (will)
gram.function: 用于表达对未来的预测、承诺或即时决定。'I'll go next year' 是一个决定。'You won't be the only new kid' 是一个预测。

example.en: I think it will rain tomorrow.
example.cn: 我想明天下雨。

gram.constraints: 'll 是 'will' 的缩写形式，'won't' 是 'will not' 的缩写形式。

paras.en: "I'm not going to say it won't be a big challenge for you, because you know better than that," she answered. "But it'll be good for you, Auggie. You'll make lots of friends. And you'll learn things you'd never learn with me." She turned in her seat again and looked at me. "When we took the tour, you know what they had in their science lab? A little baby chick that was just hatching out of its egg. It was so cute! Auggie, it actually kind of reminded me of you when you were a little baby . . . with those big brown eyes of yours. . . ."
paras.cn: “我不会说这对你来说不会是一个大挑战，因为你比谁都清楚，” 她回答。“但这对你是好的，奥吉。你会交到很多朋友。而且你会学到跟我在一起永远学不到的东西。” 她又在座位上转过身看着我。“我们参观的时候，你知道他们的科学实验室里有什么吗？一只刚从蛋里孵出来的小鸡。它太可爱了！奥吉，它真的有点让我想起你还是个小婴儿的时候......你那双大大的棕色眼睛......”

vocab.ex: It won't be a big challenge for you.
A little baby chick that was just hatching out of its egg.
It kind of reminded me of you.
It’s easy to make friends if you join clubs at school.
We did a cool experiment in the science lab.
The baby chick hatched this morning.
The eggs will hatch in about three weeks.
This song reminds me of my childhood.

gram.name: would 表示过去的假设/虚拟
gram.function: 用于描述在特定（过去或假设的）条件下不可能发生的事情。'you'd never learn with me' (you would never learn) 意思是“（如果继续在家上学）你就永远学不到”，这是一种对未来可能性的虚拟表达。

example.en: In that situation, I would do the same thing.
example.cn: 在那样的情形下，我也会做同样的事。

gram.constraints: 常用于条件句的主句中，或在上下文中隐含条件。

paras.en: I usually love when they talk about when I was a baby. Sometimes I want to curl up into a little tiny ball and let them hug me and kiss me all over. I miss being a baby, not knowing stuff. But I wasn't in the mood for that now. "I don't want to go," I said.
paras.cn: 我通常喜欢他们谈论我还是婴儿的时候。有时候我想蜷缩成一个小小的球，让他们拥抱我、亲吻我全身。我想念当婴儿的感觉，什么都不知道。但我现在没那种心情。“我不想去，” 我说。

vocab.ex: I want to curl up into a little tiny ball.
Let them hug me and kiss me all over.
But I wasn't in the mood for that now.
I’m not in the mood to talk today.

gram.name: 动词后跟动名词
gram.function: 某些动词（如miss, enjoy, avoid, finish）后面需要跟动名词作宾语。'I miss being a baby...' 意思是“我想念‘当婴儿’这件事”。

example.en: I enjoy reading books.
example.cn: 我喜欢读书。

gram.constraints: 需要记住哪些动词后面跟动名词，哪些跟不定式。

paras.en: "How about this? Can you at least meet Mr. Tushman before making up your mind?" Mom asked. "Mr. Tushman?" I said. "He's the principal," answered Mom. "Mr. Tush man?" I repeated. "I know, right?" Dad answered, smiling and looking at me in the rearview mirror. "Can you believe that name, Auggie? I mean, who on earth would ever agree to have a name like Mr. Tushman?"
paras.cn: “这样如何？你能在下决心之前至少见见塔什曼先生吗？” 妈妈问。“塔什曼先生？” 我说。“他是校长，” 妈妈回答。“屁股人先生？” 我重复道。“我知道，对吧？” 爸爸笑着，在后视镜里看着我回答。“你能相信有那样的名字吗，奥吉？我的意思是，究竟有谁会同意取一个像塔什曼先生这样的名字？”

vocab.ex: How about this?
Before making up your mind.

vocab.mean: 究竟；到底（用于加强疑问语气）
vocab.ex: Who on earth would ever agree to have a name like that?
Take your time to make up your mind about the trip.
The principal welcomed all the new students.
Check the rearview mirror before changing lanes.
She slipped and fell right on her tush.

gram.name: Before + 动名词
gram.function: 介词 'before' 后面跟动名词短语，构成时间状语，表示“在做…之前”。

example.en: You should finish your homework before watching TV.
example.cn: 你应该在看电视前完成你的作业。

gram.constraints: 介词后面通常跟名词或动名词。

paras.en: I smiled even though I didn't want to let them see me smile. Dad was the one person in the world who could make me laugh no matter how much I didn't want to laugh. Dad always made everyone laugh. "Auggie, you know, you should go to that school just so you can hear his name said over the loudspeaker!" Dad said excitedly. "Can you imagine how funny that would be? Hello, hello? Paging Mr. Tushman!" He was using a fake high, old-lady voice. "Hi, Mr. Tushman! I see you're running a little behind today! Did your car get rear-ended again? What a bum rap!"
paras.cn: 我笑了，尽管我不想让他们看到我笑。爸爸是世界上唯一一个无论我多不想笑都能让我笑出来的人。爸爸总是能让每个人都笑。“奥吉，你知道吗，你应该去那所学校，就为了能听到他的名字在广播里被喊出来！” 爸爸兴奋地说。“你能想象那会有多好笑吗？喂，喂？请塔什曼先生接电话！” 他用一种假装的、尖声的老太太声音说。“嗨，塔什曼先生！我看到您今天有点迟到了！您的车又被追尾了吗？真是倒霉！”

vocab.ex: No matter how much I didn't want to laugh.
Hear his name said over the loudspeaker.
Did your car get rear-ended again?
What a bum rap!
I brought an umbrella just so I wouldn't get wet.
Paging Dr. Smith to the emergency room.

vocab.mean: 落后；迟到；没按计划进行
vocab.ex: I'm running behind schedule and will be late for the meeting.

gram.name: 使役动词 (make sb do sth)
gram.function: 表示“使/让某人做某事”。'...who could make me laugh' 意为“能让我笑”。

example.en: My parents make me do my homework every day.
example.cn: 我父母每天都让我做作业。

gram.constraints: 在主动语态中，make, let, have 后面跟不带 to 的不定式作宾补。

paras.en: I started laughing, not even because I thought he was being that funny but because I wasn't in the mood to stay mad anymore. "It could be worse, though!" Dad continued in his normal voice. "Mommy and I had a professor in college called Miss Butt." Mom was laughing now, too. "Is that for real?" I said. "Roberta Butt," Mom answered, raising her hand as if to swear. "Bobbie Butt." "She had huge cheeks," said Dad. "Nate!" said Mom. "What? She had big cheeks is all I'm saying." Mom laughed and shook her head at the same time.
paras.cn: 我开始笑了起来，甚至不是因为我觉得他有那么好笑，而是因为我再也没有心情生气了。“不过，情况可能更糟呢！” 爸爸用他正常的声音继续说。“我和妈妈在大学时有个教授叫巴特小姐（Butt，意为屁股）。” 妈妈现在也笑了。“是真的吗？” 我说。“罗伯塔·巴特，” 妈妈举起手好像在发誓一样回答道。“波比·巴特。” “她有巨大的脸颊，” 爸爸说。“内特！” 妈妈说。“怎么了？我只是说她脸颊很大而已。” 妈妈边笑边摇头。

vocab.ex: I wasn't in the mood to stay mad anymore.
Is that for real?
Raising her hand as if to swear.
She is a professor of biology at the university.
Her cheeks turned red when she blushed.

gram.name: not because... but because... 结构
gram.pattern: not because [reason A] but because [reason B]
gram.function: 用于对比和澄清两个可能的原因，否定前者，肯定后者。'I started laughing, not... because I thought... but because I wasn't in the mood...' 解释了笑的真正原因。

example.en: I helped him not because I liked him, but because it was my duty.
example.cn: 我帮他不是因为我喜欢他，而是因为那是我的责任。

gram.constraints: 两个 'because' 后面都跟从句，结构应保持平行。

paras.en: "Hey hey, I know!" said Dad excitedly. "Let's fix them up on a blind date! Can you imagine? Miss Butt, meet Mr. Tushman. Mr. Tushman, here's Miss Butt. They could get married and have a bunch of little Tushies." "Poor Mr. Tushman," answered Mom, shaking her head. "Auggie hasn't even met the man yet, Nate!" "Who's Mr. Tushman?" Via said groggily. She had just woken up. "He's the principal of my new school," I answered.
paras.cn: “嘿嘿，我知道了！” 爸爸兴奋地说。“我们给他们安排一次相亲吧！你能想象吗？巴特小姐，见见塔什曼先生。塔什曼先生，这位是巴特小姐。他们可以结婚，然后生一堆小屁屁（Tushies）。” “可怜的塔什曼先生，” 妈妈摇着头回答。“奥吉甚至还没见过这个人呢，内特！” “谁是塔什曼先生？” 维娅睡眼惺忪地说。她刚醒。“他是我新学校的校长，” 我回答。

vocab.ex: Let's fix them up on a blind date!
Let's fix them up on a blind date!

vocab.mean: 昏昏沉沉地；睡眼惺忪地
vocab.ex: Via said groggily.

gram.name: 祈使句 (Let's)
gram.function: 用于提出建议，邀请对方一起做某事。'Let's fix them up on a blind date!' 是爸爸提出的一个玩笑建议。

example.en: It's a nice day. Let's go to the park.
example.cn: 今天天气很好。我们去公园吧。

gram.constraints: Let's 后面必须跟动词原形。

paras.en: I would have been more nervous about meeting Mr. Tushman if I'd known I was also going to be meeting some kids from the new school. But I didn't know, so if anything, I was kind of giggly. I couldn't stop thinking about all the jokes Daddy had made about Mr. Tushman's name. So when me and Mom arrived at Beecher Prep a few weeks before the start of school, and I saw Mr. Tushman standing there, waiting for us at the entrance, I started giggling right away. He didn't look at all like what I pictured, though. I guess I thought he would have a huge butt, but he didn't. In fact, he was a pretty normal guy. Tall and thin. Old but not really old. He seemed nice. He shook my mom's hand first.
paras.cn: 如果我知道我还会见到新学校的一些孩子，那么见到塔什曼先生时我可能会更紧张。但我不知道，所以，反倒是有点想笑。我忍不住一直在想爸爸开的关于塔什曼先生名字的那些玩笑。所以，在开学前几周，当我和妈妈到达比彻预备学校，看到塔什曼先生站在那里，在入口处等我们时，我立刻就咯咯地笑了起来。不过，他长得和我设想的一点也不一样。我猜我以为他会有一个巨大的屁股，但他没有。事实上，他是个很普通的人。又高又瘦。年纪大但又不是真的很老。他看起来人很好。他先和我妈妈握了手。

vocab.ex: The new rules didn't help; if anything, they made the situation worse.
The children were tired and getting giggly.
I always pictured my dream house by the sea.
I started giggling right away.

gram.name: 第三条件句
gram.pattern: If + past perfect, ... would have + past participle
gram.function: 用于描述与过去事实相反的假设情况及其可能的结果。'I would have been more nervous if I'd known...' 描述了一个未发生的过去情况（他当时并不知道）。

example.en: If I had studied harder, I would have passed the exam.
example.cn: 如果我当初学习更努力的话，我就能通过考试了。

gram.constraints: 用于对过去情况的虚拟假设。

paras.en: "Hi, Mr. Tushman, it's so nice to see you again," said Mom. "This is my son, August." Mr. Tushman looked right at me and smiled and nodded. He put his hand out for me to shake. "Hi, August," he said, totally normally. "It's a pleasure to meet you." "Hi," I mumbled, dropping my hand into his hand while I looked down at his feet. He was wearing red Adidas.
paras.cn: “嗨，塔什曼先生，很高兴再次见到您，” 妈妈说。“这是我的儿子，奥古斯特。” 塔什曼先生直直地看着我，微笑着点了点头。他伸出手来要和我握手。“嗨，奥古斯特，” 他完全正常地说道。“很高兴认识你。” “嗨，” 我咕哝着，把手放进他的手里，同时低头看着他的脚。他穿着红色的阿迪达斯。

vocab.ex: The teacher nodded to show she understood the student's question.
It was a pleasure to work with such a dedicated team.
He tends to mumble when he's nervous, so it's hard to hear him.

gram.name: 直接引语与动作描述

components.role: 描述说话者动作的短语

gram.function: 在对话中，通过在引述语（如 'I mumbled'）后添加动作描述（如 'dropping my hand...' 和 'while I looked down...'）来丰富场景，让读者能够同时看到角色的言语和行为。

example.en: "I don't know," he said, looking away nervously.
example.cn: “我不知道，” 他说，紧张地移开了目光。

gram.constraints: 动作描述通常使用现在分词短语，与引述语的主语保持一致。

paras.en: "So," he said, kneeling down in front of me so I couldn't look at his sneakers but had to look at his face, "your mom and dad have told me a lot about you." "Like what have they told you?" I asked. "Sorry?" "Honey, you have to speak up," said Mom. "Like what?" I asked, trying not to mumble. I admit I have a bad habit of mumbling. "Well, that you like to read," said Mr. Tushman, "and that you're a great artist." He had blue eyes with white eyelashes. "And you're into science, right?"
paras.cn: “那么，” 他说着，跪在我面前，这样我就不能看他的运动鞋，而必须看着他的脸了，“你爸爸妈妈跟我说了很多关于你的事。” “比如他们都跟你说了些什么？” 我问。“什么？” “亲爱的，你得大点声说，” 妈妈说。“比如什么？” 我问，努力不让自己咕哝。我承认我有咕哝的坏习惯。“嗯，说你喜欢读书，” 塔什曼先生说，“而且你是个很棒的艺术家。” 他有蓝色的眼睛和白色的睫毛。“而且你对科学很感兴趣，对吧？”

vocab.ex: It's polite to kneel when you speak to a small child.
Could you please speak up? We can't hear you in the back.
My brother is really into classic cars.
He said, kneeling down in front of me.
"Honey, you have to speak up," said Mom.

vocab.mean: 咕哝；嘀咕（含糊不清地说）
vocab.ex: I admit I have a bad habit of mumbling.
"And you're into science, right?"
He had blue eyes with white eyelashes.

gram.name: so that 目的/结果状语从句
gram.function: 用于解释一个动作的目的或其直接导致的结果。'...kneeling down... so I couldn't look at his sneakers but had to look at his face...' 解释了“跪下”这个动作的目的和效果。

example.en: She stood on a chair so she could reach the top shelf.
example.cn: 她站到椅子上，以便能够到最上面的架子。

gram.constraints: 口语中 'that' 常常被省略。

paras.en: "Uh-huh," I said, nodding. "We have a couple of great science electives at Beecher," he said. "Maybe you'll take one of them?" "Uh-huh," I said, though I had no idea what an elective was. "So, are you ready to take a tour?" "You mean we're doing that now?" I said. "Did you think we were going to the movies?" he answered, smiling as he stood up. "You didn't tell me we were taking a tour," I said to Mom in my accusing voice.
paras.cn: “嗯哼，” 我点着头说。“我们在比彻有几门很棒的科学选修课，” 他说。“也许你会选一门？” “嗯哼，” 我说，虽然我根本不知道选修课是什么。“那么，你准备好参观一下了吗？” “你的意思是我们现在就去？” 我说。“你以为我们是去看电影吗？” 他站起来时笑着回答。“你没告诉我我们要参观，” 我用指责的语气对妈妈说。

vocab.ex: Students must choose two electives this semester.
We went on a guided tour of the old castle.
She pointed an accusing finger at her brother.

gram.name: 连词 though 表示转折
gram.function: 用于引出一个与主句内容形成对比或让步的从句，意为“虽然，尽管”。'"Uh-huh," I said, though I had no idea...' 表达了“我”的回答和内心真实想法之间的矛盾。

example.en: He kept working, though he was very tired.
example.cn: 他继续工作，尽管他非常累。

gram.constraints: 可以放在句首或句中。

paras.en: "Auggie . . . ," she started to say. "It'll be fine, August," said Mr. Tushman, holding his hand out to me. "I promise." I think he wanted me to take his hand, but I took Mom's instead. He smiled and started walking toward the entrance. Mommy gave my hand a little squeeze, though I don't know if it was an "I love you" squeeze or an "I'm sorry" squeeze. Probably a little of both.
paras.cn: “奥吉......，” 她开口想说。“会没事的，奥古斯特，” 塔什曼先生说着，向我伸出手。“我保证。” 我想他是想让我牵他的手，但我却牵了妈妈的手。他笑了笑，开始朝入口走去。妈妈轻轻地捏了一下我的手，不过我不知道那是一个“我爱你”的捏，还是一个“对不起”的捏。可能两者都有一点吧。

vocab.ex: I promise I will finish the report by tomorrow.
I didn't have coffee; I had tea instead.
She gave my arm a gentle squeeze to get my attention.

vocab.mean: 两者都有一点；都有一些
vocab.ex: Probably a little of both.

gram.name: 使用 'or' 的平行结构
gram.function: 用于连接两个或多个选择或可能性。'...an "I love you" squeeze or an "I'm sorry" squeeze' 通过并列两个名词短语，表达了主角对妈妈行为意图的不确定性。

example.en: Would you like tea or coffee?
example.cn: 你想喝茶还是咖啡？

gram.constraints: 连接的成分在语法上应保持平行。

paras.en: The only school I'd ever been inside before was Via's, when I went with Mom and Dad to watch Via sing in spring concerts and stuff like that. This school was very different. It was smaller. It smelled like a hospital.
paras.cn: 我以前唯一进过的学校是维娅的学校，那是在我和爸爸妈妈去看维娅在春季音乐会之类活动上唱歌的时候。这所学校非常不同。它更小。闻起来像医院。

vocab.ex: I've never been inside that old theater.
We bought tickets for the rock concert.
He enjoys hiking, camping, and stuff like that.

gram.name: 省略关系代词
gram.function: 在限定性定语从句中，如果关系代词（that, which, who）在从句中作宾语，通常可以被省略。'The only school (that) I'd ever been inside...' 省略了作介词 'inside' 宾语的关系代词 'that'。

example.en: The book (that) I'm reading is very interesting.
example.cn: 我正在读的那本书非常有趣。

gram.constraints: 只有当关系代词在从句中作宾语时才能省略。

paras.en: We followed Mr. Tushman down a few hallways. There weren't a lot of people around. And the few people who were there didn't seem to notice me at all, though that may have been because they didn't see me. I sort of hid behind Mom as I walked. I know that sounds kind of babyish of me, but I wasn't feeling very brave right then.
paras.cn: 我们跟着塔什曼先生走过了几条走廊。周围没有很多人。而那几个在场的人似乎完全没有注意到我，尽管那可能是因为他们没看到我。我走路时有点像躲在妈妈身后。我知道我这种行为听起来有点孩子气，但那时我感觉不是很有勇气。

vocab.ex: The students rushed down the hallway to their next class.
I sort of understand what you mean, but not completely.
His tantrum was very babyish for a ten-year-old.

gram.name: Adjective + of + Person 结构 (用于评价行为)
gram.pattern: (That/It) + is/was + Adjective + of + Person (+ to do sth)
gram.function: 用于评价某人的行为所表现出的品质。'that sounds kind of babyish of me' 意思是“我（的行为）听起来有点孩子气”，是在评价自己的行为。

example.en: It was very kind of you to help me with my bags.
example.cn: 你帮我拿包真是太好了。

gram.constraints: 常与 nice, kind, silly, stupid, brave 等描述性格或行为的形容词连用。

paras.en: We ended up in a small room with the words OFFICE OF THE MIDDLE SCHOOL DIRECTOR on the door. Inside, there was a desk with a nice-seeming lady sitting behind it.
paras.cn: 我们最终到了一个门上写着“初中部主任办公室”的小房间。里面有一张书桌，一位看起来很和善的女士坐在后面。

vocab.mean: 最终到达（某地）；结果陷入（某种境地）
vocab.ex: After getting lost in the city, we ended up in a strange neighborhood.
The director of the program will give the opening speech.
The new neighbor is a very nice-seeming man.

gram.name: 复合形容词 (形容词 + 分词)
gram.function: 通过将形容词和现在分词用连字符连接（或不连接），创造一个新的描述性词语，以更简洁的方式表达。“nice-seeming” 意为 “seeming nice”（看起来和善）。

example.en: The actor is famous for his good-looking face.
example.cn: 那位演员因其英俊的脸庞而闻名。

gram.constraints: 是构成复合形容词的多种方式之一。

paras.en: "This is Mrs. Garcia," said Mr. Tushman, and the lady smiled at Mom and took off her glasses and got up out of her chair. My mother shook her hand and said: "Isabel Pullman, nice to meet you." "And this is August," Mr. Tushman said. Mom kind of stepped to the side a bit, so I would move forward. Then that thing happened that I've seen happen a million times before. When I looked up at her, Mrs. Garcia's eyes dropped for a second. It was so fast no one else would have noticed, since the rest of her face stayed exactly the same. She was smiling a really shiny smile.
paras.cn: “这位是加西亚夫人，” 塔什曼先生说，那位女士对妈妈笑了笑，摘下眼镜，从椅子上站了起来。我妈妈和她握了握手说：“伊莎贝尔·普尔曼，很高兴见到您。” “这是奥古斯特，” 塔什曼先生说。妈妈稍微往旁边站了一点，好让我往前走。然后那件我已经见过一百万次的事情发生了。当我抬头看她时，加西亚夫人的目光往下落了一秒钟。那速度快得其他人都不会注意到，因为她脸上其余的表情完全没变。她正挂着一个亮晶晶的微笑。

vocab.ex: Please step to the side to let the people pass.
When he heard the bad news, his smile dropped from his face.

vocab.mean: 发亮的；有光泽的（此处指虚假的）
vocab.ex: The politician gave the camera a shiny smile that didn't reach his eyes.
He took off his glasses before cleaning them.
She got up from her chair to greet the guest.
They shook hands after the meeting.
He moved a bit closer to the window.
Nobody noticed the quick change in her face.
Everything stayed exactly the same.

gram.name: 复合宾语与定语从句
gram.pattern: ... thing + that + Subject + have seen + Object + infinitive
gram.function: 这是一个复杂的结构，用于描述一个反复发生的、熟悉的事件。'that thing that I've seen happen a million times' 中，定语从句 'that I've seen happen...' 修饰名词 'thing'，而从句内部又包含了 'see something happen' (感官动词+宾语+不带to的不定式) 的结构。

example.en: He did that annoying thing that I've seen him do a thousand times.
example.cn: 他又做了那个我见过他做过一千次的烦人动作。

gram.constraints: 这种层叠结构在口语中很常见，用于表达熟悉感。

paras.en: "Such a pleasure to meet you, August," she said, holding out her hand for me to shake. "Hi," I said quietly, giving her my hand, but I didn't want to look at her face, so I kept staring at her glasses, which hung from a chain around her neck. "Wow, what a firm grip!" said Mrs. Garcia. Her hand was really warm. "The kid's got a killer handshake," Mr. Tushman agreed, and everyone laughed above my head.
paras.cn: “很高兴认识你，奥古斯特，” 她说着，伸出手来要和我握手。“嗨，” 我小声地说，把手递给她，但我不想看她的脸，所以我一直盯着她的眼镜，那眼镜用一根链子挂在她的脖子上。“哇，握得真有力！” 加西亚夫人说。她的手真的很暖和。“这孩子的握手超赞的，” 塔什曼先生同意道，然后大家都在我头顶上方笑了起来。

vocab.ex: He held out his hand to help her up.
A good leader often has a firm grip on the situation.
That band gave a killer performance last night.

vocab.mean: 在某人头顶上；（引申）在上方
vocab.ex: They laughed above his head as he looked down.

gram.name: 感叹句 (What a...!)
gram.function: 用于对名词所代表的人或事物表示强烈的赞扬、惊讶或其他情感。'What a firm grip!' 是对握手力量的赞叹。

example.en: What a beautiful day it is!
example.cn: 今天天气真好！

gram.constraints: 用于修饰名词，而 'How' 用于修饰形容词、副词或动词。

paras.en: "You can call me Mrs. G," Mrs. Garcia said. I think she was talking to me, but I was looking at all the stuff on her desk now. "That's what everyone calls me. Mrs. G, I forgot my combination. Mrs. G, I need a late pass. Mrs. G, I want to change my elective." "Mrs. G's actually the one who runs the place," said Mr. Tushman, which again made all the grown-ups laugh.
paras.cn: “你可以叫我G夫人，” 加西亚夫人说。我想她是在对我说话，但我那时正看着她桌上所有的东西。“大家都是这么叫我的。‘G夫人，我忘了我的密码。’‘G夫人，我需要一张迟到条。’‘G夫人，我想换选修课。’” “实际上G夫人才是这里真正管事的人，” 塔什曼先生说，这句话又让所有的大人都笑了。

vocab.ex: I can never remember the combination for my gym locker.
If you arrive after the bell, you need to get a late pass from the office.

vocab.mean: 管理这个地方；是这里的主心骨
vocab.ex: The manager's assistant is the one who really runs the place.

gram.name: 用直接引语举例
gram.function: Mrs. Garcia没有引用某个特定的人说的话，而是通过列举一系列典型的学生请求（'Mrs. G, I forgot my combination...'）来生动地展示自己的角色和日常工作。这是一种比简单陈述更具画面感的举例方式。

example.en: My mom is always worrying. It's always, "Did you eat?" "Are you wearing a coat?"
example.cn: 我妈妈总是操心。她总是问，“你吃饭了吗？”“你穿外套了吗？”

gram.constraints: 引号内的内容是虚构的典型例子，而非真实对话。

paras.en: "I'm here every morning by seven-thirty," Mrs. Garcia continued, still looking at me while I stared at her brown sandals with small purple flowers on the buckles. "So if you ever need anything, August, I'm the one to ask. And you can ask me anything." "Okay," I mumbled. "Oh, look at that cute baby," Mom said, pointing to one of the photographs on Mrs. Garcia's bulletin board. "Is he yours?"
paras.cn: “我每天早上七点半之前就到这里了，” 加西亚夫人继续说，她仍然看着我，而我则盯着她那双搭扣上有紫色小花的棕色凉鞋。“所以如果你有任何需要，奥古斯特，找我就对了。而且你可以问我任何事。” “好的，” 我咕哝道。“哦，看那个可爱的宝宝，” 妈妈指着加西亚夫人布告板上的一张照片说。“是您的孩子吗？”

vocab.ex: He fastened the buckle on his new belt.
Check the bulletin board for the latest announcements.
If you need help with computers, John is the one to ask.
I go for a run every morning before breakfast.
She wore new sandals with colorful straps.

vocab.mean: 曾经；在任何时候（用于强调）
vocab.ex: If you ever need help, just ask me.
He mumbled an answer because he was nervous.
She pointed to the map to show the location.

gram.name: while 引导的时间状语从句
gram.function: 用于连接两个同时发生的动作，强调它们的并行性。'...still looking at me while I stared at her brown sandals' 清楚地展示了两个角色在同一时间里各自不同的行为和关注点。

example.en: He read a book while he waited for the bus.
example.cn: 他在等公交车的时候读了一本书。

gram.constraints: 从句中的动词通常是表示持续状态或动作的。

paras.en: "No, my goodness!" said Mrs. Garcia, smiling a big smile now that was totally different from her shiny smile. "You've just made my day. He's my grandson." "What a cutie!" said Mom, shaking her head. "How old?" "In that picture he was five months, I think. But he's big now. Almost eight years old!" "Wow," said Mom, nodding and smiling. "Well, he is absolutely beautiful." "Thank you!" said Mrs. Garcia, nodding like she was about to say something else about her grandson. But then all of a sudden her smile got a little smaller. "We're all going to take very good care of August," she said to Mom, and I saw her give Mom's hand a little squeeze.
paras.cn: “不，天哪！” 加西亚夫人说，现在露出了一个大大的微笑，这和她那亮晶晶的微笑完全不同。“你让我今天太开心了。他是我的外孙。” “真是个小可爱！” 妈妈摇着头说。“多大了？” “在那张照片里他大概五个月大，我想。但他现在长大了。快八岁了！” “哇，” 妈妈点着头微笑着说。“嗯，他真是太漂亮了。” “谢谢！” 加西亚夫人说，点着头，好像正要说些关于她外孙的其他事。但接着突然之间她的笑容变小了一点。“我们都会好好照顾奥古斯特的，” 她对妈妈说，我看到她轻轻捏了捏妈妈的手。

vocab.ex: My goodness, you've grown so tall!
Your kind compliment really made my day.
Look at that little puppy, what a cutie!

gram.name: 同位语（短语）
gram.function: 用于对前面的名词进行补充说明或解释。'a big smile now that was totally different...' 中，'that was totally different...' 是一个定语从句，修饰 'smile'，功能上类似于同位语，对其进行详细描述和对比。

example.en: He showed me his new car, a red convertible that was very expensive.
example.cn: 他给我看了他的新车，一辆非常昂贵的红色敞篷车。

gram.constraints: 同位语和它修饰的词在逻辑上指的是同一事物。

paras.en: I looked at Mom's face, and that's when I realized she was just as nervous as I was. I guess I liked Mrs. Garcia—when she wasn't wearing her shiny smile.
paras.cn: 我看着妈妈的脸，就在那时我意识到她和我一样紧张。我猜我喜欢加西亚夫人——当她不挂着那亮晶晶的微笑的时候。

vocab.ex: I suddenly realized I had left my keys at home.
Before the big performance, the actor was as nervous as a kitten.

vocab.mean: 亮晶晶的微笑（指虚假的、职业性的微笑）
vocab.ex: I prefer a genuine smile to a shiny smile any day.

gram.name: 破折号（用于补充限定）
gram.function: 用于在句末添加一个补充说明、解释或条件，从而对主句的陈述进行限定。它比逗号或括号更具强调意味和非正式感。'I liked Mrs. Garcia—when she wasn't wearing her shiny smile' 限定了“喜欢”她的条件。

example.en: I love that restaurant—when it's not too crowded.
example.cn: 我喜欢那家餐厅——只要它不太拥挤就行。

gram.constraints: 破折号后面的内容在语法上可以是独立的，也可以不是。

paras.en: We followed Mr. Tushman into a small room across from Mrs. Garcia's desk. He was talking as he closed the door to his office and sat down behind his big desk, though I wasn't really paying much attention to what he was saying. I was looking around at all the things on his desk. Cool stuff, like a globe that floated in the air and a Rubik's-type cube made with little mirrors. I liked his office a lot. I liked that there were all these neat little drawings and paintings by students on the walls, framed like they were important.
paras.cn: 我们跟着塔什曼先生走进加西亚夫人办公桌对面的一个小房间。他一边关上办公室的门，一边坐到他的大书桌后面说话，不过我并没太注意他在说什么。我正环顾他桌上所有的东西。都是些很酷的玩意儿，比如一个悬浮在空中的地球仪，还有一个用小镜子做成的类似魔方的东西。我非常喜欢他的办公室。我喜欢墙上挂着所有这些由学生创作的、整洁的小素描和画作，它们被装裱起来，好像很重要似的。

vocab.ex: You must pay attention to the teacher's instructions to do the activity correctly.
The astronaut seemed to float in the zero-gravity environment of the spaceship.
She keeps her room very neat and tidy, but he thinks her new car is really neat.
She has a framed photograph of her family on her desk.
The library is across from the coffee shop.
He wasn’t paying attention during the meeting.
He can solve a Rubik’s cube in under a minute.
She looked at herself in the mirror before leaving.
They framed the painting and hung it on the wall.
Each of these drawings looked important to him.

gram.name: 使用 'like' 的明喻
gram.function: 用于将一事物与另一事物进行直接比较，以创造生动的形象。'...framed like they were important' 将画作被装裱的方式与重要物品的待遇进行比较，突显了对学生作品的珍视。

example.en: He ran like the wind was chasing him.
example.cn: 他跑得飞快，就像有风在追他一样。

gram.constraints: 'Like' 用于非正式比较，而 'as' 用于更正式的比较。

paras.en: Mom sat down in a chair in front of Mr. Tushman's desk, and even though there was another chair right next to hers, I decided to stand beside her. "Why do you have your own room and Mrs. G doesn't?" I said. "You mean, why do I have an office?" asked Mr. Tushman. "You said she runs the place," I said. "Oh! Well, I was kind of kidding. Mrs. G is my assistant." "Mr. Tushman is the director of the middle school," Mom explained. "Do they call you Mr. T?" I asked, which made him smile.
paras.cn: 妈妈在塔什曼先生书桌前的一把椅子上坐下，尽管她旁边还有另一把椅子，我还是决定站在她身边。“为什么你有自己的房间而G夫人没有？” 我说。“你的意思是，为什么我有一间办公室？” 塔什曼先生问。“你说她才是管事的人，” 我说。“哦！嗯，我只是开个玩笑。G夫人是我的助理。” “塔什曼先生是初中部的主任，” 妈妈解释道。“他们叫你T先生吗？” 我问，这让他笑了。

vocab.mean: 管理这个地方；是这里的主心骨
vocab.ex: The manager's assistant is the one who really runs the place.
Don't be so serious, I was only kidding about selling your car.
The manager asked her assistant to schedule the meeting.
The director of marketing presented the new advertising campaign.

gram.name: which 指代整个主句
gram.function: 在非限定性定语从句中，'which' 可以指代前面整个主句所表达的观点或事实。在此句中，'...which made him smile' 的 'which' 指代的是“我问他‘他们叫你T先生吗？’”这一整件事。

example.en: He forgot my birthday, which made me quite upset.
example.cn: 他忘了我的生日，这让我很生气。

gram.constraints: 必须用逗号与主句隔开，只能使用 'which'。

paras.en: "Do you know who Mr. T is?" he answered. "I pity the fool?" he said in a funny tough voice, like he was imitating someone. I had no idea what he was talking about. "Anyway, no," said Mr. Tushman, shaking his head. "No one calls me Mr. T. Though I have a feeling I'm called a lot of other things I don't know about. Let's face it, a name like mine is not so easy to live with, you know what I mean?" Here I have to admit I totally laughed, because I knew exactly what he meant.
paras.cn: “你知道T先生是谁吗？” 他回答。“我同情傻瓜？” 他用一种滑稽的硬汉声音说，好像在模仿某人。我完全不知道他在说什么。“总之，没有，” 塔什曼先生摇着头说。“没人叫我T先生。不过我感觉我被叫了很多我不知道的其他外号。面对现实吧，像我这样的名字可不太好过，你懂我的意思吧？” 在这里我得承认我完全笑了，因为我完全明白他的意思。

vocab.ex: Children often imitate their parents' behavior.
I have no idea where I left my keys.
I have a feeling that something good is about to happen.
Let's face it, we are not going to win this game.
It was a difficult decision, but I learned to live with it.
He said, 'I pity the fool!' in a joking, dramatic voice.

gram.name: 话语标记 (you know what I mean?)
gram.function: 用于在陈述后寻求听者的理解和认同，是一种常见的口语化表达，能拉近说话者与听者之间的距离，使其听起来更像是一次亲密的交谈。

example.en: It's just so frustrating sometimes, you know what I mean?
example.cn: 有时候就是那么令人沮丧，你懂我的意思吧？

gram.constraints: 主要用于非正式对话中。

paras.en: "My mom and dad had a teacher called Miss Butt," I said. "Auggie!" said Mom, but Mr. Tushman laughed. "Now, that's bad," said Mr. Tushman, shaking his head. "I guess I shouldn't complain. Hey, so listen, August, here's what I thought we would do today. . . ." "Is that a pumpkin?" I said, pointing to a framed painting behind Mr. Tushman's desk. "Auggie, sweetie, don't interrupt," said Mom.
paras.cn: “我妈妈和爸爸有个老师叫巴特小姐（Butt，意为屁股），” 我说。“奥吉！” 妈妈说，但塔什曼先生笑了。“那可真够糟的，” 塔什曼先生摇着头说。“我猜我不该抱怨了。嘿，听着，奥古斯特，这是我今天想的我们的安排......” “那是个南瓜吗？” 我指着塔什曼先生书桌后面的一幅装裱好的画问道。“奥吉，宝贝，别打断，” 妈妈说。

vocab.ex: He always finds something to complain about.
The guide will point to the historical landmarks on our tour.
She has a framed photograph of her family on her desk.
It's considered rude to interrupt someone when they are speaking.

gram.name: 否定祈使句
gram.function: 用于给出指令或要求，告诉某人不要做某事。'don't interrupt' 是妈妈对奥吉行为的直接制止。

example.en: Don't touch that vase; it's very fragile.
example.cn: 别碰那个花瓶；它很易碎。

gram.constraints: 后面必须跟动词原形。

paras.en: "You like it?" said Mr. Tushman, turning around and looking at the painting. "I do, too. And I thought it was a pumpkin, too, until the student who gave it to me explained that it is actually not a pumpkin. It is . . . are you ready for this . . . a portrait of me! Now, August, I ask you: do I really look that much like a pumpkin?" "No!" I answered, though I was thinking yes. Something about the way his cheeks puffed out when he smiled made him look like a jack-o'-lantern. Just as I thought that, it occurred to me how funny that was: cheeks, Mr. Tushman. And I started laughing a little. I shook my head and covered my mouth with my hand. Mr. Tushman smiled like he could read my mind.
paras.cn: “你喜欢它吗？” 塔什曼先生说着，转过身看着那幅画。“我也喜欢。而且我也曾以为那是个南瓜，直到送给我的那个学生解释说它其实不是一个南瓜。它是......你准备好了吗......一幅我的肖像画！现在，奥古斯特，我问你：我真的那么像一个南瓜吗？” “不！” 我回答，尽管我心里想的是“是的”。他微笑时脸颊鼓起的样子让他看起来有点像一个南瓜灯。就在我这么想的时候，我突然意识到这有多好笑：脸颊（cheeks），塔什曼先生（Tushman）。我开始有点笑了。我摇了摇头，用手捂住了嘴。塔什曼先生笑了，好像他能读懂我的心思一样。

vocab.ex: The queen sat for a famous artist to paint her portrait.
The bird puffed out its chest to look bigger.
For Halloween, we carve faces into pumpkins to make jack-o'-lanterns.

vocab.mean: （想法）突然出现在某人脑海中
vocab.ex: It never occurred to me that I might have left the keys in the car.
You must have read my mind; I was just about to suggest we get ice cream.

vocab.mean: 捂住嘴（常用于掩饰笑或惊讶）
vocab.ex: She covered her mouth to stop herself from laughing out loud.
We made a pumpkin pie for Thanksgiving.
Her cheeks turned red when she laughed.

gram.name: that 作为程度副词
gram.function: 在非正式语境中，'that' 可以用作副词，意为“那么”、“那样地”，用来修饰形容词或副词的程度。'...do I really look that much like a pumpkin?' 中的 'that' 强调了相似的程度。

example.en: I'm not that tired, we can walk a little further.
example.cn: 我没那么累，我们能再走远一点。

gram.constraints: 主要用于口语和非正式写作。

paras.en: I was about to say something else, but then all of a sudden I heard other voices outside the office: kids' voices. I'm not exaggerating when I say this, but my heart literally started beating like I'd just run the longest race in the world. The laughter I had inside just poured out of me.
paras.cn: 我正要说点别的，但就在那时，我突然听到了办公室外的其他声音：孩子们的声音。我说这话并不夸张，但我的心真的开始跳动起来，就像我刚跑完了世界上最长的比赛一样。我内心的笑声一下子都消失了。

vocab.ex: Hurry up, the movie is about to start!
We were walking in the park when all of a sudden it started to rain.
He tends to exaggerate his stories to make them more interesting.

vocab.mean: 简直；（用于加强语气的）真的
vocab.ex: It was so cold I literally felt my fingers turning to ice.
After the emotional movie, her feelings just poured out in tears.

gram.name: 使用'literally'的夸张手法
gram.function: 在现代非正式口语中，'literally' 常常被用作强调词，来加强一个比喻或夸张的说法，即使它并非字面上的事实。'...my heart literally started beating like...' 极大地强调了心跳的剧烈程度。

example.en: I was so tired, I literally died when I got home.
example.cn: 我太累了，一到家简直就累死了。

gram.constraints: 这种用法在正式写作中应避免，因为它与 'literally' 的本意（字面上地）相悖。

paras.en: The thing is, when I was little, I never minded meeting new kids because all the kids I met were really little, too. What's cool about really little kids is that they don't say stuff to try to hurt your feelings, even though sometimes they do say stuff that hurts your feelings. But they don't actually know what they're saying. Big kids, though: they know what they're saying. And that is definitely not fun for me. One of the reasons I grew my hair long last year was that I like how my bangs cover my eyes: it helps me block out the things I don't want to see.
paras.cn: 问题是，我小的时候，从来不介意认识新孩子，因为我遇到的所有孩子也都还很小。小小孩很酷的一点是，他们不会为了伤害你的感情而说些什么，尽管有时他们确实会说出伤感情的话。但他们实际上并不知道自己在说什么。不过，大孩子就不一样了：他们知道自己在说什么。而那对我来说绝对不好玩。我去年把头发留长的原因之一是，我喜欢刘海遮住眼睛的感觉：这能帮我挡住那些我不想看到的东西。

vocab.ex: I want to go, but the thing is, I don't have enough money.
Do you mind if I open the window?
Be careful with your words; you don't want to hurt his feelings.
Use these earplugs to block out the noise while you sleep.
She didn’t mean to hurt his feelings with that joke.
He actually likes classical music, though he never says it.
That movie was definitely better than I expected.
She cut her bangs short so they wouldn’t cover her eyes.
The reason I left early was that I felt sick.
Her bangs cover her eyes when she doesn’t tie her hair up.

gram.name: 句中插入语 'though' 表示对比
gram.function: 将 'though' 作为一个独立的插入语放在两个对比的句子之间，可以有效地转换话题并强调两者之间的差异。'Big kids, though: they know what they're saying.' 强烈地对比了“小小孩”和“大孩子”的行为。

example.en: I love summer. Winter, though, is my favorite season.
example.cn: 我爱夏天。不过，冬天是我最喜欢的季节。

gram.constraints: 这是一种非常口语化的表达方式，用标点（冒号或逗号）来分隔。

paras.en: Mrs. Garcia knocked on the door and poked her head inside. "They're here, Mr. Tushman," she said. "Who's here?" I said. "Thanks," said Mr. Tushman to Mrs. Garcia. "August, I thought it would be a good idea for you to meet some students who'll be in your homeroom this year. I figure they could take you around the school a bit, show you the lay of the land, so to speak." "I don't want to meet anyone," I said to Mom.
paras.cn: 加西亚夫人敲了敲门，把头探了进来。“他们到了，塔什曼先生，” 她说。“谁到了？” 我说。“谢谢，” 塔什曼先生对加西亚夫人说。“奥古斯特，我想让你见见今年和你同班的一些同学会是个好主意。我琢磨着他们可以带你逛逛学校，可以说，让你熟悉一下环境。” “我谁也不想见，” 我对妈妈说。

vocab.ex: My boss just poked his head in to say hello.
All students should report to their homeroom at 8 a.m.
