vocab.ex: He tends to mumble when he's nervous, so it's hard to hear him.
Could you please speak up? We can't hear you in the back.
I had to force myself to get out of bed this morning.
I've listed all the ingredients. That's it.

gram.name: 犹豫标记
gram.function: 在对话中用作填充词，表示说话者正在思考、犹豫或不确定。'I, um... have a sister...' and 'And, um... that's it' 真实地反映了主角在紧张状态下说话的不流利。

example.en: I think we should, um, maybe reconsider our plan.
example.cn: 我想我们应该，嗯，也许重新考虑一下我们的计划。

gram.constraints: 是口语的自然组成部分，但在正式演讲或写作中应尽量避免。

paras.en: "Okay, you're next," said Ms. Petosa to Jack. "Wait, I have a question for August," said Julian, raising his hand. "Why do you have that tiny braid in the back of your hair? Is that like a Padawan thing?" "Yeah." I shrug-nodded. "What's a Padawan thing?" said Ms. Petosa, smiling at me. "It's from Star Wars," answered Julian. "A Padawan is a Jedi apprentice."
paras.cn: “好了，下一个是你，” 佩托萨女士对杰克说。“等等，我有个问题要问奥古斯特，” 朱利安举着手说。“你为什么头发后面有根小辫子？那是像帕达瓦学徒那样的东西吗？” “嗯。” 我耸肩点了点头。“什么是帕达瓦的东西？” 佩托萨女士微笑着问我。“那是《星球大战》里的，” 朱利安回答。“帕达瓦是绝地武士的学徒。”

vocab.ex: After she finished her presentation, the teacher said, 'You're next.'
She wore her long hair in a single braid down her back.
In the movie, the young hero begins his training as a Padawan.

vocab.mean: 耸肩点头（表示不情愿或不确定的同意）
vocab.ex: When asked if he agreed, he just gave a little shrug-nod without saying a word.
The story follows the journey of a young Jedi apprentice.

gram.name: 创造性复合动词
gram.function: 通过将两个独立的动作（'shrug' 和 'nod'）组合成一个新词 'shrug-nodded'，作者简洁而生动地描绘了一个复杂的、非语言的反应，传达了不情愿、不确定但又表示同意的混合情绪。

example.en: He half-smiled, half-frowned at the confusing news.
example.cn: 面对这个令人困惑的消息，他半笑半皱眉。

gram.constraints: 是一种文学性的、非标准的构词法，用于增强描述效果。

paras.en: "Oh, interesting," answered Ms. Petosa, looking at me. "So, are you into Star Wars, August?" "I guess." I nodded, not looking up because what I really wanted was to just slide under the desk. "Who's your favorite character?" Julian asked. I started thinking maybe he wasn't so bad. "Jango Fett." "What about Darth Sidious?" he said. "Do you like him?"
paras.cn: “哦，有意思，” 佩托萨女士看着我回答。“那么，你喜欢《星球大战》吗，奥古斯特？” “我猜是吧。” 我点了点头，没有抬头，因为我真正想做的就是滑到桌子底下。“你最喜欢的角色是谁？” 朱利安问。我开始觉得他也许没那么坏。“詹戈·费特。” “那达斯·西迪厄斯呢？” 他说。“你喜欢他吗？”

vocab.ex: My brother is really into classic cars and spends weekends fixing them.
The cat saw the dog and quickly tried to slide under the sofa.

vocab.mean: 詹戈·费特（星球大战角色）
vocab.ex: Jango Fett is a famous bounty hunter in the Star Wars universe.

vocab.mean: 达斯·西迪厄斯（星球大战角色）
vocab.ex: Darth Sidious is one of the main villains in the Star Wars saga.

gram.name: 强调句型 (What... is/was...)
gram.function: 用于强调句子中的某个特定部分，通常是动作的对象或内容。'what I really wanted was to just slide under the desk' 强调了他当时最强烈的愿望是“躲起来”。

example.en: What he needs most right now is a good rest.
example.cn: 他现在最需要的是好好休息。

gram.constraints: 由 'what' 引导的主语从句充当句子的主语。

paras.en: Now it was Jack's turn to talk, but I admit I didn't hear a word he said. Maybe no one got the Darth Sidious thing, and maybe Julian didn't mean anything at all. But in Star Wars Episode III: Revenge of the Sith, Darth Sidious's face gets burned by Sith lightning and becomes totally deformed. His skin gets all shriveled up and his whole face just kind of melts.
paras.cn: 现在轮到杰克说话了，但我承认我一个字也没听进去。也许没人明白达斯·西迪厄斯的梗，也许朱利安根本没有任何恶意。但是在《星球大战前传3：西斯的复仇》中，达斯·西迪厄斯的脸被西斯闪电烧伤，变得完全畸形。他的皮肤都皱缩起来，整张脸都有点融化了。

vocab.ex: He told a complicated joke, but nobody seemed to get it.
The accident left his hand permanently deformed.
The leaves on the plant shriveled up from lack of water.
The ice cream started to melt in the hot sun.

gram.name: 使用 'maybe' 进行推测
gram.function: 用于表达不确定性或对情况的可能性进行推测。通过 'Maybe no one got...' 和 'maybe Julian didn't mean...'，主角展现了他内心的挣扎：一方面希望对方是无辜的，另一方面又感到不安。

example.en: He hasn't arrived yet. Maybe he missed the train.
example.cn: 他还没到。也许他错过了火车。

gram.constraints: 通常放在句首。

paras.en: I peeked at Julian and he was looking at me. Yeah, he knew what he was saying.
paras.cn: 我偷偷看了朱利安一眼，他正在看着我。是的，他知道自己在说什么。

vocab.ex: The child peeked at the presents under the Christmas tree.

vocab.mean: 知道自己在说什么（指话里有话，有深层含义）
vocab.ex: From the smirk on his face, I could tell he knew exactly what he was saying.

gram.name: 简短陈述句
gram.function: 在一段内心独白和描述之后，使用一个非常简短、肯定的陈述句 'Yeah, he knew what he was saying.'，可以创造出一种强烈的顿悟感和结论性。它简洁有力地结束了主角的内心挣扎，确认了朱利安的恶意。

example.en: After hours of searching, he found the key. He was finally free.
example.cn: 经过数小时的搜寻，他找到了钥匙。他终于自由了。

gram.constraints: 其力量来自于与前后较长句子的对比。

paras.en: There was a lot of shuffling around when the bell rang and everybody got up to leave. I checked my schedule and it said my next class was English, room 321. I didn't stop to see if anyone else from my homeroom was going my way: I just zoomed out of the class and down the hall and sat down as far from the front as possible. The teacher, a really tall man with a yellow beard, was writing on the chalkboard.
paras.cn: 铃声响起，大家起身准备离开时，一片嘈杂的挪动声。我查了我的课程表，上面说我下一节课是英语，在321室。我没有停下来看有没有同班同学和我同路：我只是飞快地冲出教室，沿着走廊跑去，坐在了离前面尽可能远的位置。老师，一个留着黄色胡子的高个子男人，正在黑板上写字。

vocab.ex: I could hear the shuffling of feet in the hallway outside.
Since you're going my way, could you give me a ride?
The sports car zoomed past us on the highway.
He threw the ball as far as possible.

gram.name: 同位语短语
gram.function: 用于对前面的名词进行补充说明或重新命名。'...a really tall man with a yellow beard...' 是对名词 'The teacher' 的补充描述，功能上起到了同位语的作用。

example.en: My brother, a doctor at the local hospital, is coming for dinner.
example.cn: 我的兄弟，当地医院的一名医生，要来吃晚饭。

gram.constraints: 同位语与它所修饰的词在逻辑上指的是同一事物。

paras.en: Kids came in laughing and talking in little groups but I didn't look up. Basically, the same thing that happened in homeroom happened again: no one sat next to me except for Jack, who was joking around with some kids who weren't in our homeroom. I could tell Jack was the kind of kid other kids like. He had a lot of friends. He made people laugh.
paras.cn: 孩子们笑着、三三两两地聊着天走了进来，但我没有抬头。基本上，在班级教室发生的事情又发生了一遍：除了杰克，没人坐在我旁边，而他正和一些不是我们班的孩子开着玩笑。我看得出杰克是那种别的孩子会喜欢的小孩。他有很多朋友。他能逗人发笑。

vocab.ex: She didn't look up from her book when I entered the room.
The students were joking around before the teacher arrived.
He's the kind of kid who is always getting into trouble.

gram.name: 现在分词作状语
gram.function: 用于描述与主句动作同时发生的伴随动作或方式。'Kids came in laughing and talking' 生动地描绘了孩子们进教室时的情景。

example.en: She ran out of the house crying for help.
example.cn: 她哭着喊救命跑出了房子。

gram.constraints: 分词的逻辑主语必须是主句的主语。

paras.en: When the second bell rang, everyone got quiet and the teacher turned around and faced us. He said his name was Mr. Browne, and then he started talking about what we would be doing this semester. At a certain point, somewhere between A Wrinkle in Time and Shen of the Sea, he noticed me but kept right on talking. I was mostly doodling in my notebook while he talked, but every once in a while I would sneak a look at the other students. Charlotte was in this class. So were Julian and Henry. Miles wasn't.
paras.cn: 当第二声铃响时，大家都安静了下来，老师转过身来面对我们。他说他叫布朗先生，然后开始谈论我们这个学期将要做些什么。在某个时刻，大约在讲到《时间的皱纹》和《沈氏海》之间，他注意到了我，但还是继续讲着。他说话的时候我大部分时间都在我的笔记本上涂鸦，但偶尔我会偷偷地看一眼其他学生。夏洛特在这个班。朱利安和亨利也是。迈尔斯不在。

vocab.ex: Please get quiet, the movie is about to start.
At a certain point in the conversation, I realized he was not telling the truth.
Even though the phone rang, she kept right on working.
He was doodling little flowers in the margin of his notebook.
I don't eat fast food often, but I enjoy a burger every once in a while.
She tried to sneak a look at the answers during the test.

gram.name: so 引起的倒装
gram.function: 用于表示“……也是如此”，以避免重复前文的谓语部分。'So were Julian and Henry' 等于 'Julian and Henry were in this class, too'。这是一种更简洁、更地道的表达方式。

example.en: She is a doctor, and so is her brother.
example.cn: 她是一名医生，她的哥哥也是。

gram.constraints: 助动词或be动词的形式需与主语和前文时态保持一致。

paras.en: Mr. Browne had written on the chalkboard in big block letters: P-R-E-C-E-P-T! "Okay, everybody write this down at the very top of the very first page in your English notebook." As we did what he told us to do, he said: "Okay, so who can tell me what a precept is? Does anyone know?" No one raised their hands. Mr. Browne smiled, nodded, and turned around to write on the chalkboard again: PRECEPTS = RULES ABOUT REALLY IMPORTANT THINGS!
paras.cn: 布朗先生用大号印刷体字母在黑板上写道：信条！“好了，大家把这个写在你们英语笔记本第一页的最顶端。” 当我们照他说的做时，他说：“好了，那么谁能告诉我什么是信条？有人知道吗？” 没人举手。布朗先生笑了笑，点了点头，然后转过身又在黑板上写道：信条 = 关于非常重要事情的规则！

vocab.ex: Please print your name in block letters on the form.
One of his guiding precepts was to always be honest.
She signed her name at the very top of the page.

gram.name: 直接祈使句
gram.function: 用于给出清晰、直接的指令。'everybody write this down...' 是老师给全班下达的明确指令。

example.en: Open your books to page ten.
example.cn: 请把书翻到第十页。

gram.constraints: 以动词原形开头。

paras.en: "Like a motto?" someone called out. "Like a motto!" said Mr. Browne, nodding as he continued writing on the board. "Like a famous quote. Like a line from a fortune cookie. Any saying or ground rule that can motivate you. Basically, a precept is anything that helps guide us when making decisions about really important things." He wrote all that on the chalkboard and then turned around and faced us.
paras.cn: “像座右铭一样？” 有人喊道。“就像座右铭！” 布朗先生说，一边点头一边继续在黑板上写。“像一句名言。像幸运饼干里的一句话。任何能够激励你的格言或基本原则。基本上，信条就是任何在我们就非常重要的事情做决定时帮助指导我们的东西。” 他把所有这些都写在了黑板上，然后转过身来面对我们。

vocab.ex: "Never give up" is her personal motto.
At the end of the meal, the waiter brought us fortune cookies.
Let's establish some ground rules before we start the discussion.
His success story motivated me to work harder.
A mentor can guide you in your career choices.

gram.name: 使用 'Like' 进行重复举例
gram.pattern: Like a... Like a... Like a...
gram.function: 通过重复使用 'Like a...' 结构，老师层层递进地给出了多个例子来解释 'precept' 这个抽象概念，使定义变得更具体、更易于理解。

example.en: He has many hobbies, like painting, like hiking, like playing the guitar.
example.cn: 他有很多爱好，比如画画、徒步、弹吉他。

gram.constraints: 是一种有效的解释和举例的修辞手法。

paras.en: "So, what are some really important things?" he asked us. A few kids raised their hands, and as he pointed at them, they gave their answers, which he wrote on the chalkboard in really, really sloppy handwriting: RULES. SCHOOLWORK. HOMEWORK. "What else?" he said as he wrote, not even turning around. "Just call things out!" He wrote everything everyone called out. FAMILY. PARENTS. PETS. One girl called out: "The environment!" THE ENVIRONMENT. he wrote on the chalkboard, and added: OUR WORLD!
paras.cn: “那么，什么是真正重要的事情呢？” 他问我们。几个孩子举起了手，当他指向他们时，他们给出了答案，他用非常非常潦草的字迹把答案写在黑板上：规则。学业。作业。“还有什么？” 他边写边说，甚至没有转身。“直接喊出来就行！” 他把每个人喊出的东西都写了下来。家庭。父母。宠物。一个女孩喊道：“环境！” 环境。他写在黑板上，并补充道：我们的世界！

vocab.ex: His handwriting is so sloppy I can barely read it.
She has very neat handwriting.
He had to call out her name twice before she heard him.
We must do more to protect the environment.

gram.name: 祈使句
gram.function: 用于给出直接的指令或鼓励。'Just call things out!' 是一种鼓励学生自由发言的非正式指令。

example.en: Think of an answer and write it down.
example.cn: 想一个答案，然后把它写下来。

gram.constraints: 以动词原形开头。

paras.en: "Sharks, because they eat dead things in the ocean!" said one of the boys, a kid named Reid, and Mr. Browne wrote down SHARKS. "Bees!" "Seatbelts!" "Recycling!" "Friends!" "Okay," said Mr. Browne, writing all those things down. He turned around when he finished writing to face us again. "But no one's named the most important thing of all." We all looked at him, out of ideas.
paras.cn: “鲨鱼，因为它们吃海洋里的死东西！” 其中一个男孩，一个名叫里德的孩子说，布朗先生写下了“鲨鱼”。“蜜蜂！” “安全带！” “回收！” “朋友！” “好的，” 布朗先生说，把所有这些都写了下来。他写完后转过身来再次面对我们。“但没有人说出最重要的事情。” 我们都看着他，想不出主意了。

vocab.ex: Recycling is an important way to protect our planet.

vocab.mean: 在所有…之中（用于加强最高级）
vocab.ex: This is the best movie of all.
We've tried everything; we're completely out of ideas on how to fix it.

gram.name: 最高级 (the most...)
gram.function: 用于在三者或三者以上的范围内进行比较，表示程度最高。'the most important thing of all' 强调了某件事的至高重要性。

example.en: Honesty is the most important quality in a friendship.
example.cn: 诚实是友谊中最重要的品质。

gram.constraints: 用于多音节形容词前。

paras.en: "God?" said one kid, and I could tell that even though Mr. Browne wrote "God" down, that wasn't the answer he was looking for. Without saying anything else, he wrote down: WHO WE ARE! "Who we are," he said, underlining each word as he said it. "Who we are! Us! Right? What kind of people are we? What kind of person are you? Isn't that the most important thing of all? Isn't that the kind of question we should be asking ourselves all the time? "What kind of person am I?"
paras.cn: “上帝？” 一个孩子说，我看得出尽管布朗先生写下了“上帝”，但那不是他想要的答案。他没再说什么，直接写下了：我们是谁！“我们是谁，” 他说，一边说一边给每个词划下划线。“我们是谁！我们！对吧？我们是哪种人？你是哪种人？这难道不是所有事情中最重要的一件吗？这难道不是我们应该一直问自己的那种问题吗？“我是哪种人？”

vocab.ex: I'm looking for my keys; have you seen them anywhere?
The teacher asked us to underline the main ideas in the text.
He complains about his job all the time.

gram.name: 反问句（用于强调）
gram.pattern: A question asked for effect, not for an answer.
gram.function: 说话者连续提出一系列问题，但并不期望得到回答，而是为了引导听众思考并强调自己的观点。老师通过一系列关于“我们是谁”的反问，将课堂的焦点引向一个更深层次的哲学问题。

example.en: After all I've done for you, is this how you repay me?
example.cn: 我为你做了这么多，你就是这样回报我的吗？

gram.constraints: 其功能是表达观点或引发思考，而非获取信息。

paras.en: "Did anyone happen to notice the plaque next to the door of this school? Anyone read what it says? Anyone?" He looked around but no one knew the answer. "It says: 'Know Thyself,' " he said, smiling and nodding. "And learning who you are is what you're here to do." "I thought we were here to learn English," Jack cracked, which made everyone laugh. "Oh yeah, and that, too!" Mr. Browne answered, which I thought was very cool of him.
paras.cn: “有人碰巧注意到这所学校门口旁边的牌匾吗？有人读了上面写了什么吗？有人吗？” 他环顾四周，但没人知道答案。“上面写着：‘认识你自己’，” 他微笑着点头说。“而学习你是谁，就是你们来这里的目的。” “我以为我们是来学英语的，” 杰克开了个玩笑，这让大家都笑了。“哦是的，还有那个！” 布朗先生回答，我觉得他这样很酷。

vocab.ex: Did you happen to see my wallet anywhere?
There is a commemorative plaque on the wall of the historic building.
The ancient Greek aphorism "know thyself" is a cornerstone of Western philosophy.
He's always cracking jokes and making everyone laugh.
It was very cool of him to stand up for his friend.

gram.name: 强调句型 (What... is...)
gram.function: 用于强调句子中的某个特定部分。'...learning who you are is what you're here to do' 将 'learning who you are' 置于句首进行强调，指明了来这里的“真正目的”。

example.en: A good education is what everyone deserves.
example.cn: 良好的教育是每个人都应得的。

variants: What you're here to do is learn who you are.
gram.constraints: 这是一种倒装的强调结构。

paras.en: He turned around and wrote in big huge block letters that spread all the way across the chalkboard: MR. BROWNE'S SEPTEMBER PRECEPT: WHEN GIVEN THE CHOICE BETWEEN BEING RIGHT OR BEING KIND, CHOOSE KIND.
paras.cn: 他转过身，用巨大无比的印刷体字母写满了整个黑板：布朗先生的九月信条：当在正确与善良之间做出选择时，选择善良。

vocab.ex: They live in a huge house with ten bedrooms.
The news spread across the country in a matter of hours.
One of his guiding precepts was to always be honest.
You have a choice between the red one and the blue one.
It was very kind of you to help me.

gram.name: 简化的状语从句（When + 过去分词）
gram.function: 当状语从句的主语与主句主语相同（此处为隐含的 'you'），且从句为被动语态时，可以省略主语和be动词。'WHEN (you are) GIVEN THE CHOICE...' 是一种非常简洁和有力的书面语表达。

example.en: When asked a question, you should always answer honestly.
example.cn: 当被问及问题时，你应该总是诚实回答。

gram.constraints: 从句必须是被动语态。

paras.en: "Okay, so, everybody," he said, facing us again, "I want you to start a brand-new section in your notebooks and call it Mr. Browne's Precepts." He kept talking as we did what he was telling us to do. "Put today's date at the top of the first page. And from now on, at the beginning of every month, I'm going to write a new Mr. Browne precept on the chalkboard and you're going to write it down in your notebook. Then we're going to discuss that precept and what it means. And at the end of the month, you're going to write an essay about it, about what it means to you. So by the end of the year, you'll all have your own list of precepts to take away with you.
paras.cn: “好了，那么，各位，” 他再次面对我们说，“我希望你们在笔记本上开始一个全新的部分，并称之为‘布朗先生的信条’。” 在我们照他说的做时，他继续说着。“把今天的日期写在第一页的顶端。从现在开始，每个月初，我都会在黑板上写一条新的布朗先生的信条，你们要把它抄在笔记本上。然后我们会讨论那条信条以及它的含义。月底，你们要就它写一篇文章，关于它对你的意义。所以到年底，你们每个人都会有自己的一份信条清单可以带走。

vocab.ex: He bought a brand-new car.
This section of the library is for reference books only.
From now on, I promise to be on time.
Let's discuss the plan for the weekend.
What is the main point you want the audience to take away from your speech?

gram.name: be going to (表示计划)
gram.function: 用于描述已经决定好的、未来的计划或打算。老师用了一系列 'I'm going to...' 和 'you're going to...' 来清晰地阐述本学期的教学计划和对学生的要求。

example.en: We are going to visit our grandparents this weekend.
example.cn: 我们这个周末打算去看望我们的祖父母。

gram.constraints: 通常指已有预谋的未来活动。

paras.en: "Over the summer, I ask all my students to come up with their very own personal precept, write it on a postcard, and mail it to me from wherever you go on your summer vacation." "People really do that?" said one girl whose name I didn't know. "Oh yeah!" he answered, "people really do that. I've had students send me new precepts years after they've graduated from this school, actually. It's pretty amazing."
paras.cn: “在暑假期间，我要求我所有的学生想出他们自己独有的个人信条，写在明信片上，然后从你们暑假去的任何地方寄给我。” “人们真的会这么做吗？” 一个我不知道名字的女孩说。“哦是的！” 他回答，“人们真的会这么做。实际上，我曾有学生在从这所学校毕业多年后还寄给我新的信条。这真是太神奇了。”

vocab.ex: She came up with a great idea for the project.
This is my personal opinion, and others may disagree.
He sent me a postcard from his trip to Italy.
She will graduate from college next year.
The magician performed some amazing tricks.

gram.name: 强调助动词 (do)
gram.function: 在肯定句中使用助动词 'do/does' 来强调谓语动词，通常用于回应质疑或确认某事。“People really do that?” 是学生表示怀疑的提问，而老师回答 “people really do that” 则是用强调的语气来确认事实。

example.en: A: You don't like spinach. B: No, I do like it!
example.cn: A：你不喜欢菠菜。B：不，我确实喜欢！

gram.constraints: 助动词后必须跟动词原形。

paras.en: He paused and stroked his beard. "But, anyway, next summer seems like a long way off, I know," he joked, which made us laugh. "So, everybody relax a bit while I take attendance, and then when we're finished with that, I'll start telling you about all the fun stuff we're going to be doing this year—in English." He pointed to Jack when he said this, which was also funny, so we all laughed at that.
paras.cn: 他停顿了一下，捋了捋他的胡子。“但是，不管怎样，我知道明年夏天似乎还很遥远，” 他开玩笑说，这让我们都笑了。“所以，大家放松一下，我来点名，然后点完名后，我就开始告诉你们我们今年将要做的所有有趣的事情——在英语课上。” 他说这话时指向了杰克，那也很好笑，所以我们都为此笑了。

vocab.ex: He paused to take a sip of water before continuing his speech.
She gently stroked the cat's soft fur.
Retirement seems like a long way off when you're young.
He was only joking when he said he was quitting his job.

gram.name: which 指代整个动作
gram.function: 在非限定性定语从句中，'which' 可以指代前面整个主句所描述的动作或事实。'...he joked, which made us laugh' 和 'He pointed to Jack..., which was also funny' 中的 'which' 都指代了前面描述的整个事件，并说明了其结果。

example.en: He tripped over his own feet, which made everyone in the room laugh.
example.cn: 他被自己的脚绊倒了，这让房间里的所有人都笑了。

gram.constraints: 必须用逗号与主句隔开。

paras.en: As I wrote down Mr. Browne's September precept, I suddenly realized that I was going to like school. No matter what.
paras.cn: 当我写下布朗先生的九月信条时，我突然意识到我将会喜欢上学。无论如何。

vocab.ex: One of his guiding precepts was to always be honest.
The weather changed suddenly, and it started to rain.
He didn't realize his mistake until it was too late.
I'll support you, no matter what happens.

gram.name: 简短结论性短语
gram.function: 在一个完整的句子之后，紧跟一个非常简短、独立的短语，可以起到极强的强调作用。'No matter what.' 作为一个独立的句子出现，有力地强调了主角下定决心的坚定性，不受任何条件影响。

example.en: He decided to leave. For good.
example.cn: 他决定离开。永远地。

gram.constraints: 是一种文学和修辞手法，用于增强语气。

paras.en: Via had warned me about lunch in middle school, so I guess I should have known it would be hard. I just hadn't expected it to be this hard. Basically, all the kids from all the fifth-grade classes poured into the cafeteria at the same time, talking loudly and bumping into one another while they ran to different tables.
paras.cn: 维娅曾警告过我关于中学午餐的事，所以我猜我本该知道会很难。我只是没想到会这么难。基本上，所有五年级的孩子都同时涌入餐厅，大声交谈，在跑向不同餐桌时互相碰撞。

vocab.ex: My parents warned me about talking to strangers.
As soon as the gates opened, the crowd poured into the stadium.
Students eat their lunch in the school cafeteria.
Be careful not to bump into the table and spill the drinks.

gram.name: should have + 过去分词
gram.function: 表示“本应该做某事但实际上没做”，用于对过去的行为或认知表示遗憾或后知后觉。'I should have known it would be hard' 表达了主角事后的想法。

example.en: I missed the bus. I should have left home earlier.
example.cn: 我错过了公交车。我本应该早点出门的。

variants: shouldn't have + pp (本不该做但做了)
gram.constraints: 用于虚拟语气，谈论与过去事实相反的情况。

paras.en: One of the lunchroom teachers said something about no seat-saving allowed, but I didn't know what she meant and maybe no one else did, either, because just about everybody was saving seats for their friends. I tried to sit down at one table, but the kid in the next chair said, "Oh, sorry, but somebody else is sitting here."
paras.cn: 一位餐厅老师说了些关于不允许占座的话，但我不知道她是什么意思，也许其他人也不知道，因为几乎每个人都在为他们的朋友占座。我试着在一张桌子旁坐下，但邻座的孩子说：“哦，对不起，但这里有人坐了。”

vocab.ex: The bell rang, and all the students headed to the lunchroom.
In a crowded library, seat-saving is often frowned upon.
Smoking is not allowed inside the building.
I'm just about finished with my homework.

gram.name: 名词性从句作宾语
gram.function: 用作动词的宾语，说明动作的内容。'I didn't know what she meant' 中的 'what she meant' 就是动词 'know' 的宾语。

example.en: Can you tell me where the nearest station is?
example.cn: 你能告诉我最近的车站在哪里吗？

gram.constraints: 从句内部使用陈述语序，而非疑问语序。

paras.en: So I moved to an empty table and just waited for everyone to finish stampeding and the lunchroom teacher to tell us what to do next. As she started telling us the cafeteria rules, I looked around to see where Jack Will was sitting, but I didn't see him on my side of the room. Kids were still coming in as the teachers started calling the first few tables to get their trays and stand on line at the counter. Julian, Henry, and Miles were sitting at a table toward the back of the room.
paras.cn: 于是我移到一张空桌子旁，只是等着所有人都停止蜂拥而入，等着餐厅老师告诉我们接下来该做什么。当她开始告诉我们餐厅规则时，我环顾四周想看看杰克·威尔坐在哪里，但我没有在房间我这边看到他。当老师们开始叫前几桌去拿餐盘并在柜台前排队时，孩子们还在陆续进来。朱利安、亨利和迈尔斯正坐在房间后方的一张桌子旁。

vocab.ex: When the store opened, shoppers began to stampede towards the sales rack.
He carried his lunch on a plastic tray.
We had to stand on line for an hour to buy tickets.
Please place your order at the counter.

gram.name: wait for sb. to do sth.
gram.function: 表示“等待某人做某事”。'waited for everyone to finish...' 和 '...the lunchroom teacher to tell us...' 清晰地表达了主角等待的两个并列事件。

example.en: We are all waiting for the rain to stop.
example.cn: 我们都在等雨停。

gram.constraints: 不定式 'to do' 是宾语 'someone' 将要执行的动作。

paras.en: Mom had packed me a cheese sandwich, graham crackers, and a juice box, so I didn't need to stand on line when my table was called. Instead, I just concentrated on opening my backpack, pulling out my lunch bag, and slowly opening the aluminum-foil wrapping of my sandwich. I could tell I was being stared at without even looking up. I knew that people were nudging each other, watching me out of the corners of their eyes. I thought I was used to those kinds of stares by now, but I guess I wasn't.
paras.cn: 妈妈给我打包了一个奶酪三明治、全麦饼干和一盒果汁，所以当叫到我们桌时我不需要去排队。相反，我只是专注于打开我的背包，拿出我的午餐袋，然后慢慢地打开我三明治的铝箔包装。我甚至不用抬头就能感觉到我正被人盯着看。我知道人们在互相推搡，用眼角余光看着我。我以为我现在已经习惯了那种眼神，但我猜我并没有。

vocab.ex: She always packs a healthy lunch for her son.
Many people enjoy graham crackers with milk.
Please concentrate on your driving and not on your phone.
She wrapped the leftovers in aluminum-foil before putting them in the fridge.
She gave him a gentle nudge to wake him up.

vocab.word: out of the corners of their eyes
vocab.ph: /aʊt əv ðə ˈkɔːrnərz əv ðer aɪz/
vocab.ex: She saw someone following her out of the corners of her eyes.

gram.name: 被动语态进行时
gram.function: 表示一个正在发生的被动动作。'I was being stared at' 强调了“被盯着看”这个动作在当时是持续进行的，生动地传达了主角的不安感。

example.en: The house is being painted this week.
example.cn: 这周房子正在被粉刷。

gram.constraints: 用于描述正在进行的被动事件。

paras.en: There was one table of girls that I knew were whispering about me because they were talking behind their hands. Their eyes and whispers kept bouncing over to me. I hate the way I eat. I know how weird it looks. I had a surgery to fix my cleft palate when I was a baby, and then a second cleft surgery when I was four, but I still have a hole in the roof of my mouth. And even though I had jaw-alignment surgery a few years ago, I have to chew food in the front of my mouth. I didn't even realize how this looked until I was at a birthday party once, and one of the kids told the mom of the birthday boy he didn't want to sit next to me because I was too messy with all the food crumbs shooting out of my mouth.
paras.cn: 有一桌女孩，我知道她们在小声议论我，因为她们用手遮着嘴说话。她们的目光和悄悄话不停地向我飘来。我讨厌我吃东西的样子。我知道那看起来有多奇怪。我婴儿时期做过一次修复腭裂的手术，四岁时又做了第二次，但我嘴巴的上颚还有一个洞。而且尽管几年前我做过下颌矫正手术，我还是得用嘴的前部咀嚼食物。我甚至都没意识到这看起来是什么样子，直到有一次在一个生日派对上，其中一个孩子告诉寿星的妈妈他不想坐我旁边，因为我吃东西太邋遢了，食物碎屑会从我嘴里喷出来。

vocab.ex: The students started to whisper during the quiet exam.
Her attention kept bouncing over to the TV screen.
The charity raises money for children who need surgery for their cleft palate.
Jaw-alignment surgery can help with chewing problems.
Cooking can be a messy job, but it's fun.
He brushed the cake crumbs off his shirt.

gram.name: 抽象名词拟人化
gram.function: 通过将属于具体事物的动作（'bouncing'）赋予抽象的事物（'eyes and whispers'），作者创造了一种生动、有侵入感的意象，让读者能真切地感受到被议论时的不适。

example.en: Fear crept into his heart as he walked through the dark forest.
example.cn: 当他走过黑暗的森林时，恐惧悄悄爬入他的心中。

gram.constraints: 是一种文学修辞手法，用于使抽象概念更具形象感。

paras.en: I know the kid wasn't trying to be mean, but he got in big trouble later, and his mom called my mom that night to apologize. When I got home from the party, I went to the bathroom mirror and started eating a saltine cracker to see what I looked like when I was chewing. The kid was right. I eat like a tortoise, if you've ever seen a tortoise eating. Like some prehistoric swamp thing.
paras.cn: 我知道那孩子不是故意要刻薄，但他后来惹上了大麻烦，他妈妈那天晚上打电话给我妈妈道歉。我从派对回到家后，走到浴室的镜子前，开始吃一片苏打饼干，看看我咀嚼时是什么样子。那个孩子是对的。我吃东西像一只乌龟，如果你见过乌龟吃东西的话。就像某种史前的沼泽生物。

vocab.ex: He got in trouble at school for talking during class.
You should apologize for being so rude.
When I'm sick, I can usually only eat soup and saltine crackers.
The old tortoise moved slowly across the grass.
Dinosaurs are prehistoric animals.
Alligators often live in the swamp.

gram.name: 明喻（含条件从句）
gram.function: 通过比喻来生动地描述事物。'...eat like a tortoise' 是一个直接的比喻。后面紧跟的条件从句 'if you've ever seen a tortoise eating' 是一种与读者互动的方式，邀请读者调用自己的经验来理解这个比喻，使其更具说服力。随后的 'Like some prehistoric swamp thing' 是一个更夸张、更具情感色彩的补充比喻。

example.en: He snores like a bear, if you've ever heard one.
example.cn: 他打鼾像熊一样，如果你听过的话。

gram.constraints: 是一种增强比喻效果的文学技巧。

paras.en: "Hey, is this seat taken?" I looked up, and a girl I never saw before was standing across from my table with a lunch tray full of food. She had long wavy brown hair, and wore a brown T-shirt with a purple peace sign on it. "Uh, no," I said. She put her lunch tray on the table, plopped her backpack on the floor, and sat down across from me. She started to eat the mac and cheese on her plate. "Ugh," she said after the swallowing the first bite. "I should have brought a sandwich like you did." "Yeah," I said, nodding.
paras.cn: “嘿，这个座位有人吗？” 我抬起头，一个我从未见过的女孩正端着装满食物的午餐托盘站在我的桌子对面。她有一头长长的棕色卷发，穿着一件带有紫色和平标志的棕色T恤。“呃，没有，” 我说。她把午餐托盘放在桌上，把背包“扑通”一声扔在地板上，然后坐在我的对面。她开始吃盘子里的通心粉和奶酪。“呃，” 她咽下第一口后说。“我真该像你一样带个三明治。” “是啊，” 我点着头说。

vocab.ex: Before sitting down in the crowded cafe, she asked, "Excuse me, is this seat taken?"
She has beautiful, long wavy hair.
The hippie's van was decorated with flowers and a large peace sign.
Exhausted, she plopped her heavy bags on the floor.
Mac and cheese is a classic comfort food for many people.

gram.name: should have + 过去分词
gram.function: 表示“本应该做某事但实际上没做”，用于对过去的行为表示遗憾或后悔。'I should have brought a sandwich' 表达了Summer对自己午餐选择的后悔。

example.en: It's cold today. I should have worn a warmer jacket.
example.cn: 今天很冷。我本应该穿一件更暖和的夹克的。

variants: shouldn't have + pp (本不该做但做了)
gram.constraints: 用于虚拟语气，谈论与过去事实相反的情况。

paras.en: "My name is Summer, by the way. What's yours?" "August." "Cool," she said. "Summer!" Another girl came over to the table carrying a tray. "Why are you sitting here? Come back to the table." "It was too crowded," Summer answered her. "Come sit here. There's more room." The other girl looked confused for a second. I realized she had been one of the girls I had caught looking at me just a few minutes earlier: hand cupped over her mouth, whispering. I guess Summer had been one of the girls at that table, too. "Never mind," said the girl, leaving. Summer looked at me, shrugged-smiled, and took another bite of her mac and cheese.
paras.cn: “顺便说一下，我叫萨默。你叫什么？” “奥古斯特。” “酷，” 她说。“萨默！” 另一个端着托盘的女孩走到桌边。“你为什么坐在这里？回我们那桌来。” “那里太挤了，” 萨默回答她。“来坐这里。这里地方更大。” 另一个女孩困惑地看了一会儿。我意识到她就是几分钟前我发现看着我的女孩之一：手捂着嘴，窃窃私语。我猜萨默之前也是那桌的女孩之一。“算了，” 那个女孩说着，走开了。萨默看着我，耸肩笑了笑，又吃了一口她的通心粉和奶酪。

vocab.ex: By the way, did you finish your homework?
The train was so crowded I couldn't find a seat.
I'm a little confused by the instructions; can you explain them again?
I can't find my keys... oh, never mind, here they are.

vocab.mean: 耸肩微笑（表示无奈或随和）
vocab.ex: When asked about the delay, the official just shrug-smiled.

gram.name: 祈使句（用于邀请）
gram.function: 用于给出直接的指令或邀请。'Come sit here' 是Summer对她朋友发出的一个直接而友好的邀请。

example.en: Come join us, there's plenty of room!
example.cn: 来加入我们吧，地方多的是！

gram.constraints: 以动词原形开头。

paras.en: "Hey, our names kind of match," she said as she chewed. I guess she could tell I didn't know what she meant. "Summer? August?" she said, smiling, her eyes open wide, as she waited for me to get it. "Oh, yeah," I said after a second. "We can make this the 'summer only' lunch table," she said. "Only kids with summer names can sit here. Let's see, is there anyone here named June or July?"
paras.cn: “嘿，我们的名字有点配呢，” 她边嚼边说。我猜她能看出我不知道她是什么意思。“萨默（夏天）？奥古斯特（八月）？” 她说，微笑着，眼睛睁得大大的，等着我明白过来。“哦，是的，” 我过了一会儿说。“我们可以把这张桌子变成‘仅限夏天’的午餐桌，” 她说。“只有名字和夏天有关的孩子才能坐在这里。让我想想，这里有叫琼（六月）或朱莉（七月）的吗？”

vocab.ex: Does this shirt match these pants?
Remember to chew your food slowly.
It's a complex joke, so don't worry if you don't get it at first.
What do I need from the store? Let's see... milk, bread, and eggs.

gram.name: 独立主格结构（含形容词）
gram.function: 在句子中作状语，提供附加的细节或伴随状态。'...her eyes open wide...' 描述了Summer在等待主角明白过来时的神情，生动地补充了画面感。

example.en: He listened to the story, his mouth wide open in amazement.
example.cn: 他听着故事，惊讶地张大了嘴巴。

gram.constraints: 其逻辑主语与主句主语不同。

paras.en: "There's a Maya," I said. "Technically, May is spring," Summer answered, "but if she wanted to sit here, we could make an exception." She said it as if she'd actually thought the whole thing through. "There's a kid named Reid in my English class," I said. "Yeah, I know Reid, but how is Reid a summer name?" she asked. "I don't know." I shrugged. "I just picture, like, a reed of grass being a summer thing." "Yeah, okay." She nodded, pulling out her notebook.
paras.cn: “有个叫玛雅的，” 我说。“严格来说，五月（May）是春天，” 萨默回答，“但如果她想坐这里，我们可以破例。” 她说这话的口气好像她真的把整件事都想透了似的。“我英语课上有一个叫里德的孩子，” 我说。“是的，我认识里德，但里德怎么会是夏天的名字呢？” 她问。“我不知道。” 我耸了耸肩。“我只是想象，比如，一根芦苇（reed）是夏天的东西。” “嗯，好吧。” 她点了点头，拿出了她的笔记本。

vocab.ex: Technically, a tomato is a fruit, not a vegetable.
The rule is no pets, but they decided to make an exception for her small dog.
Before you make a big decision, you should think it through carefully.
The boat moved quietly through the tall reeds along the riverbank.

gram.name: as if / as though 从句
gram.function: 用于引出一个方式状语从句，进行比喻或描述看起来像的情景，意为“好像；仿佛”。'She said it as if she'd actually thought the whole thing through' 描述了Summer说话时的认真神态。

example.en: He acted as if nothing had happened.
example.cn: 他表现得好像什么事都没发生过一样。

gram.constraints: 当描述与事实相反的假设时，从句中常使用虚拟语气。

paras.en: "And Ms. Petosa could sit here, too. That kind of sounds like the word 'petal,' which I think of as a summer thing, too." "I have her for homeroom," I said. "I have her for math," she answered, making a face. She started writing the list of names on the second-to-last page of her notebook. "So, who else?" she said. By the end of lunch, we had come up with a whole list of names of kids and teachers who could sit at our table if they wanted. Most of the names weren't actually summer names, but they were names that had some kind of connection to summer.
paras.cn: “佩托萨女士也可以坐这里。这个名字听起来有点像‘花瓣’（petal）这个词，我也觉得那是夏天的东西。” “她是我的班主任，” 我说。“她是我的数学老师，” 她回答，做了个鬼脸。她开始在她笔记本的倒数第二页上写下名字列表。“那么，还有谁？” 她说。到午餐结束时，我们已经想出了一整串孩子和老师的名字，如果他们愿意，都可以坐在我们的桌子旁。大多数名字其实都不是夏天的名字，但它们是和夏天有某种联系的名字。

vocab.ex: His story doesn't sound like the truth to me.
A single rose petal fell onto the table.
I've always thought of her as my best friend.
The child made a face when he had to eat his vegetables.
She came up with a great idea for the project.

gram.name: By the end of (时间点)
gram.pattern: By the end of + [time period], + clause
gram.function: 表示“到…结束时”，用于设定一个时间终点，主句的动作在该时间点之前已经完成。'By the end of lunch, we had come up with a whole list...' 使用了过去完成时来表示“想出名单”这个动作在午餐结束前完成了。

example.en: By the end of the day, I had finished all my work.
example.cn: 到一天结束时，我已经完成了我所有的工作。

gram.constraints: 主句通常使用完成时态。

paras.en: I even found a way of making Jack Will's name work by pointing out that you could turn his name into a sentence about summer, like "Jack will go to the beach," which Summer agreed worked fine. "But if someone doesn't have a summer name and wants to sit with us," she said very seriously, "we'll still let them if they're nice, okay?" "Okay." I nodded. "Even if it's a winter name." "Cool beans," she answered, giving me a thumbs-up. Summer looked like her name. She had a tan, and her eyes were green like a leaf.
paras.cn: 我甚至找到了一个让杰克·威尔的名字也说得通的方法，我指出你可以把他的名字变成一个关于夏天的句子，比如“杰克将（will）要去海滩”，萨默同意这个也行。“但如果有人没有夏天的名字又想和我们坐在一起，” 她非常严肃地说，“如果他们人好，我们还是会让他们坐的，好吗？” “好的。” 我点了点头。“即使是冬天的名字也行。” “酷毙了，” 她回答，给了我一个大拇指。萨默看起来就像她的名字。她有古铜色的皮肤，她的眼睛像叶子一样绿。

vocab.ex: The plan seems difficult, but I think we can make it work.
He was quick to point out my mistakes.
You need to take this warning seriously.
"I finished the project!" "Cool beans! Let's celebrate."
She gave me a thumbs-up to show that everything was okay.
He came back from his vacation with a deep tan.

gram.name: look like (用于比较)
gram.function: 用于描述外貌或特征上的相似性。'Summer looked like her name' 是一个富有诗意的比喻，暗示她的外表（古铜色皮肤、绿眼睛）与“夏天”这个概念给人的感觉相符。

example.en: That cloud looks like a dragon.
example.cn: 那朵云看起来像一条龙。

gram.constraints: 是一种常见的描述性语言。

paras.en: Mom always had this habit of asking me how something felt on a scale of one to ten. It started after I had my jaw surgery, when I couldn't talk because my mouth was wired shut. They had taken a piece of bone from my hip bone to insert into my chin to make it look more normal, so I was hurting in a lot of different places. Mom would point to one of my bandages, and I would hold up my fingers to show her how much it was hurting. One meant a little bit. Ten meant so, so, so much. Then she would tell the doctor when he made his rounds what needed adjusting or things like that. Mom got very good at reading my mind sometimes.
paras.cn: 妈妈总有这个习惯，用一到十的等级来问我感觉如何。这始于我做完下颌手术后，那时我的嘴被钢丝固定住了，无法说话。他们从我的髋骨取了一块骨头植入我的下巴，让它看起来更正常一些，所以我身上很多不同的地方都在疼。妈妈会指着我的一块绷带，我就会举起手指告诉她有多疼。一根手指代表有一点点疼。十根手指代表非常非常非常疼。然后当医生来查房时，她就会告诉他需要调整什么或者类似的事情。妈妈有时变得非常善于读懂我的心思。

vocab.word: on a scale of one to ten
vocab.ph: /ɒn ə skeɪl əv wʌn tuː ten/
vocab.ex: The doctor asked him to rate his pain on a scale of one to ten.
After his jaw surgery, his mouth was wired shut for six weeks.
The doctor usually makes his rounds in the morning to check on patients.
The machine needs some minor adjusting to work properly.
You must have read my mind; I was just about to suggest we get ice cream.

gram.name: 使用 'would' 表示过去习惯
gram.function: 用于描述过去反复发生的习惯性动作，常带有讲故事的色彩。'Mom would point...' 和 'I would hold up my fingers...' 描述了他们之间反复发生的交流方式。

example.en: When I was a kid, my grandfather would tell me stories every night.
example.cn: 我小时候，我爷爷每晚都会给我讲故事。

gram.constraints: 'would'不能用于描述过去的状态，只能用于描述动作。

paras.en: After that, we got into the habit of doing the one-to-ten scale for anything that hurt, like if I just had a plain old sore throat, she'd ask: "One to ten?" And I'd say: "Three," or whatever it was. When school was over, I went outside to meet Mom, who was waiting for me at the front entrance like all the other parents or babysitters. The first thing she said after hugging me was: " So, how was it? One to ten?" "Five," I said, shrugging, which I could tell totally surprised her. "Wow," she said quietly, "that's even better than I hoped for."
paras.cn: 那之后，我们养成了对任何疼痛都用一到十等级来衡量的习惯，比如如果我只是得了普通的喉咙痛，她会问：“一到十？” 我会说：“三，” 或者不管是什么数字。放学后，我到外面去见妈妈，她和其他所有家长或保姆一样，在正门等我。她拥抱我之后说的第一件事是：“那么，怎么样？一到十？” “五，” 我耸着肩说，我看得出这让她完全惊讶了。“哇，” 她轻声说，“这比我希望的还要好。”

vocab.ex: I'm trying to get into the habit of exercising every morning.
It wasn't anything special, just a plain old cheeseburger.
I have a sore throat, so it hurts when I swallow.
When asked where he had been, he just answered with a shrugging gesture.
The result was better than we had hoped for.

gram.name: 比较级 (even better than)
gram.function: 用于比较两者，并通过'even'来强调两者之间的差距之大。'that's even better than I hoped for' 强调了结果不仅好，而且远超预期。

example.en: The second movie was even more exciting than the first one.
example.cn: 第二部电影甚至比第一部更精彩。

gram.constraints: 用于加强比较级的语气。

paras.en: "Are we picking Via up?" "Miranda's mother is picking her up today. Do you want me to carry your backpack, sweetness?" We had started walking through the crowd of kids and parents, most of whom were noticing me, "secretly" pointing me out to each other. "I'm fine," I said. "It looks too heavy, Auggie." She started to take it from me. "Mom!" I said, pulling my backpack away from her. I walked in front of her through the crowd.
paras.cn: “我们去接维娅吗？” “米兰达的妈妈今天接她。你想让我帮你背背包吗，小甜心？” 我们开始穿过由孩子和家长组成的人群，他们中的大多数人都在注意我，“偷偷地”互相指着我。“我没事，” 我说。“它看起来太重了，奥吉。” 她开始想从我身上把它拿下来。“妈！” 我说，把我的背包从她那里拉开。我从人群中走到了她的前面。

vocab.ex: Can you pick me up from the airport tomorrow?
"Good morning, sweetness," she said to her daughter.
A large crowd gathered to watch the parade.
The witness was asked to point out the suspect in a lineup.
The child tried to pull his hand away from his mother's.

gram.name: 引号（用于反讽）
gram.function: 将一个词放在引号里，可以暗示这个词正在被反讽地使用，或者叙述者并不相信它的字面意思。在这里，'secretly' 加引号表明这种“偷偷地”的行为对主角来说是显而易见的，一点也不秘密。

example.en: He offered me his "help", but I knew he just wanted to get in the way.
example.cn: 他向我提供了他的“帮助”，但我知道他只是想碍事。

gram.constraints: 是一种传达叙述者态度的 subtle（微妙的）修辞手法。

paras.en: "See you tomorrow, August!" It was Summer. She was walking in the opposite direction. "Bye, Summer," I said, waving at her. As soon as we crossed the street and were away from the crowd, Mom said: "Who was that, Auggie?" "Summer." "Is she in your class?" "I have lots of classes." "Is she in any of your classes?" Mom said. "Nope." Mom waited for me to say something else, but I just didn't feel like talking.
paras.cn: “明天见，奥古斯特！” 是萨默。她正朝着相反的方向走。“再见，萨默，” 我说着，向她挥了挥手。我们一穿过街道，远离人群，妈妈就说：“那是谁啊，奥吉？” “萨默。” “她在你的班上吗？” “我有很多课。” “她在你的任何一门课上吗？” 妈妈说。“没。” 妈妈等着我再说点什么，但我就是不想说话。

vocab.ex: They were walking in the opposite direction, so we didn't meet.
Please keep the dog away from the furniture.
"Are you tired?" "Nope, I'm full of energy!"
I'm tired; I don't feel like cooking tonight.

gram.name: 回避性对话
gram.pattern: Answering a specific question with a general or vague statement.
gram.function: 当角色不想直接回答一个问题时，他们可能会给出一个模糊或笼统的回答。当妈妈问 'Is she in your class?'（一个具体问题）时，奥吉回答 'I have lots of classes'（一个笼统的事实），以此来回避直接回答，表明他不想深入这个话题。

example.en: A: Did you finish the report? B: I've been very busy today.
example.cn: A：你完成报告了吗？B：我今天一直很忙。

gram.constraints: 是一种常见的社交策略，用于避免冲突或不想透露信息。

paras.en: "So it went okay?" said Mom. I could tell she had a million questions she wanted to ask me. "Everyone was nice? Did you like your teachers?" "Yeah." "How about those kids you met last week? Were they nice?" "Fine, fine. Jack hung out with me a lot." "That's so great, sweetie. What about that boy Julian?"
paras.cn: “所以一切都还顺利吗？” 妈妈说。我看得出她有一百万个问题想问我。“大家都友善吗？你喜欢你的老师吗？” “嗯。” “上周你见到的那些孩子怎么样？他们友善吗？” “还好，还好。杰克跟我玩了很久。” “那太好了，宝贝。那个叫朱利安的男孩怎么样？”

vocab.ex: Don't worry about your presentation; I'm sure it will go okay.
After the trip, my parents had a million questions for me.
I like this shirt, but how about the blue one?
He likes to hang out with his friends on the weekend.

gram.name: 快速提问（用于获取信息）
gram.pattern: A series of short, direct questions.
gram.function: 说话者通过提出一系列简短、直接的问题，来快速地了解情况，同时也反映出其内心的焦虑和急切。妈妈的一连串问题显示了她对儿子第一天上学情况的极度关心。

example.en: "Did you have fun? Who was there? What did you do?" she asked as soon as he walked in.
example.cn: 他一进门，她就问道：“你玩得开心吗？谁在那儿？你都做了些什么？”

gram.constraints: 是一种在对话中常见的、表达强烈兴趣或担忧的方式。

paras.en: I thought about that Darth Sidious comment. By now it felt like that had happened a hundred years ago. "He was okay," I said. "And the blond girl, what was her name?" "Charlotte. Mom, I said everyone was nice already." "Okay," Mom answered. I honestly don't know why I was kind of mad at Mom, but I was. We crossed Amesfort Avenue, and she didn't say anything else until we turned onto our block.
paras.cn: 我想起了那个关于达斯·西迪厄斯的评论。到这时，感觉那事好像已经发生了一百年前了。“他还行，” 我说。“那个金发女孩呢，她叫什么名字？” “夏洛特。妈，我已经说了每个人都很好。” “好的，” 妈妈回答。我真的不知道为什么我有点生妈妈的气，但我就是生气了。我们穿过艾姆斯福特大道，她再没说什么，直到我们拐上我们自己家的街区。

vocab.ex: He made a rude comment about her new haircut.
You should know the rules by now; you've been here long enough.
Honestly, I don't think that's a good idea.
Please don't be mad at me for being late.

gram.name: 表达自我困惑
gram.function: 用于表达对自己情感或行为原因的不解。'I honestly don't know why I was kind of mad at Mom' 真实地反映了孩子有时无法清晰地分析自己复杂情绪的状态。

example.en: I honestly don't know why I said that; it was a stupid thing to say.
example.cn: 我真的不知道我为什么那么说；那话太蠢了。

gram.constraints: 是一种常见的自我反思的表达。

paras.en: "So," Mom said. "How did you meet Summer if she wasn't in any of your classes?" "We sat together at lunch," I said. I had started kicking a rock between my feet like it was a soccer ball, chasing it back and forth across the sidewalk. "She seems very nice." "Yeah, she is." "She's very pretty," Mom said. "Yeah, I know," I answered. "We're kind of like Beauty and the Beast."
paras.cn: “所以，” 妈妈说。“如果萨默不在你的任何一门课上，你是怎么认识她的？” “我们午餐时坐在一起，” 我说。我开始用脚踢着一块石头，像踢足球一样，让它在人行道上来回滚动。“她看起来人很好。” “是的，她是。” “她很漂亮，” 妈妈说。“是的，我知道，” 我回答。“我们有点像《美女与野兽》。”

vocab.ex: My best friend and I always sit together in class.
The children were kicking a ball around in the park.
The tennis players hit the ball back and forth over the net.
Their relationship reminded everyone of the classic story, Beauty and the Beast.

gram.name: 文学典故
gram.pattern: Reference to a well-known story, person, or event.
gram.function: 通过引用广为人知的童话故事《美女与野兽》，主角用一个简洁的比喻，深刻地表达了他对自己外貌和与Summer关系的看法，传达了复杂的情感和自我认知。

example.en: He has a Herculean task ahead of him to finish the project on time.
example.cn: 要按时完成这个项目，他面临着一项赫拉克勒斯般的艰巨任务。

gram.constraints: 其效果依赖于读者对所引用典故的熟悉程度。

paras.en: I didn't wait to see Mom's reaction. I just started running down the sidewalk after the rock, which I had kicked as hard as I could in front of me.
paras.cn: 我没有等看妈妈的反应。我只是开始沿着人行道追着那块石头跑，我刚刚用尽全力把它踢到了我前面。

vocab.ex: Her reaction to the surprise party was priceless; she was so happy.
It's safer for pedestrians to walk on the sidewalk.
She pushed the heavy door as hard as she could.

gram.name: 用行动回避情感
gram.pattern: Emotional statement + immediate physical action of escape.
gram.function: 在说出一句充满情感和脆弱的话（“我们有点像《美女与野兽》”）之后，主角立刻通过一个剧烈的身体动作（“开始跑”）来逃避接下来的对话和可能的情感反应。这是一种在叙事中展示人物内心回避和脆弱的有效技巧。

example.en: After saying 'I'm sorry,' he quickly left the room without waiting for a reply.
example.cn: 说完“对不起”后，他迅速离开了房间，没有等待回复。

gram.constraints: 动作通常反映了角色的内心状态。

paras.en: That night I cut off the little braid on the back of my head. Dad noticed first. "Oh good," he said. "I never liked that thing." Via couldn't believe I had cut it off. "That took you years to grow!" she said, almost like she was angry. "Why did you cut it off?" "I don't know," I answered. "Did someone make fun of it?" "No." "Did you tell Christopher you were cutting it off?" "We're not even friends anymore!" "That's not true," she said. "I can't believe you would just cut it off like that," she added snottily, and then practically slammed my bedroom door shut as she left the room.
paras.cn: 那天晚上，我剪掉了后脑勺上的小辫子。爸爸先注意到了。“哦，太好了，” 他说。“我从来就不喜欢那东西。” 维娅简直不敢相信我把它剪掉了。“你花了好几年才长成那样！” 她说，几乎像是生气了。“你为什么把它剪掉？” “我不知道，” 我回答。“有人取笑它了吗？” “没有。” “你告诉克里斯托弗你要剪掉它了吗？” “我们甚至不再是朋友了！” “那不是真的，” 她说。“我真不敢相信你就那样把它剪掉了，” 她没好气地补充道，然后在离开房间时几乎是把我的卧室门砰地一声关上了。

vocab.ex: He decided to cut off his long hair for the summer.
She wore her long hair in a single braid down her back.
It's not kind to make fun of someone just because they are different.
She answered the question snottily, as if it were a stupid thing to ask.
The wind caused the door to slam shut.

gram.name: 表达不相信
gram.function: 用于表达对某件事的惊讶、震惊或难以置信。'Via couldn't believe...' 和 'I can't believe you would just cut it off...' 都表达了维娅对弟弟行为的强烈反应。

example.en: I can't believe you forgot my birthday!
example.cn: 我真不敢相信你忘了我的生日！

gram.constraints: 后面通常跟一个由 'that' 引导的宾语从句，'that' 可以省略。

paras.en: I was snuggling with Daisy on my bed when Dad came to tuck me in later. He scooched Daisy over gently and lay down next to me on the blanket. "So, Auggie Doggie," he said, "it was really an okay day?" He got that from an old cartoon about a dachshund named Auggie Doggie, by the way. He had bought it for me on eBay when I was about four, and we watched it a lot for a while—especially in the hospital. He would call me Auggie Doggie and I would call him "dear ol' Dad," like the puppy called the dachshund dad on the show.
paras.cn: 我后来正和黛西依偎在床上时，爸爸进来给我盖被子。他轻轻地把黛西挪开，躺在我旁边的毯子上。“那么，奥吉狗狗，” 他说，“今天真的是还不错的一天吗？” 顺便说一下，这个外号是他从一部关于一只叫奥吉狗狗的腊肠犬的老动画片里学来的。大约在我四岁的时候，他在eBay上给我买了这个动画片，我们有一段时间看了很多遍——尤其是在医院里。他会叫我奥吉狗狗，我则会叫他“亲爱的老爸”，就像动画片里的小狗叫他腊肠犬爸爸那样。

vocab.ex: The kitten snuggled close to its mother for warmth.
Every night, the mother would tuck her children in and read them a story.
Could you scooch over a bit so I can sit down?
His pet dachshund had very short legs and a long body.

gram.name: 使用 'would' 表示过去习惯
gram.function: 用于描述过去反复发生的习惯性动作。'He would call me Auggie Doggie and I would call him...' 描述了他们过去反复发生的互动方式。

example.en: When I lived in the countryside, I would go for a long walk every morning.
example.cn: 我住在乡下的时候，每天早上都会去散很长的步。

gram.constraints: 'would'不能用于描述过去的状态，只能用于描述动作。

paras.en: "Yeah, it was totally okay," I said, nodding. "You've been so quiet all night long." "I guess I'm tired." "It was a long day, huh?" I nodded. "But it really was okay?" I nodded again. He didn't say anything, so after a few seconds, I said: "It was better than okay, actually." "That's great to hear, Auggie," he said quietly, kissing my forehead. "So it looks like it was a good call Mom made, your going to school."
paras.cn: “是的，完全没问题，” 我点着头说。“你一整晚都那么安静。” “我猜我累了。” “是漫长的一天，是吧？” 我点了点头。“但真的没问题吗？” 我又点了点头。他没说话，所以几秒钟后，我说：“实际上，比没问题还要好。” “听到这个太好了，奥吉，” 他轻声说，亲吻我的额头。“所以看来妈妈让你去上学是个正确的决定。”

vocab.ex: After the children went to bed, the house was finally quiet.
It's a beautiful day, huh?
He wiped the sweat from his forehead with the back of his hand.
Bringing an umbrella was a good call; it started raining minutes later.

gram.name: 所有格 + 动名词
gram.function: 在动名词前使用所有格（如 my, your, his, John's），可以明确指出该动作的执行者。这是一种较为正式的书面语用法。'...a good call Mom made, your going to school' 中，'your going to school' 指的是“你去上学”这件事。

example.en: I appreciate your helping me with this difficult task.
example.cn: 我很感激你帮我完成这项艰巨的任务。

variants: Object Pronoun + GERUND-ing (less formal, e.g., 'you going to school')
gram.constraints: 在正式语境中，使用所有格更受青睐。

paras.en: "Yeah. But I could stop going if I wanted to, right?" "That was the deal, yes," he answered. "Though I guess it would depend on why you wanted to stop going, too, you know. You'd have to let us know. You'd have to talk to us and tell us how you're feeling, and if anything bad was happening. Okay? You promise you'd tell us?" "Yeah." "So can I ask you something? Are you mad at Mom or something? You've been kind of huffy with her all night long. You know, Auggie, I'm as much to blame for sending you to school as she is."
paras.cn: “是的。但如果我想，我可以不去，对吧？” “是的，那是我们说好的，” 他回答。“不过我猜那也要看你为什么想不去，你知道的。你得让我们知道。你得跟我们谈，告诉我们你的感受，以及是否发生了什么不好的事。好吗？你保证会告诉我们吗？” “嗯。” “那么我能问你点事吗？你是不是生妈妈的气了？你一整晚对她都有点气呼呼的。你知道，奥吉，在送你去上学这件事上，我和她一样有责任。”

vocab.ex: We shook hands because that was the deal we agreed on.
Our picnic plan will depend on the weather.
She got all huffy when I pointed out her mistake.
The driver was not to blame for the accident.

gram.name: as much as (比较责任)
gram.function: 用于表示两者在某个（通常是不可数的）方面程度相同。'I'm as much to blame... as she is' 意思是“我和她负有同等的责任”，用于公平地分担责任。

example.en: He has as much experience in this field as I do.
example.cn: 他和我一样在这个领域有同样多的经验。

gram.constraints: 是一种同级比较。

paras.en: "No, she's more to blame. It was her idea." Mom knocked on the door just then and peeked her head inside my room. "Just wanted to say good night," she said. She looked kind of shy for a second. "Hi, Momma," Dad said, picking up my hand and waving it at her. "I heard you cut off your braid," Mom said to me, sitting down at the edge of the bed next to Daisy. "It's not a big deal," I answered quickly. "I didn't say it was," said Mom.
paras.cn: “不，她责任更大。那是她的主意。” 就在那时，妈妈敲了敲门，把头探进我的房间。“只是想来说声晚安，” 她说。她有一瞬间看起来有点害羞。“嗨，妈咪，” 爸爸说，拿起我的手对着她挥了挥。“我听说你剪掉了你的辫子，” 妈妈对我说，坐在黛西旁边的床沿上。“没什么大不了的，” 我迅速回答。“我没说那是大事，” 妈妈说。

vocab.ex: Although both were involved, he was more to blame for the argument.
My boss just peeked his head in to say hello.
The little girl was shy and hid behind her mother.
Don't worry about breaking the glass; it's not a big deal.

gram.name: 转述意图 (Just wanted to...)
gram.function: 一种委婉、非正式的表达意图的方式。通过省略主语 'I'，'Just wanted to say good night' 听起来更像是一个随意的、不打扰的拜访，而不是一个正式的声明。

example.en: Just wanted to let you know I'm leaving now.
example.cn: 就是想告诉你我现在要走了。

gram.constraints: 常见于口语和非正式的短信、邮件中。

paras.en: "Why don't you put Auggie to bed tonight?" Dad said to Mom, getting up. "I've got some work to do anyway. Good night, my son, my son." That was another part of our Auggie Doggie routine, though I wasn't in the mood to say Good night, dear ol' Dad. "I'm so proud of you," said Dad, and then he got up out of the bed. Mom and Dad had always taken turns putting me to bed. I know it was a little babyish of me to still need them to do that, but that's just how it was with us.
paras.cn: “今晚你来给奥吉弄上床睡觉怎么样？” 爸爸对妈妈说，一边站起来。“反正我还有些工作要做。晚安，我的儿子，我的儿子。” 那是我们“奥吉狗狗”常规程序的另一部分，尽管我当时没心情说“晚安，亲爱的老爸”。“我真为你骄傲，” 爸爸说，然后他从床上起来了。爸爸妈妈一直轮流哄我上床睡觉。我知道我还需要他们这样做有点孩子气，但我们之间就是这样。

vocab.ex: It's time to put the children to bed.
My morning routine includes a cup of coffee and reading the news.
I'm not in the mood for a party tonight.
The siblings take turns washing the dishes.
His tantrum was very babyish for a ten-year-old.

gram.name: That's how it was
gram.function: 用于描述一种既定的、无法或不愿改变的状况或习惯，带有一种接受和“就是这样”的意味。'...but that's just how it was with us' 表达了这种哄睡习惯在他们家是一种自然而然的存在。

example.en: I know it's strange, but that's just how he is.
example.cn: 我知道这很奇怪，但他就是那样的人。

gram.constraints: 是一种非正式的、表达接受现状的说法。

paras.en: "Will you check in on Via?" Mom said to Dad as she lay down next to me. He stopped by the door and turned around. "What's wrong with Via?" "Nothing," said Mom, shrugging, "at least that she would tell me. But . . . first day of high school and all that." "Hmm," said Dad, and then he pointed his finger at me and winked. "It's always something with you kids, isn't it?" he said. "Never a dull moment," said Mom. "Never a dull moment," Dad repeated. "Good night, guys."
paras.cn: “你去看看维娅好吗？” 妈妈躺在我旁边时对爸爸说。他在门口停下来，转过身。“维娅怎么了？” “没什么，” 妈妈耸着肩说，“至少她是不会告诉我的。但是......高中第一天，诸如此类的。” “嗯，” 爸爸说，然后他用手指着我，眨了眨眼。“你们这些孩子总是有事，不是吗？” 他说。“从没有无聊的时刻，” 妈妈说。“从没有无聊的时刻，” 爸爸重复道。“晚安，各位。”

vocab.ex: Could you check in on the baby to make sure she's still sleeping?
He winked at me to show that he was only joking.
First the car broke down, and now the roof is leaking. It's always something!

vocab.mean: 从没有无聊的时刻（指生活充满变化和意外）
vocab.ex: With three young children in the house, there's never a dull moment.

gram.name: 附加疑问句
gram.function: 附加在陈述句后，用于寻求对方的同意或确认。'It's always something with you kids, isn't it?' 是爸爸在寻求妈妈的认同。

example.en: It's a beautiful day, isn't it?
example.cn: 今天天气真好，不是吗？

gram.constraints: 通常遵循“前肯后否，前否后肯”的原则。

paras.en: As soon as he closed the door, Mom pulled out the book she'd been reading to me for the last couple of weeks. I was relieved because I really was afraid she'd want to "talk," and I just didn't feel like doing that. But Mom didn't seem to want to talk, either. She just flipped through the pages until she got to where we had left off. We were about halfway through The Hobbit .
paras.cn: 他一关上门，妈妈就拿出了她过去几周一直在读给我听的那本书。我松了口气，因为我真的怕她想“谈谈”，而我只是不想那么做。但妈妈似乎也不想谈。她只是翻着书页，直到找到我们上次停下的地方。我们大概读到了《霍比特人》的一半。

vocab.ex: He pulled out his wallet to pay for the coffee.

vocab.mean: 松了一口气的；感到宽慰的
vocab.ex: I was so relieved to hear that you were safe.
She flipped through the magazine while waiting.
Let's start again from where we left off yesterday.
We are already halfway through the movie.

gram.name: 过去完成进行时
gram.function: 表示一个在过去某个时间点之前一直在持续的动作。'...the book she'd been reading to me...' 强调了“读书给我听”这个动作在过去的一段时间里是持续进行的。

example.en: His eyes were red because he had been crying.
example.cn: 他的眼睛红了，因为他之前一直在哭。

gram.constraints: 强调动作的持续性。

paras.en: " 'Stop! stop! ' shouted Thorin," said Mom, reading aloud, "but it was too late, the excited dwarves had wasted their last arrows, and now the bows that Beorn had given them were useless. "They were a gloomy party that night, and the gloom gathered still deeper on them in the following days. They had crossed the enchanted stream; but beyond it the path seemed to straggle on just as before, and in the forest they could see no change."
paras.cn: “‘停下！停下！’ 索林喊道，” 妈妈朗读道，“但为时已晚，兴奋的矮人们已经浪费了他们最后的箭，现在比翁给他们的弓都无用了。“那天晚上他们是一群忧郁的队伍，而在接下来的日子里，忧郁在他们身上聚集得更深了。他们已经穿过了魔法溪流；但在那之后，小路似乎和以前一样蜿蜒前行，在森林里他们看不到任何变化。”

vocab.ex: The teacher asked the student to read the poem aloud to the class.
The fairy tale featured seven dwarves living in a cottage.
The rainy weather made everyone feel gloomy.
They walked through an enchanted forest where the trees could talk.
The old road seemed to straggle on for miles through the empty landscape.

gram.name: 对话中引用文学语言
gram.function: 通过直接引用《霍比特人》中的段落，作者巧妙地利用了书中的情节（迷失、忧郁、看不到变化）来映衬和放大主角内心的感受。这是一种“文中之文”的技巧，用外部故事来揭示角色的内在世界。

example.en: Reading the line 'It was the best of times, it was the worst of times' made her reflect on her own contradictory life.
example.cn: 读到“那是最好的时代，也是最坏的时代”这句，让她反思自己矛盾重重的生活。

gram.constraints: 这是一种高级的文学技巧，可以增加文本的层次感和深度。

paras.en: I'm not sure why, but all of a sudden I started to cry. Mom put the book down and wrapped her arms around me. She didn't seem surprised that I was crying. "It's okay," she whispered in my ear. "It'll be okay." "I'm sorry," I said between sniffles. "Shh," she said, wiping my tears with the back of her hand. "You have nothing to be sorry about. . . ."
paras.cn: 我不确定为什么，但突然之间我开始哭了。妈妈放下书，用双臂抱住我。她似乎对我哭泣并不感到惊讶。“没事的，” 她在我耳边低语。“会没事的。” “对不起，” 我在抽泣声中说。“嘘，” 她说，用手背擦去我的眼泪。“你没有什么好对不起的......”

vocab.ex: We were walking in the park when all of a sudden it started to rain.
She wrapped her arms around her friend in a warm hug.
I could hear his sniffles from the other room.
Please wipe your feet before you come inside.

gram.name: have nothing to be sorry about
gram.function: 一种安慰性的表达，意思是“没什么好…的”。'You have nothing to be sorry about' 是妈妈用来安慰儿子，告诉他哭泣或他的感受都不是他的错。

example.en: You tried your best; you have nothing to be ashamed of.
example.cn: 你已经尽力了；你没什么好羞愧的。

gram.constraints: 是一种常见的、表达安慰和支持的句型。

paras.en: "Why do I have to be so ugly, Mommy?" I whispered. "No, baby, you're not . . ." "I know I am." She kissed me all over my face. She kissed my eyes that came down too far. She kissed my cheeks that looked punched in. She kissed my tortoise mouth. She said soft words that I know were meant to help me, but words can't change my face.
paras.cn: “为什么我非得这么丑，妈咪？” 我低声说。“不，宝贝，你不是……” “我知道我是。” 她亲遍了我的整张脸。她亲吻了我长得太靠下的眼睛。她亲吻了我看起来像被打凹进去的脸颊。她亲吻了我的乌龟嘴。她说了一些温柔的话，我知道那些话是为了帮助我，但言语改变不了我的脸。

vocab.ex: He felt insecure and thought he was ugly.
The car door was punched in after the accident.
The author uses the metaphor 'tortoise mouth' to describe a specific facial feature.
The joke was meant to be funny, but it just offended people.

gram.name: 排比与首语重复法 (She kissed...)
gram.pattern: Repetition of a phrase at the beginning of successive clauses.
gram.function: 通过在连续的句子开头重复 'She kissed...'，作者建立了一种强烈的节奏感，并有力地强调了母亲无条件的爱和接纳。这种手法通过列举亲吻主角每一个“不完美”的部位，将抽象的爱具体化，极具感染力。

example.en: He loved the city. He loved its busy streets. He loved its towering buildings. He loved its vibrant energy.
example.cn: 他爱这座城市。他爱它繁忙的街道。他爱它高耸的建筑。他爱它充满活力的能量。

gram.constraints: 是一种强有力的修辞手法，用于强调和增强情感。

title: Wake Me Up when September Ends

paras.en: The rest of September was hard. I wasn't used to getting up so early in the morning. I wasn't used to this whole notion of homework. And I got my first "quiz" at the end of the month. I never got "quizzes" when Mom homeschooled me. I also didn't like how I had no free time anymore. Before, I was able to play whenever I wanted to, but now it felt like I always had stuff to do for school.
paras.cn: 九月剩下的日子很难熬。我不习惯早上起那么早。我不习惯作业这个全新的概念。而且月底我有了我的第一次“测验”。妈妈在家教我的时候，我从来没有过“测验”。我也不喜欢我现在没有任何自由时间了。以前，我想玩的时候随时都可以玩，但现在感觉我总有学校的事情要做。

vocab.ex: I ate two cookies and saved the rest of them for later.
After living in the city for a year, he was used to the noise.
The notion of a four-day work week is becoming more popular.
We have a pop quiz in history class today.
Some parents choose to homeschool their children for various reasons.

gram.name: 首语重复法 (I wasn't used to...)
gram.pattern: Repetition of a phrase at the beginning of successive clauses.
gram.function: 通过在连续的句子开头重复 'I wasn't used to...'，作者建立了一种强烈的节奏感，并有力地强调了主角在适应新学校生活时所面临的多个方面的困难。

example.en: I was tired of the noise. I was tired of the crowds. I was tired of the city.
example.cn: 我厌倦了噪音。我厌倦了人群。我厌倦了这座城市。

gram.constraints: 是一种强有力的修辞手法，用于强调和列举。

paras.en: And being at school was awful in the beginning. Every new class I had was like a new chance for kids to "not stare" at me. They would sneak peeks at me from behind their notebooks or when they thought I wasn't looking. They would take the longest way around me to avoid bumping into me in any way, like I had some germ they could catch, like my face was contagious.
paras.cn: 而且刚开始在学校的日子很糟糕。我上的每一节新课都像是给孩子们一个“不盯着我”的新机会。他们会从笔记本后面，或者在他们以为我没看的时候偷偷看我。他们会绕最远的路来避开我，以任何方式避免碰到我，就好像我身上有什么他们会感染的病菌，好像我的脸会传染一样。

vocab.ex: The weather was awful, so we stayed inside all day.
She tried to sneak peeks at the answers on her friend's paper.
Be careful not to bump into the table and spill the drinks.
Washing your hands helps to remove germs.
The flu is highly contagious, so stay home if you are sick.

gram.name: 使用 'like' 的明喻
gram.function: 用于将一事物与另一事物进行直接比较，以创造生动的形象。通过 'like I had some germ...' 和 'like my face was contagious' 这两个连续的比喻，作者强烈地传达了主角被他人排斥和孤立时的感受。

example.en: He ran like his life depended on it.
example.cn: 他跑得像性命攸关一样。

gram.constraints: 'Like' 后面可以跟一个从句，在非正式语境中很常见。

paras.en: In the hallways, which were always crowded, my face would always surprise some unsuspecting kid who maybe hadn't heard about me. The kid would make the sound you make when you hold your breath before going underwater, a little "uh!" sound. This happened maybe four or five times a day for the first few weeks: on the stairs, in front of the lockers, in the library.
paras.cn: 在总是很拥挤的走廊里，我的脸总会吓到一些毫无防备的、可能还没听说过我的孩子。那个孩子会发出你在下水前屏住呼吸时发出的那种声音，一种小小的“呃！”的声音。在最初的几周里，这种事一天大概会发生四五次：在楼梯上，在储物柜前，在图书馆里。

vocab.ex: The students rushed down the hallway to their next class.
The train was so crowded I couldn't find a seat.

vocab.mean: 毫无防备的；不起疑心的
vocab.ex: The practical joke was played on an unsuspecting coworker.
Everyone held their breath as the gymnast attempted the difficult move.
He forgot the combination to his school locker.

gram.name: 描述性定语从句
gram.function: 用于详细描述或定义先行词，使其更具体。'the sound you make when you hold your breath...' 通过一个包含时间状语从句的复杂定语从句，非常精确地描述了一种难以用单一词语形容的声音。

example.en: I love the feeling you get when you finish a long run.
example.cn: 我喜欢长跑结束后你所获得的那种感觉。

gram.constraints: 作宾语的关系代词 'that' 被省略了。

paras.en: Five hundred kids in a school: eventually every one of them was going to see my face at some time. And I knew after the first couple of days that word had gotten around about me, because every once in a while I'd catch a kid elbowing his friend as they passed me, or talking behind their hands as I walked by them. I can only imagine what they were saying about me. Actually, I prefer not to even try to imagine it.
paras.cn: 一所学校有五百个孩子：最终他们每一个人都会在某个时候看到我的脸。而且在最初几天后我就知道，关于我的消息已经传开了，因为我时不时会发现有孩子在我经过时用胳膊肘碰他的朋友，或者在我走过时用手捂着嘴说话。我只能想象他们在说我什么。其实，我宁愿根本不去想它。

vocab.ex: After many attempts, he eventually succeeded.
Word had gotten around that the company was closing, so everyone started looking for new jobs.
I don't eat fast food often, but I enjoy a burger every once in a while.
She elbowed me to get my attention.
Can you imagine a world without music?

gram.name: 表达内心冲突
gram.pattern: Statement of possibility + Statement of avoidance.
gram.function: 通过前后矛盾的两个句子 'I can only imagine...' 和 'I prefer not to even try to imagine it'，作者生动地展现了主角内心的冲突：他无法抑制地去想象别人在说什么，但同时又因为害怕而极力抗拒这种想象。

example.en: I know I should call him. But I just can't bring myself to do it.
example.cn: 我知道我应该给他打电话。但我就是没法强迫自己那么做。

gram.constraints: 是一种展示角色内心挣扎的有效技巧。

paras.en: I'm not saying they were doing any of these things in a mean way, by the way: not once did any kid laugh or make noises or do anything like that. They were just being normal dumb kids. I know that. I kind of wanted to tell them that. Like, it's okay, I'm know I'm weird-looking, take a look, I don't bite. Hey, the truth is, if a Wookiee started going to the school all of a sudden, I'd be curious, I'd probably stare a bit! And if I was walking with Jack or Summer, I'd probably whisper to them: Hey, there's the Wookiee. And if the Wookiee caught me saying that, he'd know I wasn't trying to be mean. I was just pointing out the fact that he's a Wookiee.
paras.cn: 顺便说一下，我不是说他们做这些事是出于恶意：没有一个孩子笑话我、发出怪声或做任何类似的事。他们只是普通的傻孩子。我知道的。我有点想告诉他们。比如，没关系，我知道我长得怪，你们看吧，我又不咬人。嘿，事实是，如果一个伍基人突然开始来上学，我也会好奇，我可能也会盯一会儿！而且如果我和杰克或萨默一起走，我可能会对他们耳语：嘿，伍基人在那儿。而且如果那个伍基人发现我这么说，他会知道我不是想刻薄。我只是在指出他是伍基人这个事实。

vocab.ex: He didn't intend to be hurtful; he didn't say it in a mean way.

vocab.mean: （非正式）傻的；愚蠢的（此处指天真无知的）
vocab.ex: That was a dumb mistake to make.
He found a weird-looking insect in his garden.
Don't be afraid of the dog; he doesn't bite.

vocab.mean: 伍基人（《星球大战》中的外星种族）
vocab.ex: Chewbacca is the most famous Wookiee in the Star Wars galaxy.
Cats are naturally curious animals.
He was quick to point out my mistakes.

gram.name: 第二条件句（用于假设类比）
gram.function: 用于描述与现在或将来事实相反的、不可能或极不可能发生的假设情况。主角通过一个不可能的假设 'if a Wookiee started going to the school...' 来创建一个类比，以此来理解和原谅其他孩子的行为，展示了他非凡的同理心。

example.en: If I were a superhero, I would fly everywhere.
example.cn: 如果我是个超级英雄，我就会飞到任何地方。

gram.constraints: 条件从句用一般过去时，主句用 'would/could/should/might + 动词原形'。

paras.en: It took about one week for the kids in my class to get used to my face. These were the kids I'd see every day in all my classes. It took about two weeks for the rest of the kids in my grade to get used to my face. These were the kids I'd see in the cafeteria, yard time, PE, music, library, computer class.
paras.cn: 我班上的孩子们大约花了一周时间来习惯我的脸。这些是我每天所有课上都会见到的孩子。我年级里其余的孩子大约花了两周时间来习惯我的脸。这些是我在餐厅、操场活动时间、体育课、音乐课、图书馆、电脑课上会见到的孩子。

vocab.ex: It took three hours to finish the puzzle.
It took a while for him to get used to his new job.
My daughter is in the third grade.
The students love to play soccer during yard time.
We have PE twice a week.

gram.name: 排比结构/首语重复法 (It took...)
gram.pattern: Repetition of a phrase at the beginning of successive paragraphs.
gram.function: 通过在连续的段落开头重复 'It took about...' 结构，作者建立了一种强烈的节奏感，并清晰地展示了一个渐进的过程。这种结构像时间标记一样，一步步地记录了从一个小群体到一个大群体慢慢接受主角的过程，强调了这个过程的漫长和层次性。

example.en: It was the best of times. It was the worst of times.
example.cn: 那是最好的时代。那也是最坏的时代。

gram.constraints: 是一种强有力的修辞手法，用于强调过程或进行对比。

paras.en: It took about a month for the rest of the kids in the entire school to get used to it. These were the kids in all the other grades. They were big kids, some of them. Some of them had crazy haircuts. Some of them had earrings in their noses. Some of them had pimples. None of them looked like me.
paras.cn: 全校其余的孩子大约花了一个月时间来习惯它。这些是所有其他年级的孩子。他们是大孩子，其中一些是。他们中有些人留着疯狂的发型。有些人鼻子上戴着耳环。有些人长了青春痘。他们中没有一个人长得像我。

vocab.ex: He ate the entire pizza by himself.
I'm going to get a new haircut this weekend.
She wore a beautiful pair of diamond earrings.
He was worried about the pimple on his nose before the school dance.
None of them wanted to volunteer for the extra work.

gram.name: 并列与结论性陈述
gram.pattern: Series of observations + final contrasting statement.
gram.function: 作者列举了一系列其他孩子外貌上的“不寻常”之处（疯狂的发型、鼻环、青春痘），这些都是青少年常见的特征。然后，通过一个简短而有力的结论 'None of them looked like me'，将这些“正常”的不寻常与主角真正独特的外貌进行并列对比，深刻地突显了他的孤独和与众不同。

example.en: Some were tall, some were short, some had red hair, some had brown. None of them was the person I was looking for.
example.cn: 有些人高，有些人矮，有些人红发，有些人棕发。他们中没有一个是我要找的人。

gram.constraints: 是一种通过并列和对比来产生强烈情感冲击的文学技巧。

paras.en: I hung out with Jack in homeroom, English, history, computer, music, and science, which were all the classes we had together. The teachers assigned seats in every class, and I ended up sitting next to Jack in every single class, so I figured either the teachers were told to put me and Jack together, or it was a totally incredible coincidence.
paras.cn: 我在班级教室、英语、历史、电脑、音乐和科学课上都和杰克一起玩，这些是我们所有共同的课程。老师们在每节课都安排了座位，结果我每节课都坐在杰克旁边，所以我琢磨着要么是老师们被告知把我和杰克安排在一起，要么就是一个完全不可思议的巧合。

vocab.ex: He likes to hang out with his friends on the weekend.
The teacher will assign a different project to each group.
We wanted to go to the beach, but we ended up at the mall because of the rain.
I figure it's going to rain later, so I'll bring an umbrella.
She told us an incredible story about her travels.
Meeting my childhood friend in a different country was an amazing coincidence.

gram.name: either... or... 结构
gram.function: 用于连接两个或多个选择或可能性，表示“要么…要么…”。主角用它来推测自己和杰克总坐在一起的两种可能性。

example.en: We can either watch a movie at home or go out for dinner.
example.cn: 我们可以要么在家看电影，要么出去吃饭。

gram.constraints: X和Y的词性或结构应该保持平行。

paras.en: I walked to classes with Jack, too. I know he noticed kids staring at me, but he pretended not to notice. One time, though, on our way to history, this huge eighth grader who was zooming down the stairs two steps at a time accidentally bumped into us at the bottom of the stairs and knocked me down. As the guy helped me stand up, he got a look at my face, and without even meaning to, he just said: "Whoa!" Then he patted me on the shoulder, like he was dusting me off, and took off after his friends. For some reason, me and Jack started cracking up.
paras.cn: 我也和杰克一起走去上课。我知道他注意到有孩子盯着我看，但他假装没注意。不过有一次，在我们去上历史课的路上，一个高大的八年级学生，一次跨两级台阶飞速冲下楼，不小心在楼梯底撞到了我们，把我撞倒了。当那家伙扶我站起来时，他看清了我的脸，然后甚至不是故意的，就说了声：“哇！” 然后他拍了拍我的肩膀，好像在给我掸灰尘，接着就追着他的朋友们跑了。不知什么原因，我和杰克开始大笑起来。

vocab.ex: The children pretended to be asleep when their mom came in.
The skateboarder was zooming down the steep hill.
He was late, so he ran up the stairs two steps at a time.
The strong wind almost knocked me down.
I finally got a look at the new car, and it's beautiful.
I'm sorry I broke your vase; I didn't mean to.
After he fell in the playground, his mother dusted him off.
As soon as he saw the police car, the thief took off.
His funny story made everyone in the room start cracking up.

gram.name: 使用 'as' 表示同步动作
gram.function: 用于连接两个同时发生的动作，意为“当…的时候”。'As the guy helped me stand up, he got a look at my face...' 将“扶我起来”和“看清我的脸”这两个紧密相连的动作串联起来。

example.en: As she was leaving the house, the phone rang.
example.cn: 当她正要离开家时，电话响了。

gram.constraints: 强调动作的同步性。

paras.en: "That guy made the funniest face!" said Jack as we sat down at our desks. "I know, right?" I said. "He was like, whoa !" "I swear, I think he wet his pants!" We were laughing so hard that the teacher, Mr. Roche, had to ask us to settle down.
paras.cn: “那家伙做了个最搞笑的表情！” 我们在课桌前坐下时杰克说。“我知道，对吧？” 我说。“他当时就那样，哇！” “我发誓，我觉得他都尿裤子了！” 我们笑得太厉害了，以至于老师罗什先生不得不叫我们安静下来。

vocab.ex: That was the funniest joke I've ever heard.

vocab.mean: （表示强烈同意）可不是嘛；我知道
vocab.ex: A: This weather is amazing! B: I know, right?
I swear, I didn't know anything about the surprise party.

vocab.mean: 尿裤子（此处用于夸张地形容笑得厉害）
vocab.ex: The roller coaster was so scary, I thought I was going to wet my pants.
The teacher asked the noisy class to settle down.

gram.name: so... that... 结果状语从句
gram.function: 用于强调程度之深以至于产生了某种结果。'We were laughing so hard that the teacher... had to ask us to settle down' 强调了笑的程度以及这种程度所导致的后果。

example.en: It was so cold that the lake froze over completely.
example.cn: 天气太冷了，湖面完全结冰了。

gram.constraints: 从句'that' 有时在口语中可以省略，但书面语中通常保留。

paras.en: Later, after we finished reading about how ancient Sumerians built sundials, Jack whispered: "Do you ever want to beat those kids up?" I shrugged. "I guess. I don't know." "I'd want to. I think you should get a secret squirt gun or something and attach it to your eyes somehow. And every time someone stares at you, you would squirt them in the face." "With some green slime or something," I answered. "No, no: with slug juice mixed with dog pee." "Yeah!" I said, completely agreeing.
paras.cn: 后来，在我们读完关于古代苏美尔人如何建造日晷的文章后，杰克低声说：“你有没有想过把那些孩子揍一顿？” 我耸了耸肩。“我猜有吧。我不知道。” “我就会想。我觉得你应该弄一把秘密水枪之类的东西，用某种方法把它装在你的眼睛上。然后每次有人盯着你看，你就朝他们脸上喷水。” “用点绿色的黏液之类的，” 我回答。“不，不：用鼻涕虫汁混合狗尿。” “好啊！” 我说，完全同意。

vocab.ex: The ancient civilization used a sundial to tell time.
The bully threatened to beat up the smaller kid after school.
On a hot day, it's fun to play with a squirt gun.
You need to attach this cable to the back of the monitor.
The monster in the movie was covered in green slime.
There was a slimy slug crawling on the lettuce.

gram.name: 使用 'would' 表示假设性行为
gram.function: 用于描述在假设或想象的情境中会发生的动作。'you would squirt them in the face' 描述的是在一个想象出来的复仇场景中会采取的行动。

example.en: If I had a million dollars, I would buy a big house.
example.cn: 如果我有一百万美元，我就会买一座大房子。

gram.constraints: 常用于条件句的主句中，或在上下文中隐含条件。

paras.en: "Guys," said Mr. Roche from across the room. "People are still reading." We nodded and looked down at our books. Then Jack whispered: "Are you always going to look this way, August? I mean, can't you get plastic surgery or something?" I smiled and pointed to my face. "Hello? This is after plastic surgery!" Jack clapped his hand over his forehead and started laughing hysterically. "Dude, you should sue your doctor!" he answered between giggles. This time the two of us were laughing so much we couldn't stop, even after Mr. Roche came over and made us both switch chairs with the kids next to us.
paras.cn: “伙计们，” 罗什先生从房间另一头说。“还有人在读书呢。” 我们点了点头，低头看着我们的书。然后杰克低声说：“你总是会长成这个样子吗，奥古斯特？我的意思是，你不能做个整形手术什么的吗？” 我笑了笑，指着我的脸。“喂？这已经是整形手术之后了！” 杰克用手拍了一下自己的额头，开始歇斯底里地大笑起来。“老兄，你应该告你的医生！” 他在咯咯笑声中回答。这一次我们俩笑得太厉害了，根本停不下来，即使在罗什先生走过来让我们俩都和旁边的孩子换了座位之后也是如此。

vocab.ex: After the accident, he needed plastic surgery on his face.
He clapped his hand over his forehead when he realized his mistake.

vocab.mean: 歇斯底里地；无法控制地
vocab.ex: She was laughing hysterically at his ridiculous joke.
She threatened to sue the company for damages.
The children's giggles filled the quiet room.
Can we switch chairs? This one is uncomfortable.

gram.name: 介词短语作方式状语
gram.function: 用于描述动作发生时的方式或伴随情况。'he answered between giggles' 生动地描绘了杰克在无法控制的笑声中说话的情景。

example.en: He managed to answer the question between sips of his coffee.
example.cn: 他在喝咖啡的间隙设法回答了那个问题。

gram.constraints: 为句子增添了生动的细节。

paras.en: Mr. Browne's precept for October was: YOUR DEEDS ARE YOUR MONUMENTS. He told us that this was written on the tombstone of some Egyptian guy that died thousands of years ago. Since we were just about to start studying ancient Egypt in history, Mr. Browne thought this was a good choice for a precept.
paras.cn: 布朗先生十月份的信条是：你的善行就是你的纪念碑。他告诉我们，这是写在几千年前去世的某个埃及人的墓碑上的。因为我们历史课正要开始学习古埃及，布朗先生认为这是一个很好的信条选择。

vocab.ex: One of his guiding precepts was to always be honest.
He was known for his many charitable deeds.
They built a monument to honor the fallen soldiers.
The name and dates were carved into the old tombstone.
I was just about to leave when the phone rang.

gram.name: 过去进行时（表示过去即将发生的动作）
gram.function: 用于描述在过去某个时间点即将要发生的动作。'we were just about to start studying...' 描述了“学习古埃及”是当时紧接着就要发生的计划，解释了老师选择这个信条的背景。

example.en: We were about to go out when it started to rain.
example.cn: 我们正要出门时，天开始下雨了。

gram.constraints: 强调动作的即时性。

paras.en: Our homework assignment was to write a paragraph about what we thought the precept meant or how we felt about it. This is what I wrote:
paras.cn: 我们的家庭作业是写一段话，关于我们认为这条信条是什么意思，或者我们对它有什么感受。这是我写的：

vocab.ex: The teacher gave us a challenging writing assignment.
Please write a short paragraph describing your favorite hobby.

gram.name: 强调句型 (This is what...)
gram.function: 用于引出并强调接下来要陈述的内容。'This is what I wrote' 将读者的注意力集中在即将展示的段落上。

example.en: I'm not sure I understand. This is what he told me.
example.cn: 我不确定我是否理解。这是他告诉我的。

gram.constraints: 'what I wrote' 在此作表语。

paras.en: This precept means that we should be remembered for the things we do. The things we do are the most important things of all. They are more important than what we say or what we look like. The things we do outlast our mortality. The things we do are like monuments that people build to honor heroes after they've died. They're like the pyramids that the Egyptians built to honor the pharaohs. Only instead of being made out of stone, they're made out of the memories people have of you. That's why your deeds are like your monuments. Built with memories instead of with stone.
paras.cn: 这条信条意味着我们应该因我们所做的事情而被铭记。我们所做的事情是所有事情中最重要的。它们比我们所说的或我们的长相更重要。我们所做的事情比我们的生命更长久。我们所做的事情就像人们在英雄死后为纪念他们而建造的纪念碑。它们就像埃及人为纪念法老而建造的金字塔。只不过它们不是由石头构成，而是由人们对你的记忆构成。那就是为什么你的善行就像你的纪念碑。用记忆而非石头建造。

vocab.ex: She hopes to be remembered for her contributions to science.
Good memories can outlast physical objects.
Facing a serious illness made him confront his own mortality.
The city built a statue to honor the nation's founder.
The ancient Egyptian pharaohs were buried in magnificent tombs.
He chose to walk instead of taking the bus.

gram.name: 首语重复法 (The things we do)
gram.pattern: Repetition of a phrase at the beginning of successive clauses.
gram.function: 通过在连续的句子开头重复 'The things we do'，作者建立了一种强烈的节奏感，并有力地强调了“行为”这一核心概念的重要性，使其成为段落的主旋律。

example.en: We shall fight on the beaches. We shall fight on the landing grounds. We shall never surrender.
example.cn: 我们将在海滩上战斗。我们将在登陆地战斗。我们决不投降。

gram.constraints: 是一种强有力的修辞手法，用于强调和增强情感。

gram.name: 使用句子片段进行强调
gram.pattern: A grammatically incomplete sentence used for effect.
gram.function: 在段落结尾使用一个语法上不完整的句子片段 'Built with memories instead of with stone'，可以创造出一种强有力的、诗意的总结效果。它作为前一句的补充说明，因其简洁而显得格外突出和令人难忘。

example.en: He walked away without saying a word. A final, silent goodbye.
example.cn: 他一言不发地走开了。一次最后的、无声的告别。

gram.constraints: 是一种文学技巧，在正式写作中应谨慎使用，但在创意写作中非常有效。

paras.en: My birthday is October 10. I like my birthday: 10/10. It would've been great if I'd been born at exactly 10:10 in the morning or at night, but I wasn't. I was born just after midnight. But I still think my birthday is cool. I usually have a little party at home, but this year I asked Mom if I could have a big bowling party.
paras.cn: 我的生日是10月10日。我喜欢我的生日：10/10。如果我能正好在早上或晚上10点10分出生就太棒了，但我不是。我是在午夜刚过时出生的。但我仍然觉得我的生日很酷。我通常在家办个小派对，但今年我问妈妈我是否可以办一个大型的保龄球派对。

vocab.ex: That would've been a disaster if you hadn't intervened.
Please arrive at exactly 3:00 PM, not a minute later.
The magical carriage turned back into a pumpkin at midnight.
He invited all his friends to his bowling party.

gram.name: 第三条件句
gram.pattern: If + past perfect, ... would have + past participle
gram.function: 用于描述与过去事实相反的假设情况及其可能的结果。'It would've been great if I'd been born...' 描述了一个未发生的过去情况（他并没有在10:10出生）。

example.en: If I had known you were coming, I would have baked a cake.
example.cn: 如果我早知道你要来，我就会烤一个蛋糕了。

gram.constraints: 用于对过去情况的虚拟假设。

paras.en: Mom was surprised but happy. She asked me who I wanted to ask from my class, and I said everyone in my homeroom plus Summer. "That's a lot of kids, Auggie," said Mom. "I have to invite everyone because I don't want anyone to get their feelings hurt if they find out other people are invited and they aren't, okay?" "Okay," Mom agreed. "You even want to invite the 'what's the deal' kid?" "Yeah, you can invite Julian," I answered. "Geez, Mom, you should forget about that already."
paras.cn: 妈妈既惊讶又高兴。她问我想邀请班上的谁，我说我们班的所有人，再加上萨默。“那可有很多孩子呢，奥吉，” 妈妈说。“我必须邀请每个人，因为我不想让任何人在发现别人被邀请而他们没有时感到伤心，好吗？” “好的，” 妈妈同意了。“你甚至想邀请那个‘怎么回事’的小孩？” “是的，你可以邀请朱利安，” 我回答。“天哪，妈妈，你早就该忘了那事了。”

vocab.ex: The cost is ten dollars, plus tax.
He was careful with his words because he didn't want anyone to get their feelings hurt.
I need to find out what time the train leaves.
She referred to him as the 'spilled the juice' kid after the incident at lunch.

vocab.mean: （表示惊讶、懊恼的感叹词）天哪
vocab.ex: Geez, I can't believe you forgot my birthday!

gram.name: 引语作绰号
gram.function: 将一个角色之前说过的话（'What's the deal with your face?'）放在引号内，用作形容词来修饰名词 'kid'，从而创造一个基于特定事件的绰号。这是一种生动的、带有个人色彩的指代方式。

example.en: Ever since he said that, we've called him the "it's impossible" guy.
example.cn: 自从他说了那话，我们就叫他“不可能”先生。

gram.constraints: 是一种非正式的、依赖上下文的指代方式。

paras.en: "I know, you're right." A couple of weeks later, I asked Mom who was coming to my party, and she said: "Jack Will, Summer. Reid Kingsley. Both Maxes. And a couple of other kids said they were going to try to be there." "Like who?" "Charlotte's mom said Charlotte had a dance recital earlier in the day, but she was going to try to come to your party if time allowed. And Tristan's mom said he might come after his soccer game." "So that's it ?" I said. "That's like . . . five people."
paras.cn: “我知道，你是对的。” 几周后，我问妈妈谁会来我的派对，她说：“杰克·威尔、萨默、里德·金斯利、两个马克斯。还有另外几个孩子说他们会尽量来。” “比如谁？” “夏洛特的妈妈说夏洛特那天早些时候有个舞蹈表演，但如果时间允许，她会尽力来你的派对。特里斯坦的妈妈说他可能会在足球比赛后过来。” “就这些了？” 我说。“那才……五个人。”

vocab.ex: I'll be ready in a couple of minutes.
I have another commitment, but I'll try to be there for your celebration.
Her daughter has a dance recital this Saturday.
We can visit the museum after lunch, if time allowed.

vocab.mean: 就这些了？（表示失望或疑问）
vocab.ex: After all that work, this is all we get? That's it?

gram.name: 间接引语
gram.function: 用于转述他人的话语。妈妈通过一系列间接引语（'Charlotte's mom said...', 'Tristan's mom said...'）来转述其他家长的回复，这是一种常见的叙事方式。

example.en: My friend said that she couldn't come to the party.
example.cn: 我朋友说她不能来参加派对了。

gram.constraints: 连词 'that' 常常可以省略。

paras.en: "That's more than five people, Auggie. I think a lot of people just had plans already," Mom answered. We were in the kitchen. She was cutting one of the apples we had just gotten at the farmers' market into teensy-weensy bites so I could eat it. "What kind of plans?" I asked. "I don't know, Auggie. We sent out the evites kind of late." "Like what did they tell you, though? What reasons did they give?" "Everyone gave different reasons, Auggie." She sounded a bit impatient. "Really, sweetie, it shouldn't matter what their reasons were. People had plans, that's all." "What did Julian give as his reason?" I asked.
paras.cn: “不止五个人呢，奥吉。我想很多人只是已经有安排了，” 妈妈回答。我们在厨房里。她正在把我们刚从农贸市场买来的一个苹果切成非常非常小的块，这样我才能吃。“什么样的安排？” 我问。“我不知道，奥吉。我们的电子邀请函发得有点晚。” “但他们到底跟你说了什么？他们给了什么理由？” “每个人给的理由都不同，奥吉。” 她听起来有点不耐烦。“真的，宝贝，他们的理由是什么不应该重要。人们有安排了，仅此而已。” “朱利安给的理由是什么？” 我问。

vocab.ex: I can't come to the party because I already had plans.
The dollhouse had teensy-weensy furniture inside.
Did you receive the evite for the wedding?
He grew impatient waiting in the long line.
I just wanted to say hello, that's all.

gram.name: should (用于建议)
gram.function: 用于给出建议或表达观点，说明什么是正确的或最好的做法。'it shouldn't matter what their reasons were' 是妈妈给出的一个观点，意思是“你不应该在意他们的理由”。

example.en: You look tired. You should get some rest.
example.cn: 你看起来很累。你应该休息一下。

gram.constraints: should 后面必须跟动词原形。
