paras.en: "You know," said Mom, "his mom was the only person who didn't RSVP at all." She looked at me. "I guess the apple doesn't fall far from the tree." I laughed because I thought she was making a joke, but then I realized she wasn't. "What does that mean?" I asked. "Never mind. Now go wash your hands so you can eat."
paras.cn: “你知道吗，” 妈妈说，“他的妈妈是唯一一个完全没有回复邀请的人。” 她看着我。“我猜真是‘有其母必有其子’。” 我笑了，因为我以为她在开玩笑，但后来我意识到她不是。“那是什么意思？” 我问。“没什么。现在去洗手吃饭吧。”

vocab.mean: 回复邀请（源自法语 répondez s'il vous plaît）
vocab.ex: Please RSVP by Friday so we can get a headcount for the dinner.
I don't like spinach at all.

vocab.word: the apple doesn't fall far from the tree
vocab.ph: /ði ˈæpl ˈdʌznt fɔːl fɑːr frəm ðə triː/
vocab.mean: 有其父必有其子；言传身教
vocab.ex: Her son is a talented musician, just like his father. The apple doesn't fall far from the tree.
He was just trying to make a joke to lighten the mood.
I can't find my keys... oh, never mind, here they are.

gram.name: 感知对比从句
gram.pattern: I [verb of perception] because... but then I [verb of perception]...
gram.function: 用于展示角色认知或理解的转变过程。'I laughed because I thought... but then I realized...' 清晰地描绘了主角从误解（以为是玩笑）到明白真相（不是玩笑）的心理过程。

example.en: I was happy because I thought I won, but then I realized I had read the number wrong.
example.cn: 我很开心，因为我以为我赢了，但后来我意识到我看错了号码。

gram.constraints: 是叙述内心活动和认知变化的有效结构。

paras.en: My birthday party turned out to be much smaller than I thought it would be, but it was still great. Jack, Summer, Reid, Tristan, and both Maxes came from school, and Christopher came, too—all the way from Bridgeport with his parents. And Uncle Ben came. And Aunt Kate and Uncle Po drove in from Boston, though Tata and Poppa were in Florida for the winter. It was fun because all the grown-ups ended up bowling in the lane next to ours, so it really felt like there were a lot of people there to celebrate my birthday.
paras.cn: 我的生日派对比我想象的要小得多，但仍然很棒。杰克、萨默、里德、特里斯坦和两个马克斯都从学校来了，克里斯托弗也来了——和他的父母大老远从布里奇波特赶来。本叔叔也来了。凯特阿姨和波叔叔也从波士顿开车过来，不过塔塔和波帕冬天在佛罗里达。派对很有趣，因为所有的大人最后都在我们旁边的球道上打保龄球，所以真的感觉像是有很多人在那里为我庆祝生日。

vocab.ex: The mysterious package turned out to be just a box of old books.
She traveled all the way from Australia to attend the wedding.
My cousins are going to drive in from the countryside for the holiday.
We wanted to go to the beach, but we ended up at the mall because of the rain.
Please wait for your turn before you step onto the bowling lane.
We're going to celebrate her graduation with a big party.

gram.name: 加强比较级
gram.function: 在比较级形容词前使用 'much'、'far'、'a lot' 等词可以加强比较的程度。'much smaller' 强调了派对规模比预想的“小得多”。

example.en: This new phone is much more expensive than my old one.
example.cn: 这部新手机比我的旧手机贵得多。

gram.constraints: 用于加强两者之间的差异。

paras.en: At lunch the next day, Summer asked me what I was going to be for Halloween. Of course, I'd been thinking about it since last Halloween, so I knew right away. "Boba Fett." "You know you can wear a costume to school on Halloween, right?" "No way, really?" "So long as it's politically correct." "What, like no guns and stuff?" "Exactly." "What about blasters?" "I think a blaster's like a gun, Auggie." "Oh man . . . ," I said, shaking my head. Boba Fett has a blaster.
paras.cn: 第二天午餐时，萨默问我万圣节要扮成什么。当然，我从去年万圣节起就一直在想了，所以我立刻就知道了。“波巴·费特。” “你知道万圣节那天可以穿戏服来学校，对吧？” “不会吧，真的？” “只要它政治正确就行。” “什么意思，比如不能带枪之类的？” “完全正确。” “那冲击枪呢？” “我觉得冲击枪就像枪一样，奥吉。” “哦天哪……” 我摇着头说。波巴·费特就有一把冲击枪。

vocab.ex: She spent weeks making her own Halloween costume.
When the fire alarm rang, we left the building right away.
You can borrow my car, so long as you promise to be careful.
Some people find it difficult to keep up with what is considered politically correct.
The stormtrooper aimed his blaster at the hero.

vocab.mean: 哦天哪（表示失望或沮丧）
vocab.ex: Oh man, I can't believe I forgot my keys again.

gram.name: 省略问句（用于澄清）
gram.function: 一种非常口语化的提问方式，通过省略部分句子成分并直接给出一个例子来寻求澄清。'What, like no guns and stuff?' 是 'What do you mean by politically correct? Do you mean something like we can't have guns?' 的简化形式。

example.en: A: We need to buy some supplies. B: What, like paper and pens?
example.cn: A：我们需要买些补给品。B：什么意思，比如纸和笔吗？

gram.constraints: 常见于非正式对话中。

paras.en: "At least, we don't have to come like a character in a book anymore. In the lower school that's what you had to do. Last year I was the Wicked Witch of the West from The Wizard of Oz ." "But that's a movie, not a book." "Hello?" Summer answered. "It was a book first! One of my favorite books in the world, actually. My dad used to read it to me every night in the first grade."
paras.cn: “至少，我们再也不用扮成书里的角色了。在小学部你必须那么做。去年我扮的是《绿野仙踪》里的西方坏女巫。” “但那是一部电影，不是一本书。” “喂？” 萨默回答。“它先是一本书！实际上，是我全世界最喜欢的书之一。我一年级的时候，我爸爸过去每晚都读给我听。”

vocab.ex: It's raining, but at least it's not cold.
Sherlock Holmes is a famous fictional character.
The Wicked Witch of the West is known for her green skin and pointy hat.
He had to squint to read the tiny print on the label.

gram.name: Hello? (作为修辞手法)
gram.function: 在对话中，用升调说出 'Hello?' 并不是在打招呼，而是一种反问，用来表达对对方所说的话感到惊讶、觉得对方说的话很明显是错的或很傻。它传达的意思是：“你难道不知道吗？”或“这还用说吗？”

example.en: A: Why are you so tired? B: Hello? I just ran a marathon!
example.cn: A：你为什么这么累？B：喂？我刚跑完一场马拉松！

gram.constraints: 是一种非常口语化和非正式的表达方式，语气中带有不耐烦或惊讶。

paras.en: When Summer talks, especially when she's excited about something, her eyes squint like she's looking right at the sun. I hardly ever see Summer during the day, since the only class we have together is English. But ever since that first lunch at school, we've sat at the summer table together every day, just the two of us.
paras.cn: 当萨默说话时，尤其是当她对某件事感到兴奋时，她的眼睛会眯起来，就像她在直视太阳一样。我白天几乎见不到萨默，因为我们唯一一起上的课是英语。但自从学校的第一顿午餐以来，我们每天都一起坐在夏天餐桌旁，就我们两个人。

vocab.ex: The children are excited about the upcoming holiday.
He had to squint to read the tiny print on the label.
He lives nearby, but we hardly ever see him.
Ever since she got her new job, she's been much happier.
It was a quiet evening at home, just the two of us.

gram.name: 使用 'like' 的明喻
gram.function: 用于将一事物与另一事物进行直接比较，以创造生动的形象。'...her eyes squint like she's looking right at the sun' 通过一个生动的比喻，描绘了Summer兴奋时的独特神情。

example.en: He eats like he hasn't seen food in days.
example.cn: 他吃起东西来就像好几天没见过食物一样。

gram.constraints: 'Like' 后面可以跟一个从句，在非正式语境中很常见。

paras.en: "So, what are you going to be?" I asked her. "I don't know yet. I know what I'd really want to go as, but I think it might be too dorky. You know, Savanna's group isn't even wearing costumes this year. They think we're too old for Halloween." "What? That's just dumb." "I know, right?"
paras.cn: “那么，你准备扮成什么？” 我问她。“我还没想好。我知道我真正想扮成什么，但我觉得那可能太傻了。你知道，萨凡纳那伙人今年甚至都不穿戏服了。她们觉得我们过万圣节已经太老了。” “什么？那太蠢了。” “可不是嘛？”

vocab.ex: What are you planning to go as for the costume party?
He loves wearing his dorky old sweater from college.
All the children were excited to wear costumes for the school play.
Some people think you can never be too old for video games.
That was a dumb mistake to make.

vocab.mean: （表示强烈同意）可不是嘛；我知道
vocab.ex: A: This weather is amazing! B: I know, right?

gram.name: too... for... 结构
gram.function: 表示程度过高，以至于不适合某人或某事。'They think we're too old for Halloween' 表达了萨凡纳那群人认为自己的年龄已经不适合参加万圣节活动了。

example.en: This movie is too scary for young children.
example.cn: 这部电影对小孩来说太恐怖了。

gram.constraints: 该结构本身带有否定意味。

paras.en: "I thought you didn't care what those girls think." She shrugged and took a long drink of her milk. "So, what dorky thing do you want to dress up as?" I asked her, smiling. "Promise not to laugh?" She raised her eyebrows and her shoulders, embarrassed. "A unicorn."
paras.cn: “我以为你不在乎那些女孩的想法。” 她耸了耸肩，喝了一大口牛奶。“那么，你想装扮成什么傻傻的东西？” 我笑着问她。“保证不笑？” 她扬起眉毛和肩膀，很不好意思。“独角兽。”

vocab.ex: You shouldn't care what other people think of your new haircut.
When I asked him where the money was, he just shrugged.
For the party, he decided to dress up as a pirate.

vocab.mean: 扬起眉毛（表示惊讶或怀疑）
vocab.ex: He raised his eyebrows when I told him the surprising news.
She felt embarrassed when she forgot her lines on stage.
The mythical unicorn is a symbol of purity and grace.

gram.name: 省略问句
gram.function: 一种非常口语化的提问方式，通过省略主语 'Do you' 来使句子更简洁、更直接。'Promise not to laugh?' 是 'Do you promise not to laugh?' 的非正式形式。

example.en: Want to get some coffee later?
example.cn: 待会儿想去喝杯咖啡吗？

gram.constraints: 常见于非正式对话中。

paras.en: I smiled and looked down at my sandwich. "Hey, you promised not to laugh!" she laughed. "Okay, okay," I said. "But you're right: that is too dorky." "I know!" she said. "But I have it all planned out: I'd make the head out of papier-mâché, and paint the horn gold and make the mane gold, too. . . . It would be so awesome."
paras.cn: 我笑了笑，低头看着我的三明治。“嘿，你保证过不笑的！” 她笑着说。“好了，好了，” 我说。“但你是对的：那确实太傻了。” “我知道！” 她说。“但我已经全部计划好了：我会用纸浆糊做头，把角涂成金色，鬃毛也做成金色的……那会超赞的。”

vocab.ex: I promise I will finish the report by tomorrow.
She likes to plan out her entire week every Sunday night.
For the art project, we made masks out of papier-mâché.
The unicorn is famous for the single horn on its forehead.
The lion shook its magnificent mane.
We had an awesome time at the concert.

gram.name: 省略号（表示兴奋的思绪）
gram.function: 用于表示说话者的话没有说完，思绪还在继续。在这里，省略号反映了Summer在描述她的计划时那种兴奋的、滔滔不绝的状态，好像还有更多细节在她脑中浮现。

example.en: "And then we could go to the park, and get ice cream, and..." she said, her voice full of excitement.
example.cn: “然后我们可以去公园，吃冰淇淋，还有......” 她说，声音里充满了兴奋。

gram.constraints: 可以用来表达多种情感，如犹豫、兴奋或未完待续。

paras.en: "Okay." I shrugged. "Then you should do it. Who cares what other people think, right?" "Maybe what I'll do is just wear it for the Halloween Parade," she said, snapping her fingers. "And I'll just be, like, a Goth girl for school. Yeah, that's it, that's what I'll do."
paras.cn: “好吧。” 我耸了耸肩。“那你应该做啊。谁在乎别人怎么想，对吧？” “也许我只在万圣节游行时穿它，” 她说着，打了个响指。“而在学校我就扮成，比如，一个哥特女孩。是的，就是这样，我就这么办。”

vocab.ex: He said he didn't like my new haircut, but who cares? I love it.
The whole town comes out to watch the annual Halloween Parade.

vocab.mean: 打响指（常表示突然想到主意）
vocab.ex: Suddenly, she snapped her fingers as if she had the perfect solution.

vocab.mean: 哥特式的；哥特风格的人
vocab.ex: She had a Goth style, with dark clothes and black lipstick.

vocab.mean: 就是这样（表示下定决心或找到答案）
vocab.ex: After hours of searching, he finally found the key. 'That's it!' he exclaimed.

gram.name: 强调句型 (What... is...)
gram.function: 用于强调句子中的某个特定部分。'what I'll do is just wear it...' 和 'that's what I'll do' 都强调了她最终做出的“决定”或“计划”。

example.en: What I need most is a good night's sleep.
example.cn: 我最需要的是好好睡一觉。

gram.constraints: 由 'what' 引导的主语从句充当句子的主语。

paras.en: "Sounds like a plan." I nodded. "Thanks, Auggie," she giggled. "You know, that's what I like best about you. I feel like I can tell you anything." "Yeah?" I answered, nodding. I gave her a thumbs-up sign. "Cool beans."
paras.cn: “听起来像个好计划。” 我点了点头。“谢谢，奥吉，” 她咯咯地笑。“你知道，那就是我最喜欢你的地方。我感觉什么都可以告诉你。” “是吗？” 我点着头回答。我给了她一个大拇指的手势。“酷毙了。”

vocab.mean: 听起来像个好计划（表示同意）
vocab.ex: A: Let's go to the movies tonight. B: Sounds like a plan!
The two girls started to giggle during the quiet movie.
I feel like this is going to be a great day.
She gave me a thumbs-up to show that everything was okay.
"I finished the project!" "Cool beans! Let's celebrate."

gram.name: 强调句型 (That's what...)
gram.function: 用于引出并强调某个特定的事物或原因。'that's what I like best about you' 强调了她最喜欢主角的“那个特质”（即可以倾诉任何事）。

example.en: You're always so honest. That's what I admire about you.
example.cn: 你总是那么诚实。那就是我欣赏你的地方。

gram.constraints: 'what I like best about you' 在此作表语。

paras.en: I don't think anyone will be shocked to learn I don't want to have my school picture taken on October 22. No way. No thank you. I stopped letting anyone take pictures of me a while ago. I guess you could call it a phobia. No, actually, it's not a phobia. It's an "aversion," which is a word I just learned in Mr. Browne's class. I have an aversion to having my picture taken. There, I used it in a sentence.
paras.cn: 我想不会有人惊讶于我不想在10月22日拍我的学校照片。没门。谢谢，不用了。我前一阵子就不让任何人给我拍照了。我猜你可以称之为一种恐惧症。不，其实，这不是恐惧症。这是一种“厌恶”，这是我刚在布朗先生课上学到的一个词。我对拍照有一种厌恶。好了，我把它用在一个句子里了。

vocab.ex: We were all shocked to hear the news about the accident.
You want me to jump off that high dive? No way!
I saw that movie a while ago, but I don't remember the ending.
He has a phobia of spiders and screams whenever he sees one.
She has a strong aversion to public speaking.

gram.name: 自我修正与元评论
gram.function: 一种叙事技巧，通过展示角色的思考和修正过程来揭示其内心世界。叙述者先提出一个词（'phobia'），然后否定它并换上一个更精确的词（'aversion'），最后还对自己使用新词的行为发表评论（'There, I used it...'）。这使得叙述非常生动，并突显了角色的聪慧和自我意识。

example.en: I was angry. No, actually, angry is not the right word. I was disappointed. Yes, that's it.
example.cn: 我很生气。不，其实，生气不是个准确的词。我很失望。是的，就是这样。

gram.constraints: 是一种模仿真实思维过程的文学手法。

paras.en: I thought Mom would try to get me to drop my aversion to having my picture taken for school, but she didn't. Unfortunately, while I managed to avoid having the portrait taken, I couldn't get out of being part of the class picture. Ugh. The photographer looked like he'd just sucked on a lemon when he saw me. I'm sure he thought I ruined the picture. I was one of the ones in the front, sitting down. I didn't smile, not that anyone could tell if I had.
paras.cn: 我原以为妈妈会试图让我放弃对拍学校照片的厌恶，但她没有。不幸的是，虽然我成功地避免了拍个人照，但我没能躲过集体照。唉。摄影师看到我时，那表情就像刚吸了一口柠檬。我敢肯定他认为我毁了这张照片。我是坐在前排的人之一。我没有笑，倒也不是说如果我笑了有谁能看出来。

vocab.ex: He tried to get his friend to drop his aversion to trying new foods.

vocab.mean: 成功做到（通常指有难度的事）
vocab.ex: Despite the traffic, we managed to arrive on time.
He tried to get out of doing his chores by pretending to be sick.

vocab.mean: （表情）像吸了柠檬一样酸（指表情难看、不悦）
vocab.ex: When he heard the bad news, his face looked like he had just sucked on a lemon.
The sudden rain completely ruined our picnic.
I'm not going to the party, not that anyone invited me anyway.

gram.name: 插入式限定从句
gram.function: 用于在主要陈述之后添加一个补充的、常常是带有自嘲或讽刺意味的限定性评论。'I didn't smile, not that anyone could tell if I had' 表明“不笑”这个行为其实没什么意义，因为即使他笑了别人也可能看不出来。这是一种传达复杂情绪和自我意识的方式。

example.en: He offered to help, not that I actually needed his help.
example.cn: 他主动提出要帮忙，倒也不是说我真的需要他的帮助。

gram.constraints: 是一种较为高级的口语和非正式写作技巧。

paras.en: I noticed not too long ago that even though people were getting used to me, no one would actually touch me. I didn't realize this at first because it's not like kids go around touching each other that much in middle school anyway. But last Thursday in dance class, which is, like, my least favorite class, Mrs. Atanabi, the teacher, tried to make Ximena Chin be my dance partner. Now, I've never actually seen someone have a "panic attack" before, but I have heard about it, and I'm pretty sure Ximena had a panic attack at that second. She got really nervous and turned pale and literally broke into a sweat within a minute, and then she came up with some lame excuse about really having to go to the bathroom. Anyway, Mrs. Atanabi let her off the hook, because she ended up not making anyone dance together.
paras.cn: 不久前我注意到，尽管人们正在逐渐习惯我，但没有人会真的碰我。我一开始没意识到这一点，因为反正初中生也不会到处互相碰来碰去。但上周四在舞蹈课上——那大概是我最不喜欢的课——老师阿塔纳比夫人想让西梅纳·陈做我的舞伴。我以前从未真正见过有人“恐慌发作”，但我听说过，而且我敢肯定西梅纳在那一秒钟就是恐慌发作了。她变得非常紧张，脸色发白，真的在一分钟内就冒出了一身汗，然后她想出了一个蹩脚的借口，说真的必须去洗手间。总之，阿塔纳比夫人放了她一马，因为她最后没有让任何人一起跳舞。

vocab.ex: It took a while for him to get used to his new job.
He's always going around telling people what to do.
Thinking about the big exam gave him a panic attack.
She turned pale when she saw the ghost in the movie.
He broke into a sweat when the police officer asked for his ID.
She came up with a great idea for the project.
He gave a lame excuse about his dog eating his homework.

vocab.mean: 放某人一马；让某人摆脱困境
vocab.ex: The teacher let him off the hook for being late because his bus was delayed.

gram.name: It's not like... 结构
gram.function: 用于反驳一个潜在的假设或澄清一种情况，意为“又不是说…”。'it's not like kids go around touching each other...' 是在解释他为什么一开始没注意到这个问题的原因，即“初中生本来就不会互相触碰”。

example.en: You don't have to whisper. It's not like the baby is sleeping.
example.cn: 你不用小声说话。又不是说宝宝在睡觉。

gram.constraints: 是一种常见的口语化表达方式。

paras.en: Then yesterday in my science elective, we were doing this cool mystery-powder investigation where we had to classify a substance as an acid or a base. Everyone had to heat their mystery powders on a heating plate and make observations, so we were all huddled around the powders with our notebooks. Now, there are eight kids in the elective, and seven of them were squished together on one side of the plate while one of them—me—had loads of room on the other side. So of course I noticed this, but I was hoping Ms. Rubin wouldn't notice this, because I didn't want her to say something. But of course she did notice this, and of course she said something. "Guys, there's plenty of room on that side. Tristan, Nino, go over there," she said, so Tristan and Nino scooted over to my side.
paras.cn: 然后昨天在我的科学选修课上，我们正在做一个很酷的神秘粉末调查，我们需要将一种物质分类为酸或碱。每个人都得在加热板上加热他们的神秘粉末并做观察，所以我们都围着粉末，拿着笔记本挤在一起。选修课有八个孩子，其中七个挤在加热板的一边，而其中一个——我——在另一边有大把的空间。所以我当然注意到了这一点，但我希望鲁宾女士不会注意到，因为我不想让她说什么。但她当然注意到了，也当然说了些什么。“伙计们，那边有足够的空间。特里斯坦，尼诺，去那边，” 她说，所以特里斯坦和尼诺就挪到了我这边。

vocab.ex: Scientists classify the new species as a type of insect.
The mysterious green substance was glowing in the dark.
The children huddled around the campfire to stay warm.
Five people were squished together on the small sofa.
Don't worry, we have loads of time before the train leaves.
Could you scoot over a bit so I can sit down?

gram.name: 使用 'of course' 进行强调
gram.pattern: So of course... but of course... and of course...
gram.function: 通过重复使用 'of course'，叙述者表达了一种无奈和“不出所料”的宿命感。它强调了他所害怕的事情（被注意到、老师说话）的必然发生，增加了叙事的戏剧张力。

example.en: I was hoping it wouldn't rain, but of course, the moment I left the house, the storm began.
example.cn: 我本希望不会下雨，但当然了，我一出门，暴风雨就开始了。

gram.constraints: 是一种表达预期或反讽的常用手法。

paras.en: Tristan and Nino have always been okay-nice to me. I want to go on record as saying that. Not super-nice, like they go out of their way to hang out with me, but okaynice, like they say hello to me and talk to me like normal. And they didn't even make a face when Ms. Rubin told them to come on my side, which a lot of kids do when they think I'm not looking. Anyway, everything was going fine until Tristan's mystery powder started melting. He moved his foil off the plate just as my powder began to melt, too, which is why I went to move mine off the plate, and then my hand accidentally bumped his hand for a fraction of a second. Tristan jerked his hand away so fast he dropped his foil on the floor while also knocking everyone else's foil off the heating plate.
paras.cn: 特里斯坦和尼诺一直以来都对我还算友善。我想郑重声明这一点。不是超级友善，比如特意来和我玩，而是还算友善，比如他们会跟我打招呼，正常地跟我说话。而且当鲁宾女士让他们到我这边来时，他们甚至没有做鬼脸，很多孩子在我以为我没看的时候都会那么做。总之，一切都还顺利，直到特里斯坦的神秘粉末开始融化。他刚把他的箔纸从加热板上移开，我的粉末也开始融化了，这就是为什么我也去移动我的箔纸，然后我的手不小心碰了他的手零点几秒。特里斯坦猛地把手抽开，速度之快以至于他的箔纸掉在了地上，同时还把其他所有人的箔纸都从加热板上撞了下来。

vocab.ex: He's not a close friend, but he's always okay-nice to me in the hallway.
I want to go on record as saying that this was the best decision we could have made.
She always goes out of her way to help new employees feel welcome.
The child made a face when he had to eat his vegetables.
The phone rang just as I was leaving the house.
The camera can capture images in a fraction of a second.
She jerked her hand away from the hot stove.

gram.name: 结果状语从句（省略 that）
gram.function: 用于强调程度之深以至于产生了某种结果。在口语化的叙述中，连词 'that' 常常被省略。'Tristan jerked his hand away so fast he dropped his foil...' 强调了抽手速度之快及其导致的后果。

example.en: He ran so fast he was out of breath.
example.cn: 他跑得太快了，以至于上气不接下气。

gram.constraints: 是一种常见的非正式用法。

paras.en: "Tristan!" yelled Ms. Rubin, but Tristan didn't even care about the spilled powder on the floor or that he ruined the experiment. What he was most concerned about was getting to the lab sink to wash his hands as fast as possible. That's when I knew for sure that there was this thing about touching me at Beecher Prep. I think it's like the Cheese Touch in Diary of a Wimpy Kid. The kids in that story were afraid they'd catch the cooties if they touched the old moldy cheese on the basketball court. At Beecher Prep, I'm the old moldy cheese.
paras.cn: “特里斯坦！” 鲁宾女士喊道，但特里斯坦甚至不在乎洒在地上的粉末，也不在乎他毁了实验。他最关心的是尽快到实验室水槽去洗手。就在那时我确切地知道，在比彻预备学校，存在着这么一件关于触碰我的事。我觉得这就像《小屁孩日记》里的“奶酪之触”。那个故事里的孩子们害怕如果他们碰到篮球场上那块发霉的旧奶酪就会染上“酷蒂虫”。在比彻预备学校，我就是那块发霉的旧奶酪。

vocab.ex: He carefully cleaned up the spilled milk.
The sudden rain completely ruined our picnic.
She is very concerned about her son's health.
I can't say for sure, but I think the meeting is at 2 PM.

vocab.mean: 奶酪之触（《小屁孩日记》中的概念）
vocab.ex: In elementary school, nobody wanted to get the imaginary Cheese Touch.

vocab.mean: （儿童用语）染上“酷蒂虫”（一种想象中的病菌）
vocab.ex: The little kids ran away from the girls, shouting 'Don't let them give you cooties!'
You can't eat that bread; it's old and moldy.

gram.name: 隐喻（用于身份认同）
gram.function: 通过将一个事物直接等同于另一个不相关的事物来创造一个强烈的、富有情感的比较，不使用 'like' 或 'as'。'I'm the old moldy cheese' 是一个极其有力的隐喻，它不仅解释了孩子们的回避行为，更深刻地揭示了主角对自己被排斥、被视为“不洁之物”的身份认同，传达出强烈的孤独和悲伤。

example.en: During the argument, her words were daggers.
example.cn: 争吵中，她的话语就像一把把匕首。

gram.constraints: 是一种核心的文学修辞手法。

paras.en: For me, Halloween is the best holiday in the world. It even beats Christmas. I get to dress up in a costume. I get to wear a mask. I get to go around like every other kid with a mask and nobody thinks I look weird. Nobody takes a second look. Nobody notices me. Nobody knows me.
paras.cn: 对我来说，万圣节是世界上最好的节日。它甚至胜过圣诞节。我得以穿上戏服。我得以戴上面具。我得以像其他每个戴面具的孩子一样到处走动，没有人觉得我长得奇怪。没有人会多看一眼。没有人注意到我。没有人认识我。

vocab.ex: In my opinion, summer beats winter every time.
The children love to dress up in their parents' clothes.
She spent weeks making her own Halloween costume.
He told me a weird story about seeing a ghost.

vocab.mean: 再看一眼（通常出于惊讶或兴趣）
vocab.ex: The car was so unusual that everyone on the street had to take a second look.

gram.name: 首语重复法 (Nobody...)
gram.pattern: Repetition of a word at the beginning of successive clauses.
gram.function: 通过在连续的句子开头重复 'Nobody...'，作者建立了一种强烈的节奏感，并有力地强调了主角在万圣节感受到的匿名性和“正常感”。这种手法层层递进地描述了面具带给他的解放。

example.en: He had no money. He had no friends. He had no hope.
example.cn: 他没有钱。他没有朋友。他没有希望。

gram.constraints: 是一种强有力的修辞手法，用于强调和增强情感。

paras.en: I wish every day could be Halloween. We could all wear masks all the time. Then we could walk around and get to know each other before we got to see what we looked like under the masks.
paras.cn: 我希望每天都是万圣节。我们就可以一直都戴着面具。然后我们就可以四处走动，在看到彼此面具下的长相之前先互相了解。

vocab.ex: He wore a scary mask for Halloween.
He complains about his job all the time.
It takes time to really get to know someone.

gram.name: wish + could (表示与现在事实相反的愿望)
gram.function: 用于表达对现在或将来不可能实现的情况的愿望。'I wish every day could be Halloween' 和 'We could all wear masks...' 表达了主角对一个理想化、不真实世界的向往。

example.en: I wish I could fly like a bird.
example.cn: 我希望我能像鸟一样飞翔。

gram.constraints: wish 后面的从句使用过去时态来表示虚拟。

paras.en: When I was little, I used to wear an astronaut helmet everywhere I went. To the playground. To the supermarket. To pick Via up from school. Even in the middle of summer, though it was so hot my face would sweat. I think I wore it for a couple of years, but I had to stop wearing it when I had my eye surgery. I was about seven, I think. And then we couldn't find the helmet after that. Mom looked everywhere for it. She figured that it had probably ended up in Grans's attic, and she kept meaning to look for it, but by then I had gotten used to not wearing it.
paras.cn: 我小的时候，无论去哪里都戴着一个宇航员头盔。去操场。去超市。去学校接维娅。即使在盛夏，尽管天气热得我满脸是汗。我想我戴了它好几年，但在我做眼睛手术时就不得不停止戴了。我想我那时大约七岁。然后那之后我们就找不到那个头盔了。妈妈到处找它。她琢磨着它可能最终被放在了奶奶的阁楼里，她一直想着要去找找，但到那时我已经习惯不戴它了。

vocab.ex: The museum had a real astronaut helmet on display.
He started to sweat during the intense workout.
After the eye surgery, his vision improved significantly.
I figure it's going to rain later, so I'll bring an umbrella.
We store our old Christmas decorations in the attic.
I keep meaning to call my grandmother, but I've been so busy.
It took a while for him to get used to his new job.

gram.name: 使用句子片段进行列举
gram.function: 通过使用一系列语法上不完整的句子片段（'To the playground.' 'To the supermarket.'...）来列举地点，创造了一种快速、有力的节奏感，强调了主角戴头盔的普遍性。

example.en: He loved all kinds of sports. Football. Basketball. Baseball.
example.cn: 他热爱各种运动。足球。篮球。棒球。

gram.constraints: 是一种文学和修辞手法，在正式写作中应谨慎使用。

paras.en: I have pictures of me in all my Halloween costumes. My first Halloween I was a pumpkin. My second I was Tigger. My third I was Peter Pan (my dad dressed up as Captain Hook). My fourth I was Captain Hook (my dad dressed up as Peter Pan). My fifth I was an astronaut. My sixth I was Obi-Wan Kenobi. My seventh I was a clone trooper. My eighth I was Darth Vader. My ninth I was the Bleeding Scream, the one that has fake blood oozing out over the skull mask.
paras.cn: 我有我所有万圣节服装的照片。我第一个万圣节扮的是南瓜。第二个是跳跳虎。第三个是彼得·潘（我爸爸扮成了铁钩船长）。第四个是铁钩船长（我爸爸扮成了彼得·潘）。第五个是宇航员。第六个是欧比旺·克诺比。第七个是克隆人士兵。第八个是达斯·维达。第九个是流血的鬼脸，就是那种有假血从骷髅面具上渗出来的那款。

vocab.ex: The army consisted of thousands of identical clone troopers.

vocab.mean: 流血鬼脸（一种万圣节面具）
vocab.ex: He bought a Bleeding Scream costume that looked really scary.
Thick mud started to ooze out from the crack in the pipe.
Pirate flags often feature a skull and crossbones.

gram.name: 平行列举（省略式）
gram.function: 通过重复 'My [ordinal number] Halloween I was...' 这种平行结构，并省略了部分连接词，作者创造了一种快速、清单式的叙事节奏，有效地展示了主角历年的万圣节装扮。

example.en: Monday I have math. Tuesday I have science. Wednesday I have history.
example.cn: 周一我有数学课。周二我有科学课。周三我有历史课。

gram.constraints: 是一种紧凑的列举方式。

paras.en: This year I'm going to be Boba Fett: not Boba Fett the kid in Star Wars Episode II: Attack of the Clones, but Boba Fett the man from Star Wars Episode V: The Empire Strikes Back . Mom searched everywhere for the costume but couldn't find one in my size, so she bought me a Jango Fett costume—since Jango was Boba's dad and wore the same armor—and then painted the armor green. She did some other stuff to it to make it look worn, too. Anyway, it looks totally real. Mom's good at costumes.
paras.cn: 今年我要扮成波巴·费特：不是《星球大战2：克隆人的进攻》里的小孩波巴·费特，而是《星球大战5：帝国反击战》里的成年人波巴·费特。妈妈到处找这套戏服，但找不到我的尺码，所以她给我买了一套詹戈·费特的戏服——因为詹戈是波巴的爸爸，穿着同样的盔甲——然后把盔甲涂成了绿色。她还对它做了些别的处理，让它看起来很旧。总之，它看起来完全是真的。妈妈很擅长做戏服。

vocab.ex: I love these shoes, but they don't have them in my size.
The knight's armor was heavy and strong.
He was wearing a pair of old, worn jeans.
She is very good at playing the piano.

gram.name: not... but... (用于澄清)
gram.function: 用于精确地区分两个相似但不同的事物，否定前者，肯定后者。“not Boba Fett the kid... but Boba Fett the man...” 清晰地指明了主角想要扮演的具体角色版本。

example.en: I ordered the green tea, not the black tea.
example.cn: 我点的是绿茶，不是红茶。

gram.constraints: X和Y的结构应保持平行。

paras.en: In homeroom we all talked about what we were going to be for Halloween. Charlotte was going as Hermione from Harry Potter. Jack was going as a wolfman. I heard that Julian was going as Jango Fett, which was a weird coincidence. I don't think he liked hearing that I was going as Boba Fett.
paras.cn: 在班级教室，我们都讨论了万圣节要扮成什么。夏洛特要扮成《哈利·波特》里的赫敏。杰克要扮成狼人。我听说朱利安要扮成詹戈·费特，这真是个奇怪的巧合。我觉得他不喜欢听到我要扮成波巴·费特。

vocab.ex: What are you planning to go as for the costume party?
The classic horror movie featured a terrifying wolfman.
It's weird that the store is closed on a Tuesday.
Meeting my childhood friend in a different country was an amazing coincidence.

gram.name: 动名词作动词宾语
gram.function: 某些动词（如 like, dislike, enjoy, finish）后面可以跟动名词作宾语。'he liked hearing...' 意思是“他喜欢‘听到’这件事”。

example.en: She enjoys reading historical novels.
example.cn: 她喜欢读历史小说。

gram.constraints: 需要记住哪些动词后面跟动名词。

paras.en: On the morning of Halloween, Via had this big crying meltdown about something. Via's always been so calm and cool, but this year she's had a couple of these kinds of fits. Dad was late for work and was like, "Via, let's go! Let's go!" Usually Dad is super patient about things, but not when it comes to his being late for work, and his yelling just stressed out Via even more, and she started crying louder, so Mom told Dad to take me to school and that she'd deal with Via. Then Mom kissed me goodbye quickly, before I even put on my costume, and disappeared into Via's room.
paras.cn: 万圣节的早上，维娅因为某件事大哭大闹了一场。维娅一直都那么冷静沉着，但今年她已经有过几次这样的发作了。爸爸上班要迟到了，就说：“维娅，走了！走了！” 通常爸爸对事情都超级有耐心，但涉及到他上班迟到就不行了，他的吼叫让维娅压力更大，她开始哭得更响了，所以妈妈告诉爸爸带我去学校，她来处理维娅。然后妈妈匆匆地亲了我一下告别，在我还没穿上戏服之前，就消失在维娅的房间里了。

vocab.ex: The toddler had a complete meltdown in the middle of the supermarket.
He had a fit of anger and slammed the door.
You need to be patient when you are learning a new skill.
Working long hours really starts to stress me out.
I have to deal with a lot of customer complaints in my job.

gram.name: when it comes to...
gram.function: 用于引出一个特定的话题或方面，意为“当谈到…时”。'...but not when it comes to his being late for work' 将爸爸的耐心限定在一个特定的情境之外，清晰地说明了例外的条件。

example.en: He's very talented in music, but when it comes to sports, he's not very good.
example.cn: 他在音乐方面很有天赋，但一谈到体育，他就不太行了。

gram.constraints: 'to' 在这里是介词，后面必须跟名词或动名词。

paras.en: "Auggie, let's go now!" said Dad. "I have a meeting I can't be late for!" "I haven't put my costume on yet!" "So put it on, already. Five minutes. I'll meet you outside." I rushed to my room and started to put on the Boba Fett costume, but all of a sudden I didn't feel like wearing it. I'm not sure why—maybe because it had all these belts that needed to be tightened and I needed someone's help to put it on. Or maybe it was because it still smelled a little like paint. All I knew was that it was a lot of work to put the costume on, and Dad was waiting and would get super impatient if I made him late. So, at the last minute, I threw on the Bleeding Scream costume from last year. It was such an easy costume: just a long black robe and a big white mask. I yelled goodbye from the door on my way out, but Mom didn't even hear me.
paras.cn: “奥吉，我们现在就走！” 爸爸说。“我有个不能迟到的会议！” “我还没穿上我的戏服呢！” “那就快穿上吧。五分钟。我在外面等你。” 我冲进我的房间，开始穿波巴·费特的戏服，但突然之间我不想穿了。我不确定为什么——也许是因为它有很多需要系紧的带子，我需要别人帮忙才能穿上。或者也许是因为它还有点油漆味。我只知道穿上这套戏服很费事，而且爸爸在等，如果我让他迟到，他会变得超级不耐烦。所以，在最后一刻，我穿上了去年的流血鬼脸戏服。那是一套非常简单的戏服：就是一件长长的黑袍和一个大大的白面具。我在出门时从门口喊了声再见，但妈妈甚至没听到我。

vocab.ex: It's cold outside, so you should put on a coat.
We were walking in the park when all of a sudden it started to rain.
You need to tighten the screws to make the shelf stable.
He grew impatient waiting in the long line.
I was late, so I just threw on a T-shirt and jeans.
The judge wore a long black robe in the courtroom.

gram.name: Maybe because... Or maybe because... (推测原因)
gram.pattern: Maybe because [reason A]. Or maybe because [reason B].
gram.function: 用于列举几个可能的原因来解释一个自己也不确定的情况。这种结构模仿了真实的思考过程，展示了叙述者在分析自己突然改变主意时的不确定性。

example.en: He didn't come to the party. Maybe because he was tired. Or maybe because he had other plans.
example.cn: 他没来参加派对。也许是因为他累了。或者也许是因为他有其他安排。

gram.constraints: 是一种常见的自我分析或推测的表达方式。

paras.en: "I thought you were going as Jango Fett," said Dad when I got outside. "Boba Fett!" "Whatever," said Dad. "This is a better costume anyway." "Yeah, it's cool," I answered.
paras.cn: “我以为你要扮成詹戈·费特呢，” 我出去时爸爸说。“是波巴·费特！” “随便啦，” 爸爸说。“反正这套戏服更好。” “是的，它很酷，” 我回答。

vocab.ex: What are you planning to go as for the costume party?
You don't like my idea? Whatever, I'll do it myself.
I know it's expensive, but I'm going to buy it anyway.

gram.name: 过去进行时（表示过去的预期）
gram.function: 用于表达过去某个时间点对（当时）未来的预期或计划，而这个预期与后来的实际情况不符。'I thought you were going as Jango Fett' 意思是“我原以为你打算扮成詹戈·费特”，暗示了与当前情况（穿着另一套服装）的差异。

example.en: I thought you were coming to the party tonight!
example.cn: 我原以为你今晚会来参加派对的！

gram.constraints: 是一种表达预期与现实出入的常见方式。

paras.en: Walking through the halls that morning on my way to the lockers was, I have to say, absolutely awesome. Everything was different now. I was different. Where I usually walked with my head down, trying to avoid being seen, today I walked with my head up, looking around. I wanted to be seen. One kid wearing the same exact costume as mine, long white skull face oozing fake red blood, high-fived me as we passed each other on the stairs. I have no idea who he was, and he had no idea who I was, and I wondered for a second if he would have ever done that if he'd known it was me under the mask.
paras.cn: 那天早上，在我去储物柜的路上穿过走廊的感觉，我必须说，简直太棒了。现在一切都不同了。我变得不同了。我通常都是低着头走，试图避免被人看见，但今天我抬着头走，环顾四周。我想被看见。一个穿着和我一模一样戏服的孩子，长长的白色骷髅脸，渗出假血，我们在楼梯上擦肩而过时和我击了个掌。我完全不知道他是谁，他也完全不知道我是谁，我有那么一瞬间在想，如果他知道面具下是我，他还会不会那么做。

vocab.ex: We had an awesome time at the concert.
The spy moved silently, trying to avoid being seen by the guards.
Thick mud started to ooze out from the crack in the pipe.
After they won the game, the teammates began to high-five each other.
I have no idea where I left my keys.

gram.name: 行为对比
gram.pattern: Where I usually [behavior A], today I [behavior B].
gram.function: 通过使用 'Where' (在此处作用类似于 'whereas' 或 'while') 来引导一个描述常态的从句，并将其与当天（'today'）的行为进行直接对比，有力地突显了主角在万圣节这一天心态和行为上的巨大转变。

example.en: Where he is usually very quiet, today he was the life of the party.
example.cn: 他通常很安静，然而今天他却是派对的焦点。

gram.constraints: 是一种展示变化和对比的有效句法结构。

paras.en: I was starting to think this was going to go down as one of the most awesome days in the history of my life, but then I got to homeroom. The first costume I saw as I walked inside the door was Darth Sidious. It had one of the rubber masks that are so realistic, with a big black hood over the head and a long black robe. I knew right away it was Julian, of course. He must have changed his costume at the last minute because he thought I was coming as Jango Fett. He was talking to two mummies who must have been Miles and Henry, and they were all kind of looking at the door like they were waiting for someone to come through it. I knew it wasn't a Bleeding Scream they were looking for. It was a Boba Fett.
paras.cn: 我开始觉得这将成为我生命史上最棒的日子之一，但接着我到了班级教室。我一走进门看到的第一套戏服是达斯·西迪厄斯。那是一个非常逼真的橡胶面具，头上罩着一个大大的黑兜帽，穿着一件长长的黑袍。我当然立刻就知道那是朱利安。他一定是在最后一刻换了戏服，因为他以为我会扮成詹戈·费特。他正在和两个木乃伊说话，那一定是迈尔斯和亨利，他们都有点看着门口，好像在等什么人进来。我知道他们等的不是流血鬼脸。而是一个波巴·费特。

vocab.ex: That match will go down as one of the greatest in history.
The special effects in the movie were incredibly realistic.
He pulled up the hood of his sweatshirt to protect himself from the rain.
The museum exhibit featured an ancient Egyptian mummy.

gram.name: 情态动词推测 (must have)
gram.function: 用于对过去发生的事情进行非常肯定的推测或推断。'He must have changed his costume' 和 'who must have been Miles and Henry' 表达了主角根据现有线索做出的强烈猜测。

example.en: The ground is wet. It must have rained last night.
example.cn: 地面是湿的。昨晚肯定下雨了。

gram.constraints: 只用于对过去事件的推测。

paras.en: I was going to go and sit at my usual desk, but for some reason, I don't know why, I found myself walking over to a desk near them, and I could hear them talking. One of the mummies was saying: "It really does look like him." "Like this part especially . . . ," answered Julian's voice. He put his fingers on the cheeks and eyes of his Darth Sidious mask. "Actually," said the mummy, "what he really looks like is one of those shrunken heads. Have you ever seen those? He looks exactly like that." "I think he looks like an orc." "Oh yeah!"
paras.cn: 我本打算去坐我平常的座位，但不知什么原因，我也不知道为什么，我发现自己走向了他们附近的一张桌子，我能听到他们在说话。其中一个木乃伊说：“那真的挺像他的。” “尤其是这个部分......，” 朱利安的声音回答。他把手指放在他达斯·西迪厄斯面具的脸颊和眼睛上。“其实，” 那个木乃伊说，“他真正像的是那种缩小的头颅。你见过那些吗？他长得和那个一模一样。” “我觉得他像个半兽人。” “哦是的！”

vocab.mean: 不知何故；不知什么原因
vocab.ex: For some reason, the key isn't working in the lock today.
I meant to go to the library, but I found myself walking toward the coffee shop instead.
The explorer's collection included a real shrunken head from South America.
The hero fought an army of orcs in the fantasy novel.

gram.name: 强调助动词 (do/does)
gram.function: 在肯定句中使用助动词 'do/does' 来强调谓语动词，表示“确实；真的”。'It really does look like him' 强调了相似性的真实程度，加强了话语的肯定语气。

example.en: Even though he's quiet, he does have strong opinions.
example.cn: 尽管他很安静，但他确实有很强的观点。

gram.constraints: 助动词后必须跟动词原形。

paras.en: "If I looked like that," said the Julian voice, kind of laughing, "I swear to God, I'd put a hood over my face every day." "I've thought about this a lot," said the second mummy, sounding serious, "and I really think . . . if I looked like him, seriously, I think that I'd kill myself." "You would not," answered Darth Sidious. "Yeah, for real," insisted the same mummy. "I can't imagine looking in the mirror every day and seeing myself like that. It would be too awful. And getting stared at all the time." "Then why do you hang out with him so much?" asked Darth Sidious.
paras.cn: “如果我长成那样，” 朱利安的声音说，有点像在笑，“我向上帝发誓，我每天都会用兜帽罩住我的脸。” “这件事我想了很多，” 第二个木乃伊说，听起来很严肃，“我真的觉得……如果我长得像他，说真的，我想我会自杀。” “你不会的，” 达斯·西迪厄斯回答。“是的，真的，” 同一个木乃伊坚持说。“我无法想象每天照镜子看到自己是那个样子。那太可怕了。而且一直被人盯着看。” “那你为什么还跟他玩得那么近？” 达斯·西迪厄斯问。

vocab.mean: 我向上帝发誓（用于极度强调）
vocab.ex: I swear to God, I had no idea this was going to happen.
Are you for real? You can't be serious about quitting your job.
He kept insisting he was right, even when we showed him the evidence.
The weather was awful, so we stayed inside all day.
He likes to hang out with his friends on the weekend.

gram.name: 第二条件句
gram.function: 用于描述与现在事实相反的、不可能或极不可能发生的假设情况及其可能的结果。孩子们用这个句型（'If I looked like that...', 'if I looked like him...'）来想象如果他们拥有主角的外貌时会怎么做，以此来表达他们的排斥和恐惧。

example.en: If I had more time, I would learn a new language.
example.cn: 如果我有更多时间，我就会学一门新语言。

gram.constraints: 条件从句用一般过去时（be动词通常用were），主句用'would/could/should/might + 动词原形'。

paras.en: "I don't know," answered the mummy. "Tushman asked me to hang out with him at the beginning of the year, and he must have told all the teachers to put us next to each other in all our classes, or something." The mummy shrugged. I knew the shrug, of course. I knew the voice. I knew I wanted to run out of the class right then and there. But I stood where I was and listened to Jack Will finish what he was saying. "I mean, the thing is: he always follows me around. What am I supposed to do?" "Just ditch him," said Julian.
paras.cn: “我不知道，” 那个木乃伊回答。“塔什曼先生在年初让我和他一起玩，而且他肯定告诉了所有老师在所有课上都把我们安排在一起，之类的。” 那个木乃伊耸了耸肩。我当然认得那个耸肩的动作。我认得那个声音。我知道我当时就想立刻跑出教室。但我站在原地，听着杰克·威尔说完他要说的话。“我的意思是，问题是：他总是跟着我。我该怎么办？” “甩掉他就行了，” 朱利安说。

vocab.ex: He said he was a doctor or something.
She was so angry that she quit her job right then and there.
Despite his fear, he stood where he was and faced the danger.
You were supposed to finish your homework before watching TV.
He decided to ditch his friends and go to the movies alone.

gram.name: 首语重复法 (I knew...)
gram.pattern: Repetition of a phrase at the beginning of successive clauses.
gram.function: 通过在连续的句子开头重复 'I knew...'，作者建立了一种快速、冲击力强的节奏，生动地描绘了主角在瞬间意识到说话人身份时的震惊和心碎。

example.en: I knew his face. I knew his voice. I knew he was the one.
example.cn: 我认得他的脸。我认得他的声音。我知道就是他。

gram.constraints: 是一种强有力的修辞手法，用于强调顿悟或强烈的认知。

paras.en: I don't know what Jack answered because I walked out of the class without anyone knowing I had been there. My face felt like it was on fire while I walked back down the stairs. I was sweating under my costume. And I started crying. I couldn't keep it from happening. The tears were so thick in my eyes I could barely see, but I couldn't wipe them through the mask as I walked. I was looking for a little tiny spot to disappear into. I wanted a hole I could fall inside of: a little black hole that would eat me up.
paras.cn: 我不知道杰克回答了什么，因为我走出了教室，没有人知道我曾在那儿。我走下楼梯时，感觉脸像着了火一样。我的戏服下面在出汗。我开始哭了。我无法阻止它发生。眼泪在我眼中如此浓厚，我几乎看不见，但我走着路，无法透过面具擦掉它们。我正在寻找一个可以消失进去的小小地方。我想要一个可以掉进去的洞：一个可以把我吞噬掉的小小黑洞。

vocab.ex: Her cheeks were on fire with embarrassment.
He tried to fix the leak, but he couldn't keep the water from coming in.
A thick fog covered the city in the morning.
I could barely hear what he was saying over the loud music.
The rabbit disappeared into the bushes.
Scientists study the mysterious properties of black holes.

gram.name: 逃避的隐喻
gram.pattern: Desire for a physical escape to represent emotional escape.
gram.function: 通过使用具体的、物理的意象，如“可以消失进去的小小地方”和“可以把我吞噬掉的小小黑洞”，作者将主角内心极度痛苦、想要逃避现实的情感具象化。这种隐喻比直接说“我想逃避”更具画面感和情感冲击力。

example.en: He wished he could build a wall around himself to keep the sadness out.
example.cn: 他希望他能在自己周围建一堵墙，把悲伤挡在外面。

gram.constraints: 是一种将抽象情感转化为具体意象的文学技巧。

paras.en: Rat boy. Freak. Monster. Freddy Krueger. E.T. Gross-out. Lizard face. Mutant. I know the names they call me. I've been in enough playgrounds to know kids can be mean. I know, I know, I know.
paras.cn: 老鼠男孩。怪物。妖怪。弗莱迪·克鲁格。外星人E.T.。恶心鬼。蜥蜴脸。变种人。我知道他们叫我的那些名字。我去过足够多的操场，知道孩子们可以很刻薄。我知道，我知道，我知道。

vocab.ex: He was called a freak just for having different interests.
The movie was a complete gross-out, full of disgusting scenes.
The comic book was about a team of teenage mutants with superpowers.
It was mean of him to say such hurtful things.

gram.name: 使用片段进行列举
gram.function: 通过使用一系列语法上不完整的句子片段（全都是名词或名词短语），作者创造了一种快速、冲击力强的节奏，有力地列举了主角遭受的各种侮辱性绰号，让读者立刻感受到那种扑面而来的恶意。

example.en: Rain. Wind. Cold. It was a terrible day for a picnic.
example.cn: 雨。风。寒冷。这真是个不适合野餐的糟糕日子。

gram.constraints: 是一种文学和修辞手法，用于增强语气和节奏。

paras.en: I ended up in the second-floor bathroom. No one was there because first period had started and everyone was in class. I locked the door to my stall and took off my mask and just cried for I don't know how long. Then I went to the nurse's office and told her I had a stomach ache, which was true, because I felt like I'd been kicked in the gut. Nurse Molly called Mom and had me lie down on the sofa next to her desk. Fifteen minutes later, Mom was at the door.
paras.cn: 我最后躲进了二楼的卫生间。那里没人，因为第一节课已经开始，大家都在教室里。我锁上隔间的门，摘下面具，就那样哭了，不知道哭了多久。然后我去了医务室，告诉护士我肚子疼，这也是真的，因为我感觉就像被人狠狠踢了一脚肚子。莫莉护士给妈妈打了电话，让我躺在她办公桌旁边的沙发上。十五分钟后，妈妈就出现在门口了。

vocab.mean: 最终到达（某地）；结果陷入（某种境地）
vocab.ex: After getting lost in the city, we ended up in a strange neighborhood.
He waited for an empty stall in the public restroom.
Please take off your shoes before entering the house.
Eating too much candy gave him a stomach ache.

vocab.mean: （感觉）像被狠狠踢了一脚肚子（比喻极度震惊或伤心）
vocab.ex: When he heard the devastating news, he felt like he had been kicked in the gut.
If you're not feeling well, you should lie down for a while.

gram.name: 比喻（用于描述情感痛苦）
gram.function: 通过将抽象的情感痛苦（'stomach ache'）与一种具体的、剧烈的物理疼痛（'kicked in the gut'）进行类比，作者生动地传达了主角内心感受到的巨大冲击和伤害。

example.en: Losing the championship felt like a punch to the stomach.
example.cn: 输掉冠军赛的感觉就像肚子上挨了一拳。

gram.constraints: 是一种将情感具象化的有效修辞手法。

paras.en: "Sweetness," she said, coming over to hug me. "Hi," I mumbled. I didn't want her to ask anything until afterward. "You have a stomach ache?" she asked, automatically putting her hand on my forehead to check for my temperature. "He said he feels like throwing up," said Nurse Molly, looking at me with very nice eyes. "And I have a headache," I whispered. "I wonder if it's something you ate," said Mom, looking worried. "There's a stomach bug going around," said Nurse Molly.
paras.cn: “小甜心，” 她说着，走过来拥抱我。“嗨，” 我咕哝道。我不想让她在事后之前问任何事。“你肚子疼吗？” 她问，同时自动地把手放在我的额头上检查我的体温。“他说他感觉想吐，” 莫莉护士说，用非常友善的眼神看着我。“而且我头也疼，” 我低声说。“我在想是不是你吃了什么东西，” 妈妈说，看起来很担心。“最近正流行肠胃炎，” 莫莉护士说。

vocab.ex: "Good morning, sweetness," she said to her daughter.
Let's go to the movies first and get dinner afterward.
When the baby cried, she automatically reached out to comfort him.
He wiped the sweat from his forehead with the back of his hand.
He ate some bad seafood and felt like he was going to throw up.
A lot of students are absent today because a stomach bug is going around the school.

gram.name: 现在分词作伴随状语
gram.function: 用于描述与主句动作同时发生的伴随动作或方式。'...she asked, automatically putting her hand on my forehead...' 将“问话”和“放手”这两个动作紧密连接，生动地展示了母亲关切的本能反应。

example.en: He walked out of the room, slamming the door behind him.
example.cn: 他走出房间，砰地一声关上了门。

gram.constraints: 分词的逻辑主语必须是主句的主语。

paras.en: "Oh geez," said Mom, her eyebrows going up as she shook her head. She helped me to my feet. "Should I call a taxi or are you okay walking home?" "I can walk." "What a brave kid!" said Nurse Molly, patting me on the back as she walked us toward the door. "If he starts throwing up or runs a temperature, you should call the doctor." "Absolutely," said Mom, shaking Nurse Molly's hand. "Thank you so much for taking care of him."
paras.cn: “哦天哪，” 妈妈说，她摇着头，眉毛扬了起来。她扶我站起来。“我该叫辆出租车还是你自己可以走回家？” “我能走。” “真是个勇敢的孩子！” 莫莉护士说，一边拍着我的背一边送我们走向门口。“如果他开始吐或者发烧，你应该给医生打电话。” “当然，” 妈妈说，和莫莉护士握着手。“太感谢您照顾他了。”

vocab.mean: 哦天哪（表示担心或懊恼）
vocab.ex: Oh geez, I forgot my wallet at home.
The audience rose to their feet to give a standing ovation.
If the child starts to run a temperature, you should call a doctor.
"Are you sure about this?" "Absolutely."
She needs someone to take care of her dog while she's on vacation.

gram.name: 独立主格结构（含分词）
gram.function: 在句子中作状语，提供附加的细节或伴随情况，其逻辑主语与主句主语不同。'...her eyebrows going up...' 描述了妈妈说话时的一种伴随表情，生动地传达了她的担忧。

example.en: He listened intently, his head tilted to one side.
example.cn: 他专注地听着，头侧向一边。

gram.constraints: 它在语法上独立于主句，通常用逗号隔开。

paras.en: "My pleasure," answered Nurse Molly, putting her hand under my chin and tilting my face up. "You take care of yourself, okay?" I nodded and mumbled "Thank you." Mom and I hug-walked the whole way home. I didn't tell her anything about what had happened, and later when she asked me if I felt well enough to go trick-or-treating after school, I said no. This worried her, since she knew how much I usually loved trick-or-treating.
paras.cn: “我的荣幸，” 莫莉护士回答，一边把手放在我的下巴下，把我的脸抬起来。“你要照顾好自己，好吗？” 我点了点头，咕哝着说了声“谢谢你”。回家的整段路，我和妈妈都抱着走。我没有告诉她发生了什么事，后来当她问我感觉好些了没有，是否能放学后去讨糖时，我说了不。这让她很担心，因为她知道我平时有多么喜欢讨糖。

vocab.ex: "Thank you for your help." "My pleasure."
She tilted her face up to feel the sunshine.
It was nice seeing you! Take care of yourself.
The newly-engaged couple hug-walked through the park.
After a week of rest, he finally felt well enough to go back to work.

vocab.mean: （万圣节）不给糖就捣蛋的活动
vocab.ex: The children dressed in costumes and went trick-or-treating around the neighborhood.

gram.name: 创造性复合动词
gram.function: 通过将两个独立的动作（'hug' 和 'walk'）组合成一个新词 'hug-walked'，作者简洁而生动地描绘了一个充满温情和保护的画面，传达了母子间亲密的关系。

example.en: The couple laugh-talked all through dinner.
example.cn: 那对情侣在整个晚餐期间都边笑边聊。

gram.constraints: 是一种文学性的、非标准的构词法，用于增强描述效果。

paras.en: I heard her say to Dad on the phone: ". . . He doesn't even have the energy to go trick-or-treating. . . . No, no fever at all . . . Well, I will if he doesn't feel better by tomorrow. . . . I know, poor thing . . . Imagine his missing Halloween."
paras.cn: 我听到她在电话里对爸爸说：“……他甚至没有精力去讨糖了。……不，一点也没发烧……嗯，如果他明天还不好转，我会的。……我知道，可怜的孩子……想象一下他错过了万圣节。”

vocab.ex: After a long week at work, I barely have the energy to cook dinner.
The child has a high fever and needs to see a doctor.
The little bird fell out of its nest. Poor thing!
Can you imagine a world without music?

gram.name: 省略号（用于转述听到的对话）
gram.function: 用于表示读者（和主角）只听到了对话的片段，而不是完整的交谈内容。这种技巧创造了一种真实感，模仿了我们现实生活中偷听或无意中听到谈话的体验。

example.en: I walked past their door and heard, "...not sure what to do... maybe tomorrow..."
example.cn: 我走过他们的门，听到“……不确定该怎么办……也许明天……”

gram.constraints: 是表现片断信息的有效叙事手法。

paras.en: I got out of going to school the next day, too, which was Friday. So I had the whole weekend to think about everything. I was pretty sure I would never go back to school again.
paras.cn: 第二天，也就是周五，我也躲过了没去上学。所以我有整个周末来思考一切。我相当确定我再也不会回学校了。

vocab.ex: He tried to get out of doing his chores by pretending to be sick.
We spent the whole weekend cleaning the garage.
I'm pretty sure I locked the door, but I'll go back and check.
After visiting her family, it was time to go back home.

gram.name: 结论性意图陈述
gram.pattern: A strong, declarative sentence at the end of a chapter/section.
gram.function: 在一段充满情感和不确定性的叙述之后，以一个非常坚定、明确的陈述句结尾，可以创造出一种强烈的结论感和戏剧性。'I was pretty sure I would never go back to school again' 宣告了主角在经历创伤后做出的重大决定，为故事设置了悬念。

example.en: She looked at the closed door one last time. She knew she would never return.
example.cn: 她最后看了一眼那扇关着的门。她知道她再也不会回来了。

gram.constraints: 是一种有效的章节收尾技巧。
